“A meeting was held between the state government and the Railway officials in which both the parties have agreed to take several steps to expedite the construction of the tracks. The in-principle approval is the outcome of the same. As far as some observations are concerned, the state government and the Railways will sort them out at the earliest,” he added.

Title: ‘Mob would have killed my official,’ says power dept executive engineer
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Strap: Anti-theft team attacked by villagers in UP's Bulandshahr, several critically injured

Meerut: An anti-theft team of the power department was attacked by local villagers in Bulandshahr’s Usmapur village after the team was returning from a checking drive on Friday morning. According to executive engineer Mahesh Updhyaya, it all began after the team reported theft at house of one Ajit Kumar.

When the theft case was pointed out by the team, Kumar became aggressive and misbehaved with the team. Another local resident also resisted to the checking drive and confronted the team. Later, when the team was returning after the drive, a mob of locals again confronted the team and allegedly attacked them with canes.

“Additional engineer Janaradan Yadav has sustained grievous injuries on his head and is currently admitted in a private hospital in critical condition. Several other officials have sustained injuries, including fractures. Had the PRD jawans at the spot not intervened, they [the mob] would have killed additional engineer Yadav,” executive engineer Upadhyay said.

According to sources, mob of cane wielding locals was assembled by two people who were reported for power theft. The team was attacked when it reached the location where it had parked its vehicle in the village.

Based on the complaint, police have registered an FIR under relevant sections against four named accused and 15 unidentified. Efforts are on to arrest the accused, police said. According to senior police officials, the attack on the raiding team was pre-planned.

“When the team at the spot tried to escape, they found the tyres of their vehicle were deflated and there was no fuel in the tank. Most of them had to abandon the vehicle and flee from the spot to save their lives,” Upadhyay added.

Title: Groom among 10 hurt in celebratory firing in Meerut
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: A wedding almost came close to be called off and at least 10 people landed in a hospital after two uncles of the bride opened fire in celebration in a Meerut village. The incident occurred on Wednesday night, which also led to a clash between the bride and groom’s families. The injured were rushed to a health centre and were later released after first-aid.

The marriage was solemnized after intervention from the elders. However, on Thursday evening, an FIR was filed by the groom’s side. The incident occurred in Kheri village near Daurala block of Meerut where Shubham Singh’s baraat reached bride’s house and during a ceremony shots were fired by the licensed weapons of bride’s uncles-- Naresh and Yashpal. This resulted in clashes between the two groups.

Daurala’s station officer Janak Singh Chauhan said, “FIR has been filed by the groom’s brother Nishant. It seems the accused were under influence of alcohol. Investigation is on.”

As of now, the two accused are absconding.

The use of weapons in weddings and election victory processions is rampant in western UP districts despite a high court order in 2012 restraining arms license holders of Uttar Pradesh from using weapons for celebratory firing.

“We have given strict orders to all police officials of the zone to act swiftly and strictly on these matters. Firstly, if anyone is found involved in celebratory firing, not only a case will be filed against him but his weapon will also be impounded, and within 24 hours cancellation of license will be done. Even the organizer of the event will not be spared in that situation and similar penalty will be slapped upon him,” said ADG Police Meerut zone, Prashant Kumar.

Title: Minus Army nod, anti-CAA rally changes starting point
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kannur: The Constitution protection rally — organized by various Muslim organizations under the banner of Constitution protection committee against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) — that was supposed to begin from St Michael’s school ground had to shift its starting point to Vilakkathara near Prabhat Junction after the Army denied permission on Friday.

Army officers said that the land belongs to Defence Security Corps and hence permission was denied. But organizers claimed that this was not intimated earlier and permission was denied as it was anti-CAA attended by one lakh persons.

Organizers said earlier there were no objections for using the ground for such rallies and even people used to park vehicles there and police too were unaware of the same. The Army also deployed its personnel well before the start of the programme, they added.

But, sources close to the Army said a decision was taken to not give the ground for programmes. Earlier, parades were held there in the morning. Later, people started using it as if it was an open ground, sources said.

Title: Students of KCB schools to make 4,000 saplings a month
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: The Khadki Cantonment Board will be roping in school students to prepare 4,000 saplings every month and distribute them among residents free of cost.

Pramod Singh, the chief executive officer of the Khadki Cantonment Board (KCB), said the drive would begin in the cantonment-run schools. He said, “There is an urgent need to increase the tree cover in the world to reduce the ill-effects of global warming and climate change. So, we shall be involving the students in preparing saplings.”

He said, “Every Saturday, the students will prepare a sapling. So, s/he will prepare four saplings a month and take care of them. Following this method, as many as 4,000 saplings will be prepared every month. These saplings will be later provided free of cost to the residents to plant in and around their homes and offices.”

Singh, an avid environmentalist, has a nursery for preparing saplings of indigenous species in his official bungalow. He said, “We gave 1,000 saplings free of cost to the Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) around a fortnight back for its tree plantation drive.”

Title: Kidnapped man returns with injuries
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Eluru: VLS Vijaya Kumar, whose kidnapping created a sensation in Bhimavaram town in East Godavari, has been found. His mother— Valavala Varalakshmi informed police that her son was found with severe injuries on his body on February 12.

On February 11, Varalakshmi lodged a complaint with the police alleging that her son had been kidnapped in Bheemili in Visakhapatnam district. Bhimavaram police lodged a zero FIR. The case was transferred to Bheemili police station.

Police say that Kumar had called his mother on February 8 telling her that he had been kidnapped and was being beaten up brutally.

The Bhimavaram police traced the phone number to Vijayawada and went there to trace the kidnappers. However, they found nothing. On February 12, the mother informed the police that her son had been found. The police admitted him to the local government hospital.

Sources allege that Vijaya Kumar is involved in betting and cockfights and owes money to several people. He was trying to evade his creditors and ran away to Hyderabad and then Bheemili.

Title: 70% of 51,000 new voters in final poll roll is youth
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Trichy: The final electoral roll of nine constituencies in Trichy district released by collector S Sivarasu on Friday shows an increasing trend of voters in the age group of 18 to 24 years enrolling as new voters. The district has a total of 22,97,106 voters including 11,18,900 male, 11,77,997 female and 209 transsexual, according to the list.

The number of voters has gone up by 49,251 after inclusion of 50,992 voters and deletion of 1,741 during the special summary revision between December 23 and January 22. Of the 50,992 voters, youngsters accounted for 70.50% or 35,950 voters. The data released by the district administration and the election department showed that 23,661 youngsters in the age group of 18 to 19 years and 12,289 in the age group of 20 to 24 years have enrolled as voters in the summary revision.

The officials attributed the increase to the election department’s efforts to enrol college students as voters through various awareness programmes like appointing college ambassadors and special camps. During the revision, the election department received a total of 65,372 applications for inclusion, deletion, correction and change of address. Of these, 62,066 applications were accepted after scrutiny. The department also gave a break-up of the deleted voters of 1,741 who included 564 dead, 820 migrated and 357 duplicate entry voters.

Among the nine constituencies, Srirangam remained on top with 3,04,335 voters and Lalgudi at the bottom with 2,14,516 voters. Female voters outnumbered males in all the constituencies with an overall increase of 59,097. The summary revision would continue to take place after the release of the final electoral roll – 2020, said the collector asking the people to apply for inclusion, deletion, correction and change of address at the respective office in their area or apply online via www.nvsp.in and mobile application ‘voters helpline’.

Title: Two house break-in cases reported in city
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Trichy: Two incidences of house break-in and a case of attention diversion were reported in Trichy on Thursday.

R Komalavalli, from Periya Milaguparai a 41-year-old tutor with a nursing institute had left for her work on Thursday. When she returned home, she found her house burgled.

Based on her complaint, the Cantonment police visited her house. It was found that the burglars had gained entry into the house by breaking open the front gate. The bureau was unlocked using its key and 17 sovereigns of gold ornaments and Rs 29,000 was looted. The total worth of the stolen valuables was Rs 1.09 lakh.

Similarly, the government hospital police got a burglary complaint from a Kumaran Nagar resident. According to the complaint of S Sridhar, 63 of Bankers colony in Kumaran Nagar, the burglars had gained entry into the house by breaking open the front grill gate and door lock. The burglars had looted six sovereigns of gold ornaments, Rs 3,000 cash and a camera worth Rs 47,000. The police had registered a case.

In rural Trichy, two men who posed as policemen took away a 60-year-old woman’s gold chain near D Nagar cut road near Thiruverumbur in Trichy on Thursday morning. The woman was identified as J Chandra of Malaikovil. A couple of men under the guise of police officer intercepted Chandra when she was on her way back home from a nearby temple. They cautioned the woman of chain-snatchers and advised her to keep her jewellery in her purse. The woman removed her chain and gave it to them to put it in the purse. Later when the woman checked the purse she found nothing and realized she was cheated. Based on her complaint, the Thiruverumbur police registered a case. tnn

Title: In heart of Delhi, choked artery causes severe pain
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Public Works Department claims that the stretch was recently repaired under its streetscaping plan

NEW DELHI: It’s a bumpy ride for some 50,000 commuters who travel daily between Supreme Court Metro station and Oberoi Flyover on the busy Mathura Road. While the entire length of 3.3km is riddled with potholes, the ongoing construction work near Pragati Maidan further reduces the width of the road. The entire journey, which should typically take less than 10 minutes, often lasts nearly half an hour, resulting in frayed tempers.

Public Works Department claims that the stretch was recently repaired under its streetscaping plan and the heavy traffic volume is to blame for its poor condition. A more plausible explanation may be the huge number of trucks that come in at night carrying materials for the Pragati Maidan redevelopment project. “Because the construction work is on, repairing big potholes will further hinder traffic movement. It’s difficult to repair the road because many trucks use it at night. We are waiting to get a clear window so that we can repair all potholes at one go,” said a PWD official who didn’t want to be named.

TOI did a reality check on Friday and found potholes at almost every 50 metres. The trouble started from Pragati Maidan Gate No. 5 where a massive dent on the road greeted us. A vendor stationed there told us that two-wheelers losing their balance at the spot wasn’t an uncommon sight. “The situation is worse during monsoon. The road is repaired once in a while, but is damaged very quickly,” he said.

Barely metres ahead, the road turned slightly towards the left due to underpasses being constructed there. These U-turns are a part of the Pragati Maidan redevelopment plan. The left turn started with a pothole and things didn’t get better until one came back to the main road. It was a crawl till DPS (Mathura Road), with there being many potholes even near the upscale Sundar Nagar.

Kuldeep Singh, a regular commuter, told us: “There are potholes all along the stretch. First, the width of the roads is uneven, which causes bottlenecks, especially during the peak hours. Who will believe that this is south Delhi?”

Supreme Court had recently taken cognisance of the dangers posed by pothole-filled roads. It had remarked that the death of nearly 15,000 people in road accidents in the past five years across the country due to potholes was probably higher than those killed on the border, or by terrorists. The deaths indicated that the authorities were not maintaining the roads properly, the court had said.

While PWD officials expressed helplessness in finding a solution to the problem, Delhi Metro, which has had been involved in massive construction activity across the city in the past two decades, seems to have cracked the code. The challenges faced by DMRC are similar, but it has usually managed to keep the roads in good shape. A senior DMRC official explained: “We barricade the areas where work is on. If there are any potholes, we fill them overnight. It just takes a couple of hours.”

Title: Muslim outfits in Trichy stage protest against Chennai police
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Trichy: Muslim outfits staged protests in Palakkarai, Anna Nagar link road and head post office in Trichy city on Friday night, against the police action on those protesting against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) in Washermenpet in Chennai earlier. They also demanded the release of those arrested in the Chennai protest.

More than 100 protesters each sat on the road in the three areas around 10pm as soon as news about the clash between the police and the protesters in Chennai broke out. They raised slogans against the police for attacking the protesters and arresting them. Commissioner of police, Trichy city V Varadharaju held talks with the protesters near head post office, following which they dispersed. Police personnel deployed near Anna Nagar link road where the massive protest for jallikattu was held few years back, attempted to pacify the protesters. The protests came to an end in all three places after the police pacified them. Protests were staged by Muslim outfits at Goripalayam, Nelpettai, Villapuram Market and Mohaboobpalayam in Madurai city condemning the police excesses in Chennai. The protests lasted about 30 minutes after which they dispersed. Hundreds took part in similar protests in Ramanathapuram, Tuticorin and a few other places and have warned they will resume on Saturday.

Title: This Rs 1 note is worth a million dollars!
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

caption

Vadodara: The Indian rupee may have slipped against US dollar, but one particular currency note of that denomination in possession of a Gujarati antique dealer is truly worth a million dollars.

Tejpal Shah, a numismatist from Vadodara, has a collection of unique one rupee notes, among which one carries US president Donald Trump’s birth date. The series of the currency note 08N 140646 — an uncanny match to Trump’s birth date and year — June 14, 1946!

Owner of the unique note has something to trump about literally, which he wishes to do when Trump comes to Gujarat on February 24 along with PM Narendra Modi. Shah wants the unique currency note to be displayed at Motera stadium.

“I had been in possession of this currency note for the past two decades. When Trump announced his visit to India, I immediately took out my collection and found this significant note,” 57-year-old Shah told TOI.

In fact, Shah also has another one rupee note whose series matches with Modi’s birth date and year, 17-9-1950. “It is mere coincidence that I have such unique currency notes that had been printed in 1988,” Shah said.

“I frequent flea markets as well as coin and currency note market,” said Shah, when asked how he managed to get these unique currency notes. He said that he went to one such market in Mumbai around 20 years ago and laid his hands on the birthday bundle of notes. My collection has 100 currency notes of one rupee in the same series with same inset. Who would have thought that someday these notes would become unique for its similarities to the birth dates of two powerful political leaders?”

An engineering graduate, Shah’s interest in antique artefacts as well as numismatics is a 25 year old story. “It began as a hobby and soon I accumulated a good collection. I also have notes with number series matching birth dates of some popular Bollywood stars too,” Shah added.

Title: Kerala: Chief secretary suspects leak of CAG report
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Tom Jose

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Levelling a veiled and serious attack against accountant general S Sunilraj, the state government finally responded to allegations levelled in the CAG audit report that was tabled in the assembly on Wednesday. Chief secretary Tom Jose, in a statement issued on Friday night, alleged that the details of CAG report might have been leaked before the report was submitted in the assembly.

“There are doubts about details of CAG report getting leaked before the report was tabled in the assembly. Normally, media and others access such reports after they are tabled in the assembly. Now, doubts have risen that a few details of the report have been leaked out,” the CS said. Though he didn’t clarify about the leaking of crucial info, which is a serious breach of the confidential nature of the report, his statement was strikingly similar to the allegation levelled by CPM mouthpiece Deshabhimani on Friday. “There is information that the report had been leaked to some UDF centres before being tabled in the assembly,” the report published in Desbhabhimani said.

Jose said the criticism against various departments in the audit report would be examined by the departments concerned and replies would be furnished. “The public accounts committee comprising legislators will examine the report. The report examines audits for 2013 to 2018 in various departments during the tenure of two governments,” he said. It is learned that the PAC has initiated action on the report. Notices to all departments mentioned in the report would be issued soon and the PAC will meet once the clarifications from the departments are received.

The chief secretary also criticised the practice of putting a few officials in the dock based on the remarks in the audit report. “It is the constitutional responsibility of the CAG to refer the audit details to the assembly and Parliament. But, it is not a good precedent to blame a particular official based on the findings in the report. There are certain procedures for examining the report and addressing the issues raised. Attempts to accuse somebody and put them under media trail without waiting for the due process is a breach of democratic courtesy,” he added.

A meeting of CPM state secretariat held here on Friday is also learned to have decided to ignore the controversy triggered by the CAG report.

Title: Need for setting up HC benches to be voiced in conference
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nashik: Around 3,500 lawyers from across the state and the neighbouring state of Goa have registered for the State Lawyers Conference , 2020 to be held in Nashik over the weekend.

President of Nashik Bar Association Nitin Thakare said that 1,000 more lawyers were expected to attend the conference. “The theme of the conference is ‘marching towards speedy modern judiciary’. While the lawyers at the convention will brainstorm various ways and means to achieve the aim of a speedy and modern judiciary system, the need for additional courts and infrastructure will also be given expression at the conference,” said Thakare.

“Since Chief justice of India Sharad Bobde will be attending the state-level conference, lawyers will be requesting him to consider their demand of setting up a bench of the high court at every revenue head quarter and benches of the Supreme Court in Mumbai, Chennai and Kolkata,” said Thakare.

Citing that there were a pile of cases pending in many courts, Thakare said that there were more than 28,000 pending cases in Nashik alone.

Chairman of the Bar Council of Maharashtra and Goa Avinash Bhide said, “Lawyers will think of ways in which the information technology and social media can be used for speedy disposal of cases.”

Methods like using Whatsapp for sending summons to the concerned people instead of issuing them physically, video recording evidence when submitted in court, setting up CCTV cameras in court halls are among a host of factors that would be discussed at length at the convention, said Bhide.

Meanwhile, chief minister Uddhav Thackeray and Supreme court Justice Bhushan Gavai will lay the foundation stone of a new court building on Sunday morning.

The new court building will have seven floors, while an additional four-storey building will be constructed for parking vehicles. Both the buildings will be constructed at an estimated cost of Rs 172 crore.

Title: Probe on into gang snatching phones from PG students at gun-point
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Trichy: The city police are probing the incident in which five students of a private college were allegedly robbed of their expensive mobile phones by a gang which arrived in two cars around midnight on Thursday. The postgraduate students said they were heading to the room of one of their mates by car when the incident happened near the government circuit house.

Cantonment police launched an inquiry with the five students on Thursday night itself. Four of the students were staying in the college hostel while one was residing outside. All of them are natives of Kerala staying in Trichy for studies. The students said they were on their way to the room of one of the students near Sengulam colony around 2 am. As their car neared circuit house, six people arrived in two cars and intercepted them.

The students told the police that the gang snatched two high value mobile phones from them by pointing an airgun. The students claimed that the gang sprayed some liquid on their faces and fled in their cars. The police team recovered some of the pellets of the gun at the spot. With the students giving contradictory statements, city police commissioner V Varadharaju inquired with the students in the morning on Friday.

Later, the police managed to find the five students roaming near Trichy international airport around 11pm after parking their car on Wireless Road for nearly an hour, after which they left the airport. When asked why they visited the airport so late at night, some of them replied that they went there to see the flights.

Unwilling to buy the theory, the officials launched a probe into the incident suspecting the activities of the students. The officials were suspicious as to why the gang should target only those students by following them in cars to snatch mobile phones. The students were initially reluctant to file a complaint but agreed later in the evening. Police said they were likely to register a case in Cantonment police in the night.

Title: Eng medium move violates RTE Act guidelines, HC told
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Vijayawada: The high court on Friday reserved judgment in the public interest litigation (PIL) petitions moved challenging the state government’s decision to implement English medium in all government schools right from the primary level.

Explaining its stand on the issue, the Union government told the high court that the state government’s decision is in violation of the provisions of Right to Education (RTE) Act.

Arguing on behalf of the Union government, assistant solicitor general B Krishna Mohan told the court that according to RTE Act, the preferred medium of education should be the mother tongue. He said the implementation of compulsory English medium is contrary to the central Act.

BJP chief spokesperson of Andhra Pradesh Srinivas Sudhish Rambhotla and Dr Guntupalli Srinivas moved separate PILs challenging the implementation of English medium from primary level. They also argued that the state government’s decision is illegal and in violation of RTE Act and various judgments given by the Supreme Court in the past.

The state government, on the other hand, justified the move saying that the decision was taken after demands from the parents to give quality education to children from poor economic background. The state government told the high court that opinions were sought from parent committees of more than 47,000 schools and that about 97 per cent of committees were in favour of English medium.

Those who moved implead petitions in support of the state government’s decision have also argued that the implementation of English medium would help children from marginalised sections of the society in the present competitive world. They argued that poor people cannot afford to send their children to private schools and English medium teaching in government schools was a way of ensuring social justice.

After hearing arguments from all sides, the high court bench headed by Chief Justice JK Maheswari and Justice Ninala Jayasurya reserved the judgment.

Title: Bank branch, 2 houses burgled in Ambad
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nashik: Three cases of burglaries, including one in a bank branch, were reported from different parts of Ambad since January 28, two of them on February 12, and cash and other articles worth Rs 1.75 lakh were stolen.

According to police, a housed was burgled in the Murari Nagar area along Ambad Link Road around 11 am on Wednesday. The complainant had locked the house and gone out when someone broke the lock and gained entry. A gold chain worth Rs 1.10 lakh was stolen after breaking the cupboard in the house.

Police said that they were checking if they could locate any CCTV cameras in the area and see if the burglar has been captured in it.

In the other case, also on Wednesday, the branch of a small finance bank in the Cidco area was targeted around 7 pm. Police said entry was gained into the bank after breaking the main door and Rs 46,000 was stolen from the safe, which was also broken open.

For the past two years, police have been appealing to banks to ensure that they have security guards and CCTV cameras on their premises and also at ATMs. However, the appeals have been falling on deaf ears of many financial institutions, said police.

In another case, garments and a gas cutter worth Rs 12,000 were stolen from a closed house at Hegdewar Chowk in the Cidco area. Police said that the lock was broken with the help of some instrument and articles taken away.

Title: Thousands to be taken for Feb 24 Motera event
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Tight security outside Motera stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday

Vadodara: The city may not figure even remotely in the itinerary of US President Donald Trump, but officials as well as the city unit of the BJP have their job cut out for the visit.

They are busy ensuring that a handsome crowd remains present at the Motera Stadium during the event there.

The city unit of the BJP has set a target of sending 10,000 persons to the event during Trump’s visit.

Party functionaries from the city level to those in the wards have been assigned responsibilities to ensure that the target is met.

Vadodara MP and city BJP president held a meeting of BJP functionaries and elected representatives on Wednesday night to chart out the strategy for the event.

Functionaries of the party have also said that the visit of those keen on attending the event will also be facilitated by the party that will be arranging buses. The Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) and the district administration have also started efforts towards arrangements to take people to the event.

The VMC top brass also held a meeting to discuss details of preparations in this direction. Officials have been asked to gather details of those wishing to attend the event and prepare a list with phone numbers.

VMC deputy commissioner S K Patel has been summoned to Ahmedabad by the state government for preparations for the visit.

Title: Plea to post technicians to handle dialysis equipment at govt hosps
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

The Madras high court has issued notice to the state government on a public interest litigation (PIL) seeking to appoint technicians to handle dialysis equipment at all the government hospitals in the state.

In his petition, K Pushpavanam, a resident of Madurai, stated that as per the guidelines, dialysis equipment should be handled by a qualified technician. There should be one qualified technician to handle three machines, however, an RTI report reveals that only seven dialysis technicians are appointed in government hospitals and that too on temporary basis.

If the dialysis machines are handled by unqualified people, then it poses a threat to the patients who are undergoing dialysis at the hospitals as there are chances of the patients getting transmission of Hepatitis B and Hepatitis C. Due to improper handling of the equipment, nearly 20 people who underwent dialysis at the Stanley Medical College at Chennai were affected with Hepatitis C in 2014.

Hence, the petitioner moved the high court Madurai bench seeking for a direction to appoint technicians to handle dialysis equipments and to install new dialysis units in all the government hospitals in the state. The petitioner also sought for a direction to administer vaccination for Hepatitis B and Hepatitis C for all dialysis patients on a regular basis.

Hearing the plea, a division bench of justice M Duraiswamy and justice T Ravindran issued notice to the state government and adjourned the case to a further date for hearing.

Title: Appoint DSP rank officer to probe case closed as ‘mistake of fact’: HC
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Madurai: Expressing shock at the final report (charge-sheet) filed by the police with regard to closing a case as ‘mistake of fact’, the Madras high court has directed the Pudukottai superintendent of police (SP) to appoint an officer at the rank of DSP to conduct investigation into a case where few people were assaulted during a dispute while conducting a temple festival at Pudukottai in 2016.

Justice G R Swaminathan passed the order on a plea moved by G Kanagaraj seeking to transfer the case to CB-CID or any other competent agency.

The judge observed that the petitioner is the complainant in the case which was registered by the Keeramangalam police station in Pudukottai district. As many as 10 people have been named in the FIR. The judge noted that the petitioner had filed this petition as he expressed dissatisfaction over the manner in which the investigation was conducted.

When the matter was taken up for final disposal, the government advocate submitted that the inspector of police had already filed a final report closing the case as ‘mistake of fact’ and a copy had been served to the petitioner. The government advocate also mentioned that the final report is yet to be taken on file by the jurisdictional magistrate.

The judge observed that the petitioner’s counsel contended that during village meeting which was convened over the dispute in conducting temple festival in 2016, the people named in the FIR brutally assaulted the petitioner and others in which the petitioner suffered a fracture on his left hand.

On perusal of the discharge summary which has been enclosed, the judge said that the petitioner was an inpatient at the government hospital at Pudukottai for 30 days and several others also suffered injuries in this incident. The judge noted that the materials on record clearly indicate that the petitioner and others were brutally assaulted.

The judge observed, “I am shocked that despite these overwhelming materials on record, the inspector of police of Keeramangalam police station had dared to file the final report closing the case as ‘mistake of fact’.”

Title: Preservation of archives in progress: Kavalekar
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Margao: The directorate of archives and archaeology has taken steps to conserve archival records by in-house digitisation and scientific preservation.

Minister for archives and archaeology Chandrakant Kavalekar recently said that in 2018-19, 20,688 folios comprising 147 volumes were conserved in-house, while 30,000 folios— approximately 150 volumes of public records— were scientifically conserved through outsourcing.

“In 2019-20, 19,896 acidic/brittle/fragmented folios in nature of land records, archival volumes, notorial deed records, inventory files, etc, comprising 195 volumes were repaired in-house and conservation of 30,000 folios of the record series ‘Monsoon Correspondence’ has been outsourced and is in progress,” Kavalekar said.

The birth and death (teor) records from the years 1914-1970 from all taluka offices of the Civil Registrar cum Sub Registrar were digitised by May 2012 and these are uploaded on the Goa online portal, the House was informed.

The digitised data, on computers, is also shown to the public in the servicing area of the directorate’s head office at Mala and annexe office at Altinho.

Title: Will protest against CAA till it is rolled back: Thamimum Ansari
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Trichy: Manithaneya Jananayaga Katchi MLA Thamimun Ansari has said peaceful protests would continue against the citizenship amendment act (CAA) until it is rolled back and there will be no compromise on it. He was speaking at Desam Kaapom (Let’s save the nation) rally organised by Jamatul Ulama at the Ulavar Santhai ground on Friday. He said they were ready to take the protest till 2024 till the tenure of the current union government comes to an end.

T Velmurugan from Tamilaga Valvurimai Katchi said the chief minister should pass a resolution in this assembly session against CAA-NRC-NPR as eleven other states have done. “The AIADMK will pay heavily in the upcoming assembly election for their stand in favour of CAA,” he said.

The AIADMK government must also pass a resolution seeking release of all the seven life convicts in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case and send it to governor Bawarilal Purohit. “If he refuses, the government must urge the centre to take him back for refusing to acknowledge the state assembly resolution,” he added.

Title: Delhi housing scam: Three arrested for duping 4,000 of Rs 400 crore
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

The scamsters attracted homebuyers for investment in lucrative DDA housing schemes through SMS or online adver... Read More

NEW DELHI: Three owners of a realty firm were arrested by Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Delhi Police for duping scores of buyers through a housing scam in which they had offered Delhi Development Authority (DDA) flats at Dwarka under a central government scheme.

The scam was first reported by TOI after which a Special Investigation Team was formed to probe the case. Joint commissioner (EOW) OP Mishra said that the accused — Satender Maan, Pradeep Shehrawat and Subhash Chand — were found to be senior office-bearers of Revanta Multi State CGHS Ltd, which was used to put out the advertisements regarding the scam.

The scamsters attracted homebuyers for investment in lucrative DDA housing schemes through SMS or online advertisements. Potential buyers were asked to pay “development charge” to apply in a lucky draw for the flats. However, they were neither allotted a flat nor refunded the money.

The probe found that approximately Rs 400 crore was collected from 3,997 investors in the name of providing housing under DDA’s land pooling policy in Dwarka.

“The land was purchased at very high rates, reaching up to Rs 10 crore per acre against the circle rate of Rs 53 lakh. Land facilitation agencies were incorporated and direct deals with farmers were avoided to siphon off approximately Rs 115 crore,” said Mishra.

During interrogation, the accused said that they posed as authorised agents offering flats on behalf of DDA. It was found that DDA had never given authorisation to their firm to issue advertisements.

Police have registered 16 more cases against builders found cheating people in the name of handing them DDA flats.

An inquiry into the scam was started after police received a complaint from Rewant Kumar Mishra, a resident of Sangam Vihar. Subsequently, an FIR was lodged for criminal conspiracy, criminal breach of trust and fraud against Revanta Multi State CGHS Ltd located in Sector 23 Dwarka.

Mishra told police that in 2015, he had come across an advertisement that the company was going to build residential flats through land pooling in Dwarka’s L-Zone. A separate inquiry was also conducted by DDA and the report was submitted to police.

Title: SC panel team visits Tolewal to look into Dalit water issue
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Sangrur: Two days after a local contractor disconnected the water supply to Dalits of Tolewal village over some pending dues, a team of Punjab State Scheduled Castes Commission led by member Poonam Kangra visited the affected village on Friday. The team also directed the district administration to file a detailed report into the incident.

Kangra, who interacted with the villagers, assured them that action would be taken against those found guilty of disconnecting the water supply. She also heard other problems of the locals and directed the district administration officials to look into the matter. The residents alleged that they had been facing water supply problems for the last four months and informed Kangra that as they could not even afford submersible motors as they were now left without any water for their daily needs.

Officials of the district administration said local contractors had disconnected the water connection over some pending dues. The connection was restored the moment they came to know of it, deputy commissioner Ghanshyam Thori said.

However, the locals alleged that the water supply had been stopped by some members of upper caste families.

Dalits and upper caste families in the village have been at loggerheads for the last many years at Tolewal village. In July last year, the two communities had clashed over the auctioning of village common land.

Title: Pudukottai farmers hail fund allocation for river linking
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Trichy: Farmers and locals in Pudukottai district celebrated on Friday as soon as deputy chief minister O Paneerselvam announced the allocation of Rs 700 crore in the first phase for the Cauvery-Vaigai-Gundar river linking project in the assembly.

The budgetary allocation on Friday sets stage for the commencement of a project, which is said to be over a century-old demand. Cauvery-Vaigai-Gundar river linking project involves the construction of 255.60 km long canal from Mayanur in Karur district to link Cauvery with Vaigai.

The link canal will run through the districts of Karur, Pudukottai and Trichy, Pudukottai, Sivagangai, Ramanathapuram and Virudhunagar districts. Gundar river flows in Virudhunagar and Ramanathapuram districts.

However, Pudukottai will benefit the most from the project. A 119-km-long canal connecting Cauvery to south Vellar estuary will bring water to 760 tanks in Pudukkottai district thereby helping to irrigate 20,249 hectares of agriculture land. The project will also benefit over 100 villages in 12 taluks of Pudukottai district.

Even before the allocation of funds for the project, health minister C Vijaya Baskar organized a meeting on Wednesday thanking chief minister Edappadi k Palaniswami for announcing the project last year.

Farmers along with locals gathered in Ulavar Santhai to distribute sweets apart from bus stands and markets to celebrate the announcement. With no proper source of water for farmers in Pudukottai district, the announcement has been historic, said S Ayyappan, a farmer.

Title: Parked bike stolen, case filed
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nashik: The Nashik Road police have registered a case of theft against an unidentified person for allegedly stealing a bike parked in front of a residential society in Chiremara area of Nashik Road.

A complaint in this regard was filed by the owner of the bike.

Police said that the bike owner had parked his vehicle in the said area on February 12 at about 11:30 pm after returning from work. However, on the next day, when he went to the spot, he found that his bike was missing.

“Next day, in the morning when the complainant went to take the spot to take his bike, it was missing. We suspect that someone used a duplicate key to unlock the vehicle before fleeing with it,” police officials investigating the case said.

“We are investigating the case,” said police.

Title: 4 of family dead as car rams tanker
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

The tanker carrying milk which the car rammed

Vijayawada: In a horrific accident , four persons belonging to the same family died, while two others suffered grievous injuries, after the car they were in lost control and rammed a vehicle carrying milk , on NH16 near Pannangadu village of Tada mandal in Nellore district on Friday morning.

The deceased were identified as Anu Selvi, Vijaya Lakshmi, Riyan Shari, and Namitha, all residents of Ongole town in Prakasam district. According to Tada police station sub-inspector Venu, the incident happened at around 8.15 am. The SI explained that the speeding car lost control while overtaking another vehicle and rammed the vehicle carrying milk, which was travelling slowly on the left lane.

Three persons died on the spot while another woman—Namitha—died while being taken to the hospital. Upon receiving the information, the police reached the spot and recovered the bodies from the wreckage.

The police said that the injured have been shifted to Nellore Government Hospital for treatment, where their condition is said to be stable. Meanwhile, the deceased were shifted to the mortuary for post-mortem.

A case under section 304A of IPC (causing death due to negligence) was registered at Tada police station. Further investigation is still on.

Title: Two nabbed after bid to rob Tasmac staff at gun-point
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Trichy: Trichy rural police arrested two people for attempting to rob Tasmac employees at gun point near Thiruverumbur on Thursday. A pistol and two rounds of bullets were seized from the two who are natives of Tirunelveli district and their bike was also confiscated.

Thuvakudi police arrested M Dison alias Sebastian Dias, 28, of Mattapuram near Nanguneri and M Sri Murugan of Thisaiyanvilai. The police pinned them down during a vehicle check at Thuvakudi on Thursday morning. The duo came on a bike to a Tasmac shop at Anna roundabout near Thuvakudi around 11.30 pm on Wednesday with Sri Murugan riding pillion. Tasmac employees T Arunagiri and K Sugumar were about to start their bike to go home when Dison and Murugan intercepted them and asked for liquor. The employees replied that the shop was closed. The next moment, the pillion rider took out a pistol from his bag and pointed at them demanding the cash in their bag. Police said they were under the impression that the employees had the day’s collection in the bag.

Seeing this, shop supervisor N S Murugadass came running while the two employees also screamed for help even as Sri Murugan threatened to shoot them. The employees however opened the bag and showed them. Since there was no cash in it, the duo left the place. Murugadass lodged a complaint with Thuvakudi police on Thursday. The police team led by inspector Gandhimathi conducted a vehicle check and intercepted two men on a bike on suspicion. Gandhimathi said on Friday that both of them were involved in various offences. While Dison was notorious for robbing Tasmac employees, Sri Murugan was involved in a murder case also. Both of them were released from prison two weeks ago. The pistol used by them was country-made, said to have been bought from Uttar Pradesh.

Title: After TOI report, KMF deposits money to CMDRF
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kochi: The proceeds from the ticket sales of the musical event ‘Karuna’ were deposited to the Chief Minister’s Distress Relief Fund (CMDRF) on Friday, programme organizer Kochi Music Foundation (KMF) said.

KMF made the announcement on its Facebook page late on Friday after TOI published a report ‘Karuna was a hit but where is the money?’

The report said the KMF had not remitted the proceeds from the star-studded relief fund-raising event to the CMDRF. The event was held at the Regional Sports Centre’s Rajiv Gandhi Indoor Stadium here on November 1, 2019.

The Facebook post, “by Bijibal and Shahabaz Aman for KMF”, said the proceeds from the sale of tickets were Rs 6,22,000, after deducting GST. This amount was deposited to the CMDRF, the post said, adding that the expenses for conducting the event was Rs 23 lakh. Incidentally, tickets were priced in the range of Rs 500 to Rs 2,000.

The post also mentioned that the artistes had performed for free at the full-house event and the venue was also given free of cost.

The stadium with a playing area of 20,000 sqft, has a capacity to seat 10,000 people, according to the RSC’s website.

The KMF also said it had requested the district collector time till March 31 to deposit the money to the CMDRF.

Responding to TOI over WhatsApp on Thursday, Bijibal had said the money would be remitted to the relief fund before March 31.

Detailing the delay, in Friday’s Facebook post — the previous one was on November 4, 2019, which said that ‘Karuna’ was “a success beyond our expectation” — KMF said it was in talks with a few media houses to market the edited content of the event, but nothing materialized. Also, political issues of national importance such as CAA, NRC and NPR demanded priority attention and that, too, affected KMF’s plans, the post said, adding that the current criticism against it was triggered by “divisive forces,” enraged over the participation of Foundation members in anti-CAA protests.

Title: Collegiate edu official sent on forced leave
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Trichy: Regional joint director of collegiate education (RJDCE) S Usha was sent on forced leave on Friday following complaints of physically assaulting her subordinates. Director of collegiate education (DCE) in-charge C Jothi Venkateswaran passed the order based on written complaints from employees in this regard.

On Thursday, two women employees had accused Usha of physically assaulting them after finding fault with their work. One of them, a stenographer in the office, was slapped by her on her back for making a spelling mistake. The woman was so traumatised that she had to be admitted to hospital after the incident. The other woman alleged that she was slapped by Usha when she requested her to process a file that had come from one of the aided colleges in the city.

Members of ACTA protested in front of the RJDCE office on Friday against the incidents demanding that the higher education secretary sack Usha. ACTA general secretary S Sahaya Sathish said Usha is incapable of continuing as RJDCE as only people who lose their mental balance can physically assault subordinates. She had insulted many teaching staff of aided colleges in the past. “A mere forced leave or transfer to other regional joint director office will make the staff in that office vulnerable to such attacks. Therefore, we seek her termination from service,” said Sathish.

Title: Delhi: Gang tries to illegally encash Rs 12 crore from PNB, 10 arrested
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Police are probing whether the copy of the cheque submitted to the PNB branch was genuine or not (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Ten people were arrested in Karol Bagh after a gang tried to fraudulently withdraw Rs 12 crore from Punjab National Bank in the name of an NGO. The mastermind of the racket used a cheque of Everest Bank in Nepal that has a collaboration with PNB to transfer the money to the NGO’s account.

A police probe revealed that the gang had managed to get access to the Nepal-based bank’s secured vaults and get the cheque that was used for the transaction.

Additional CP (central) Mandeep Singh Randhawa said that they had received a complaint regarding the fraud from the branch manager of PNB at Karol Bagh. The huge amount involved in the transaction and interaction with the accused had raised doubts in the manager’s mind.

A team led by SHO Maninder Singh was subsequently formed to probe the source of the cheque. It was found that two men, Abhishek Kumar and Ashok Panwar, had gone to the bank to deposit the cheque. “We interrogated the two men and found that the cheque was handed over to them by another person named Kamal. A further probe revealed that it had changed many hands. Each of the person claimed that they were promised Rs one crore from the share amount,” added Randhawa.

The cops tracked down six other people identified as Kul Bhushan, Lokender Rao, Amit Markal, Abdul Kadir, Jyotika Bhonsale and Shravan Yadav to finally reach the mastermind, Prem Narayan Pandey.

Pandey had managed to get the secured account of Everest Bank. The Nepal-based bank had opened an account in its name at the PNB in Karol Bagh branch. Pandey decided to dupe it using a cheque he is suspected to have stolen from the Everest Bank headquarters. Police are probing whether the copy of the cheque submitted to the PNB branch was genuine or not.

Cops have registered a case of forgery and cheating. The authorities concerned in Nepal have been informed.

Title: Karnataka: 51 MoUs worth Rs 72,000 crore signed; jobs for 90,000 people likely
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

HUBBALLI: Invest Karnataka Hubballi Conference, which was conducted on Friday to attract investors to invest in tier-II and III cities in north Karnataka, ended on a positive note.

The daylong meet witnessed a good number of investors from across India, including over 1,500 business delegates from 50 companies.

Prominent companies like Rajesh Exports, Sanali Energy, Bhagiratha Chemicals, HPC, IOC, Renew Power, Gujarath Ambuja, KLE Society, Dodla Dairy, NATCAP, and other companies signed memoranda of understanding with the state government to implement projects worth Rs 72,000 crore in north Karantaka region. It is expected to generate employment for 90,000 people from the region.

Rajesh Exports Ltd of east Bengaluru has proposed to set up plat of manufacturing of electric vehicles and lithiu-ion cells and batteries by investing Rs 50,000 crore to create employment for 1,000 people in Dharwad, Sanali Power Pvt of Hyderabad has proposed to invest Rs 4,800 crore to start hybrid wind and solar power project in Davanagere, and it is proposed to create jobs for 2,100 people, Natcap Power Pvt Ltd of Delhi has proposed to invest Rs 3,000 crore to set plant of waste to energy MSW and biomass conversion to fuel and electricity in Hubballi to create jobs for 100 people.

Jettwings Aerospace and Aviation (P) Ltd of Guwahati will invest Rs 2,060 crore in Dahrwad to set up Jettwings Flight Training Academay and Aviation Training School to create employment for 2,520 people, Ayana Renewable Power Pvt Lt iof Bengaluru to invest Rs 3,000 crore in Hubballi to start solar/ wind/ hybrid power project and to create 250 jobs, Savson Distil Pvt Ltd to invest Rs 122 crore in Kokatanur village of Belagavi district, KLE Education Society to invest Rs 600 crore in Belagavi, Indian Oil Corporation to invest Rs 500 in Chitradurga to develop POL Terminal in central Karnataka, Dodla Dairy Ltd to invest Rs 60 crore in Belagavi for dairy-processing unit, Ashok Iron Works to invest Rs 300 crore in Udyambag in Bealgavi for expansion of foundry, Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd of Mumbai to invest Rs 680 in Hassan, Tumkuru and Chitradurga.

This apart, pharma companies, including Bhagiradha Chemicals and Industries Ltd, Hari Pharma, Indur Life Sciences Pvt Ltd, Jet Life Sciences of Hyderabad, Adarsha Pharmaceutical Industry of Kalaburagi to invest Rs 345 crore, Rs 16 crore, Rs 16 crore, Rs 19.50 crore, and Rs 40 crore, respectively, in Kadechur Industrial Area of Yadgir.

Jagadish Shettar , large and medium-scale industries ministers, said the meet was a success with 51 MoUs worth Rs 72,000 crore being signed. “Many investors from other states have shown interest to invest in north Karanaka region. We are hopeful that at least 80% of MoUs will be implemented. The government has promised all kinds of support and facilities to investors to start their companies in the region. Seeing the response to this meet, we are also holding investors’ meeting in Belagavi, Vijaypuara, Raichur, Kalaburagi and other parts of the region in future,” he added.

Title: 2 youths killed, 1 hurt in bike-truck collision
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nashik: Two youths were killed and one was critically injured when the bike they were travelling in was knocked down by a speeding truck in the Nashik Road area on Friday afternoon.

Adarsh Rohidas Karad (18) and Akash Gavali (22), both residents of Vijay Nagar near Chehedi pumping, Nashik Road, died on the spot. Dnyanesh Balu Kedare (24), a resident of Nashik Road, was admitted to Nashik Road Bytco hospital.

Senior inspector at Nashik Road police station (first name) Bijli said that a truck was speeding on the road towards Chehedi pumping Kharjul Mala, opposite Gajanan park, close to the Nashik-Pune highway. After running over the bike, the truck driver fled the scene.

“We have seized the truck and brought it to the police station. We believe the truck driver will surrender soon,” said Bijli.

Meanwhile, residents of Kharjul Mala who saw the accident said a school van arrived from one lane and hit the motorcycle, after which the three youths fell down. The truck driver entered the Chehedi pumping road from the Nashik-Pune highway. He could not bring the truck under control and ran the vehicle over the three youths.

Residents of the area said that the road is narrow with farm lands on either side. Mangesh Khalkar, a resident of the area, said the road where the accident took place was wide enough.

According to residents in the area, only two people were on the bike. Kedare, who escaped with injuries, was walking past in the area. Police are yet to ascertain the chronology of events before the accident.

Khalkar added that Gavali had his engagement ceremony in a few days.

Over the past five years, a large number of residential buildings have come up on the Chehedi pumping road, reducing the width of the road. Traffic bottlenecks are common in this stretch of road whenever a car and a bus come from opposite directions.

Citing that many people have met with fatalities on this stretch of road, residents here have expressed the need for increasing the width of the road.

Title: Consider plea of consumer panel member for revised salary: HC
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Madurai: The Madras high court has directed the authorities concerned to consider a representation moved by a non-judicial member of the Tamil Nadu State Consumer Dispute Redressal Commission (TNSCDRC) seeking payment of revised salary as per the Consumer Protection (Appointment, Salary, Allowances and Conditions of service of President and Members of the State Commission and District Forum) Rules, 2018 and to disburse the same along with all allowances and arrears. Justice M S Ramesh passed the order on a plea moved by S M Murugeshan who was appointed as permanent whole time non-judicial member of TNSCDRC in the circuit bench inside Madurai district court premises. The judge also made it clear that the court has not expressed any of its view with regard to the claim made by the petitioner and it is for the authorities to consider it in accordance with law.

The judge observed that the petitioner had stated that he had already made a representation to the authorities concerned on November 22, 2019 which was said to be kept pending. The judge noted that if the said representation is directed to be disposed of within a stipulated time, the ends of justice could be secured. “Whenever a representation is made to a statutory authority to redress the claim of the employee, there is a duty cast upon the authorities to consider the same on its own merits and pass appropriate orders in one way or other, instead of keeping the same pending indefinitely. Any inaction would amount to dereliction of duties.” TNN

Title: ‘Corona won’t affect chickens’
Content: Visakhapatnam: Chairman of Vizianagar Hatcheries Private Limited and veterinarian Gandhi Reddy said coronavirus would not infect poultry and people should not fear consumption of eggs and chicken. He also urged the public to not believe rumours on social media.Addressing the media here on Friday, the chairman said the Centre had released a report that chicken consumption would not pose a threat. Adding that the poultry business has been affected by coronavirus, Gandhi Reddy said, “diseases are spreading on some poultry farms because vaccination programmes are not taken up on time. These diseases and corornavirus are different. Present weather conditions in the Telugu states will not give room for the spread of coronavirus.”

Title: Mahant makes bid to take charge of mutt
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Arjun Das, the erstwhile mahant of Hathiramji mutt who was sacked by the state government as its custodian, attempted to take charge on Friday, but was allegedly prevented by endowments officials. Das was suspended on January 29 over charges of irregularities in land dealings and unceremoniously shunted out, following which Srikalahasti temple executive officer C. Chandrasekhar Reddy took charge as the custodian.

On Friday, Das attempted to take charge following the directions of the high court, wherein Justice AV Sesha Sai, in his verdict dated Feb 10, granted an interim order against the suspension proceedings against him. Das claimed the action was politically motivated as leaders of various political parties had encroached upon the mutt’s lands. He further said that Lord’s jewels were in the safe custody of the court.

Title: Council chairman, secy butt heads over select panel
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Amaravati: AP legislature secretary Balakrishnamacharyulu has once again made it clear that it is not possible to constitute the select committees as per the directives of the legislative council chairman.

With chairman MA Shariff setting a 48-hour deadline to constitute the committees, Balakrishnamacharyulu returned the file without issuing the notification on Friday. This is second time the secretary has returned the file to the chairman. Expressing serious displeasure over the secretary’s refusal to issue orders, Sharrif had asked him to fall in line before Friday evening.

However, the secretary has not followed the chairman’s directive citing rules. He clarified that there was no provision to issue notifications under rule 154 of business rules of the legislature to constitute the select committees.

Sources said the TDP is now planning to approach the high court seeking intervention in the matter.

Municipal administration minister Botcha Satyanarayana said the secretary has only cited the rules and it should not be construed as going against the chairman. “The secretary has to follow the rules and he has explained it to the chairman. Such decisions should not attract a privilege motion. The chairman is aware of the fact that he committed a grave mistake by referring the bills to the select committee without following due procedure,” said Ummareddi Venkateswarlu, the chief whip in the council.

Title: Multiple robberies and a murder in 15 days cause panic across dist
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Vijayawada: With an inter-state gang on the prowl across the highway region of Vijayawada and Krishna district, and the recent string of incidents including the Bhavanipuram murder for gain case, instances of robbery have increased in the region. Officials explained that none of the offenders involved in these incidents belonged to the state and were coming in from Bihar and Odisha.

While the city has witnessed robbery cases that have predominantly been restricted to chain-snatching and blade attacks, a new trend has emerged where inter-state gangs are targeting residential areas on the outskirts of Vijayawada and other parts of Krishna district.

The most recent incident was on February 11, when six miscreants robbed a family, stealing gold and cash to the tune of Rs 10 lakh in in Katur village of Vuyyur Mandal. Initially, it was suspected to be an Odia gang and later confirmed as a Bihari gang. Aarepalli Rajanikanth (50)—a farmer and resident of Katur village—and his wife were tied up after which their movable properties were stolen.

On February 7, two miscreants broke into a house and robbed a Marwari couple at knifepoint in Tiruvuru town. The complainant—identified Shohan Devi (30)—and her husband Gopal Singh were robbed of Rs 57,000 cash. In both these cases, cops are yet to nab the miscreants involved.

The biggest robbery instance that took place recently happened to be the Bhavanipuram murder case. The daylight murder of Yedupati Padmavathi (52) caused panic amongst locals in the city where the accused Gavirineni Anil Kumar, a resident of Chodavaram in Penamaluru mandal committed the offence. Interestingly, Anil was inspired by a crime show on television. Cops were swift enough to nab the accused.

However, the trend of house robbery in the district is still a cause for concern for locals.

Title: Who’s responsible for feni tax hike, asks former dy CM
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Panaji: With discussions heating up over the excise duty hike on feni , former deputy chief minister Vijai Sardesai has joined those questioning the decision.

Waste management minister Michael Lobo had tweeted saying that he would speak to chief minister Pramod Sawant, asking him to consider reducing tax on wines served at weddings and traditional functions and also on the famous local brew, cashew feni.

Replying to the tweet, Sardesai asked Lobo whether Sawant’s decision was based on suggestions received from the pre-budget inputs he had sought from the public. “Whose idea was it to tax the heritage drink, which has GI? Did it come as a suggestion from the pre-budget online suggestions the government sought? Or was it an original idea by the head of the government?” Sardesai tweeted.

Meanwhile, the All Goa Distillers and Bottlers’ Association has sought a reduction in the excise duty on feni announced by the chief minister in his budget speech last week.

On Thursday, the association’s president, Gurudatta Bhakta, led a delegation to commissioner of commercial taxes, Amit Satija, to present their case. They will also be meeting the chief minister.

The tax, which ranges between Rs 10 per bulk litre and Rs 75 per bulk litre, has been imposed for the first time on bottled feni, the association said.

Since feni has been labelled a heritage drink, Bhakta said that “such a high levy” will not help in promoting it, but only make brand compliance difficult. Stating that they are not opposed to feni being taxed, Bhakta said it ought to be levied at a lower rate.

Feni was granted geographical indication (GI) certification over a decade ago, but only in the last three to four years efforts have been made to derive benefits out of this tag.

Title: BJP MLA writes to CM seeking action
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kochi: BJP MLA O Rajagopal on Friday wrote to chief minister seeking action against the organizers of ‘Karuna’ event at Kochi based on TOI report that the earnings from the event organized to raise funds for CMDRF was yet to be remitted. He urged the chief minister to inquire about the foundation (Kochi Music Foundation) and the fund (they collected) and to take appropriate action against those who erred. tnn

Title: Coronavirus: No brakes on seafood export to China
Content: Hyderabad: India’s seafood exports to China has not been hit so far by the coronavirus (Covid-19) outbreak, said officials from Marine Products Export Development Authority (MPEDA) on Friday.“Around 500 exporters are exporting seafood from India to China. The exporting community, in general, has not raised any issue about exports being stopped to that country because of coronavirus,” said KS Srinivas, chairman, MPEDA, adding, “The impact of coronavirus on seafood exports is minimal. There is no need for farmers or exporters to panic. The demand for shrimp and other varieties remains unchanged at the global level.”While urging exporters not to worry, he said that seafood exports to China has increased substantially in 2020 compared to a year ago.China has continued to be a big market for Indian seafood, accounting for almost 16% of the exports during the last financial year. India exported seafood worth $6.73 billion (13.92 lakh tonnes) last fiscal.“Fish sales in the country and outside have not officially dwindled, but there is a huge chance of people avoiding contact from meat market places, given the risk of contracting the virus,” said N Srinivas, senior executive, National Fisheries Development Board.But exporters fear that the consumption of shrimp might reduce, due to the coronavirus. “They are worried that consumption might be affected as the virus is rumoured to have originated from a meat market,” said Viswanath, a merchant exporter from Riyasat Nagar in Hyderabad.

Title: Man injured in accident succumbs
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nashik: A 38-year-old man was killed and his wife and children injured after the motorcycle they were riding was knocked down by a four-wheeler on Trimbak road last Friday.

Gangapur police said that the deceased, Sandip Jadhav, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital a couple of days ago.

The kin of the deceased lodged a complaint at Gangapur police station on Thursday.

“Jadhav was knocked down by an unidentified four wheeler near the bus stop at ABB Circle area on Trimbak Road. While his wife and children escaped with minor injuries, Jadhav sustained serious injuries on his chest and spine,” said police.

Title: Designated cop for all 12,700 villages in Punjab
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: A designated police officer, in the rank of ASI or head constable or constable, who would act as ready point of contact (POC) for each of the 12,700 villages of Punjab. Punjab Police chief DGP Dinkar Gupta on Friday ordered for such designated police officers to be earmarked for the convenience of people living in villages.

It was also decided to set up women help desks in all 406 police stations across the state, with dedicated women police officers of the rank of constable and above. These decisions were taken during a review of the law and order situation in the state with all SSPs and senior police officers in Phillaur. Gupta also asked field police officers to be more proactive in view of the latest internal security inputs received by the police.

The state police head said names and phone numbers of village police officers would be shared by displaying them on the Punjab Police website. The village police officer would visit the village once every week to understand the issues and concerns of the community. Similarly, names of women police officers would also be displayed on the police website along with their ranks. These officials would provide the necessary interface, besides acting as a bridge between the police and the people. These officials will seek to replace zail (a group of villages) system of earlier times with one ASI or head constable looking after a group of eight to 10 villages.

Title: Four sentenced to life imprisonment in Begumpura murder case
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: Four men have been convicted of killing real-estate agent Shaikh Jabbar in May 2018 and sentenced to life imprisonment by district judge-I SM Bhosale on Friday.

The four — Shaikh Wajed alias Babla, Shaikh Amjad alias Mohsin, Syed Shahabuddin alias Shahab and Shaikh Kalim alias Kallu — have been convicted on two different counts of kidnapping, murder and disappearance of evidence. The sentences for murder, kidnapping as well as disappearance of evidence would run concurrently for all convicts, except Wajed.

Considering the brutality with which the 30-year-old realtor was murdered, the prosecution sought capital punishment for Wajed who was accused of cutting open the deceased’s stomach and stashing stones in it before throwing the body in a well near the historic Mombatta Lake situated on the city outskirts.

Additional district government pleader Santosh Mundwadkar told TOI, “Of the 10 accused, four have been convicted and slapped with life imprisonment, one turned approver, three were acquitted and two accused — Shaikh Sikander and Shaikh Harun — are absconding since the incident took place.”

Reading out the judgement in open court, the district judge has pronounced that Wajed, on completion of his life sentence, shall separately suffer 10 years of rigorous imprisonment.

A total of 23 witnesses were examined during the course of trial that went on for a period of over one year. As per police record, Jabbar, a resident of Asifiya Colony, went missing on the afternoon of May 16 of 2018 following which a missing case was registered with Begumpura police station.

Couple of days later, the family lodged a kidnapping complaint suspecting the role of a person with whom Jabbar was having some land dispute.

At the same time an unidentified body was found floating in the well neighbouring historic Mobatta Lake by a water supply department employee. After verification it turned out to be Jabbar’s body.

The police then lodged a murder case and a team led by the then assistant inspector Rahul Rode managed to arrest Wajed in June, 2018, and detected the case.

The probe revealed that the convicts had tortured the man before killing him and dumping his body into the well.

Title: Bilal Bagh women have inspired me to speak up: Naseer
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Actor Naseeruddin Shah speaks at Bilal Bagh on Friday

BENGALURU: Actor Naseeruddin Shah late Friday evening made a surprise appearance at Bilal Bagh , Bengaluru’s Shaheen Bagh where women are on indefinite dharna against Citizenship (Amendment) Act 2019. He said women protesting in similar spaces across the country have given him the courage to speak up about all that’s wrong with the country.

Thousands of women thronged the shamiyana at the protest venue to catch a glimpse of Shah, who arrived around 9pm. They applauded his remarks attacking critics of the anti-CAA protest.

“These brave women are being asked by some that how can they come out on the streets. Have the men sent them to protest? Who gave them permission? And to them, I have only one thing to say: These brave women are awakened now and don’t need anyone’s approval,” Shah said to the roaring applause from the all-woman gathering.

“When students in Jamia Millia Islamia are attacked, when a nine-year-old girl in Bidar is traumatised and is forced to live alone because her mother is taken into custody on no grounds and when in Delhi’s Gargi College, miscreants enter the premises and misbehave with our daughters, people who have spoken about ‘beti-padao beti-bachao’ seem to have still not found a voice to speak out,” Shah said, adding the incidents left his blood boiling.

“But women like you in Shaheen Bagh and Bilal Bagh help me find courage and peace of mind,” he said. Shah stayed at the venue for around 15 minutes and organisers had a tough time escorting him out due to the huge crowd.

Earlier in the day, independent Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani assured the protesters that he would take their message of peace and resistance to Delhi’s Shaheen Bagh and everywhere else where similar protests are under way.

“...I bring you the message of the sisters protesting at Delhi’s Shaheen Bagh and Patna’s Sabzi Bagh that ‘we all are determined, you too remain firm in your resistance and we promise victory will be ours’,” Mevani told the women whose protest entered the seventh day on Friday.

Mevani said whenever someone asks him why protests like Shaheen Bagh are cropping up everywhere in the country and why do so many people go there, he answers: “Whoever has a conscience will go to Shaheen Bagh, Bilal Bagh and the likes. Those who place their belief in Manusmriti will build detention centres and those who place it in the Constitution will come to Shaheen Bagh.”

“I know you are full of enthusiasm but do remember to keep the slogans of Jai Shri Ram’ and ‘Nare Taqbeer’ in your hearts and homes. Because this is not a Hindu vs Muslim or India vs Pakistan fight. It’s BJP vs the entire India,” he said.

Title: Mumbai: ‘Bangladeshis’ acquitted, poll card proves citizenship, says court
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A magistrate court recently held that original election cards are proof of citizenship while acquitting a Mankhurd couple arrested in 2017 on suspicion of being Bangladeshi nationals illegally living in India.

The court held a birth certificate, a domicile certificate, a bona fide certificate and a passport can be relied upon to establish the origin of any person.

“Even the election card can be said to be sufficient proof of citizenship, as while applying for an election card or a voting card, a person has to file a declaration with the authority in view of Form 6 of Peoples Representation Act that he is a citizen of India and if the declaration is found false, he is liable for punishment,” the court said.

The court further said the documents submitted by the accused, Abbas Shaikh (45) and Rabiya Shaikh (40), were not rebutted by the prosecution or proven to be fake.

“It is necessary to mention that the person may lie but the documents will never. Hence, I hold that the prosecution has failed to bring any evidence on record to establish that the documents produced by the accused are not genuine,” the court said.

The court clarified that the Aadhar card, PAN card, driving licence or ration card cannot be termed as documents proving citizenship as they are not meant for the purpose.

A third accused, Rabbiul Mizi (32), is absconding and the trial against him will be heard separately.

Two police officials deposed during trial. It was submitted on March 2, 2017, after receiving information about “Bangladeshi infiltrators” living at Reay Road, a police squad went to the area. They further stated Rabiul was found and he gave “reckless answers” to queries about his nationality. The cops said subsequently Rabiul gave them names of the couple living in Mankhurd and claimed they too like him were Bangladeshis. The cops said after the three were arrested and brought to the police station, they allegedly confessed to having entered India through an unauthorized route without valid documents due to poverty and starvation in Bangladesh.

Out on bail, the accused couple denied the allegations and said that they were Indian nationals. They submitted various documents before court.

Title: 54,000 voters added to final electoral rolls
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Madurai: As many as 54,324 new voters have been added to the final voters list in the 10 assembly segments in Madurai district that was released here on Friday. While there were 25,88,981 voters on the draft electoral rolls released on December 23, 2019, the number has increased to 26,43,305 on the final list.

District collector and district election officer T G Vinay released the list in the presence of representatives from recognised political parties. There are 13,40,435 female votes and 13,02,700 male voters. It was 13,12,040 females and 12,76,784 males on the draft rolls. Transgender voters number has increased to 170 from 157 on the draft rolls.

Usilampatti is the only assembly segment where male voters have outnumbered females. The assembly segment with 2,79,146 voters has 1,39,925 male and 1,39,209 female voters, which is less than the number of male voters by 716. Madurai East assembly segment has the highest number of transgender voters (39).

With 3,15,720 voters, Madurai East assembly segment has the highest number of voters among the 10 assembly segments, followed by Thiruparankundram (3,09,808) and Madurai West (3,01,364). Sholavandan has the lowest number at 2,15,599, followed by Madurai South assembly segment at 2,26,654. Meanwhile, Tuticorin district collector and election officer, Sandeep Nanduri on Friday said that the strong room to store electronic voting machines (EVM) and other polling materials is under construction and is likely to be completed in a year.

Speaking to reporters after releasing the final electoral roll for the district, the collector said the land for the dedicated strong room as instructed by the election commission has been identified at the district collectorate campus and is being constructed at Rs 3.36 crore. He said the building with specifications from the Election Commission of India will have a total storage area of 1,000sqm in two floors.

Talking about the final electoral roll, he said that the district has 14,50,689 voters including 7,11,072 males, 7,39,487 females and 130 other voters.

Title: Road safety activists patch up potholes in city
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Vimala Sudheekshan and Gangadhar Tilak inspect a pothole being plugged

Vijayawada: In a bid to prevent any untoward incidents, Sudheekshan Foundation, a city-based NGO , along with Samadhanam, have begun patching up potholes at different areas in Vijayawada.
