Vimala Sudheekshan, the founder of the NGO, citing official data, said that Andhra Pradesh stands sixth place in the country for most number of deaths due to potholes. “Around 15,000 people are dying annually, across the country, due to potholes, most of whom are bikers. We want to do whatever little we can to fix potholes to reduce the number,” Sudheekshan said.

Samadhanam, an Hyderabad-based NGO founded by Katakam Gangadhar Tilak, an ex-Vijayawada railway official who is known as a ‘roads doctor’.

With the help of road bond ready mix, staff members have patched a number of potholes across the city and the surrounding areas. Activists pointed that many of these potholes are formed again and again due to rains and apathy from civic and panchayat bodies.

Vijayawada too has seen a fair share of pothole deaths particularly on Eluru Road.

Activists say that areas like the Gollapudi-Sitara junction stretch, Mahanadu road, Autonagar, Kanuru and other arterial roads in One Town area are peppered with potholes of varying sizes, which is a death trap for drivers. Though temporary patch works are being taken up, the same region continues to get damaged as no permanent measures are taken.

Apart from the National Highways, a number of pothole-laden roads come under the roads and buildings department while the arterial and other roads are under the Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) limits.

Title: Bihar: Four opposition leaders hold ‘secret’ meet without Congress, RJD
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

RLSP chief Upendra Kushwaha

PATNA: As the political focus shifts to Bihar after the Delhi election, churning within the opposition Mahagathbandhan (MGB) has begun with leaders of four constituents — RLSP chief Upendra Kushwaha , HAM (S) chief Jitan Ram Manjhi , VIP chief Mukesh Sahni and RLD patron Sharad Yadav — holding a closed-door meeting here on Friday.

Sources said the meeting — held in Yadav’s room at a posh hotel in Patna — was prompted by “concerns” of the smaller parties over RJD assuming “big brother” role in the alliance by announcing Tejashwi Prasad Yadav as the CM face. Congress and RJD representatives were not invited for the meeting hurriedly called a day before the RLD patron’s meeting with jailed RJD chief Lalu Prasad in Ranchi.

However, Sharad’s close aide and the RLD state vice-president, Binny Yadav, said, the three leaders came to request his party chief “to take more responsibility” in the alliance. Binny added, “They want him to head the co-ordination committee of the Mahagatbandhan, which will soon be formed. He will convey everyone’s demand to Lalu Ji.”

The RLSP functionary said, “He (Sharad) is also from Yadav caste and far more experienced and mature than Tejashwi. I believe he will more responsibly handle the alliance affairs than Tejashwi.”

RJD and Congress both tried to downplay the meeting. While RJD asserted that Tejashwi will be the CM face, Congress leaders said there is no harm in holding a meeting.

After the meeting, Manjhi said, he met Sharad to discuss the “lethargic role of RJD and Congress over CAA, NRC and NPR apart from other issues” related to Mahagatbandhan.

“Alliance co-ordination committee will decide on CM's face,” he said, adding, “We are in touch with a few more people and things will be clear on February 18, or after that.” Interestingly, expelled JD (U) leader Prashant Kishor had also given the same deadline for pronouncing his next political move.

Sahni said, “There is nothing wrong in meeting Sharad Yadav ji because he is a senior leader and our patron. He is also close to Lalu ji and will be meeting him on Saturday to apprise him about our discussions.” However, Sahni gave a conflicting indication saying, “Sharad could not be given the charge of co-ordination committee as only a leader who stayed 24X7 in Bihar could handle the affairs.”

Sahni appeared softer on the issue of Tejashwi as CM candidate. “The party which wins more seats will naturally get the CM’s post and no doubt RJD is a big party and Tejashwi is the leader of opposition. Also Lalu Ji’s blessing is a must for CM’s post.”

Sahni also hinted at possible discussions between Mahagatbandhan leaders and Kishor and, like Manjhi, said, wait for February 18.

However, RJD said such meetings will have no consequences. “Since Sharad Yadav Ji is a senior leader, there is nothing wrong in meeting him. But Mahagatbandhan’s meet is not possible without RJD and Tejashwi Ji. If anyone has any confusion, I would like to clear that Tejashwi is the only CM candidate and those who accompany him in the chariot will win this battle. For others it will not be possible to even reach the battleground,” said RJD state spokesperson Mritunjay Tiwari.

Title: Medical seat-blocking scandal leaves Karnataka Examinations Authority richer by Rs 40 crore
Content:
Representative image

Times View The seat-blocking scam is a disgraceful operation that takes away seats allocated for genuinely meritorious students and gives them to the affluent. In this context, raising the penalty for those who surrender their seats makes a lot of sense. It would be appropriate to penalise colleges where such malpractice is widespread. The seats that are transferred from open to management quota are sold for exorbitant sums. So why not let a bigger portion of this money go to the education department? The government could also tax seats that private colleges sell.

Rs 10 crore from other courses

BENGALURU: It’s not only private medical colleges that are laughing all the way to the bank, thanks to the seat-blocking scandal. Karnataka Examinations Authority ( KEA ) too has made a whopping Rs 40 crore in five academic years (2015-2020) by forfeiting fees paid by candidates who block undergraduate seats but surrender them later.In the seat-blocking scandal, meritorious candidates are suspected to land top ranks in National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET), block seats in private medical colleges by paying the fee to KEA and surrender them after the final mop-up round of counselling. The surrendered seats are added to the management quota of private medical colleges, which sell them in return for huge sums of money.KEA’s gain, however, is unintended. It collects fee from selected candidates and has to transfer it to the colleges concerned later. However, with the candidates backing out even before the fee is transferred and failing to provide a convincing explanation for abandoning the seats, the fee is confiscated by KEA as penalty . During 2019-20, KEA saw 276 candidates surrendering MBBS seats in various private medical colleges. Consequently, they became management seats.Candidates surrendering seats also have to pay Rs 10,000 as penalty to the directorate of medical education. This is apart from the first-year college fee that is forfeited by KEA in case candidates to provide a convincing explanation.Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences has submitted a report to the department of medical education on reforms that need to be brought in to end the scam. RGUHS suggested the penalty must be over Rs 25 lakh for MBBS seats surrendered after the mop-up round.Dr PG Girish, director of medical education, said changes will be made to stop candidates from surrendering seats after the final round. “The need is to increase penalty in such a way that the candidate doesn’t leave the seat. That’s being done. The system will be taken online and students’ biometric details will be checked during every round of counselling,” said Dr Girish.KEA authorities said the scandal can be checked only when a candidate surrendering the seat after the mop-up round is made to face criminal charges and undergo a thorough investigation. “The other suggestion made to the government is that the college should collect the entire course fee from the candidate and not allot the seat to anyone else,” said an officer.There’s a possibility of candidates seeking seats in institutions outside Karnataka surrendering their seats here. “Though NEET is the only exam for MBBS entrance, counselling doesn’t happen in all states at once. There could be genuine candidates who want to join medical colleges elsewhere and give away their seat here. That can be tackled only through centralised counselling,” said an expert.Candidates surrendering UG seats in dental, engineering, pharmacy and farm sciences also end up benefiting KEA by not providing convincing explanations. In five academic years, it has gained Rs 10 crore in the form of fees paid by such candidates. This is in addition to around Rs 40 crore the authority has got from candidates giving up MBBS seats. KEA officials, however, said surrendering of seats in dental, engineering, pharmacy and farm sciences is not part of any seat-blocking scam .

Title: Bengaluru: 6.1% jump in job offers at IIMB placements
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: The lateral and final placements for the Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP) class of 2018-20 of the Indian Institute of Management Bangalore (IIMB) has seen a rise of over 6.1% in job offers compared to the previous year, U Dinesh Kumar, chair, career development services, IIMB, said on Friday.

A total of 518 job offers were made to 428 students, who appeared for placements over three days.

Consulting companies made the most number of offers (147), with 26 offers from Accenture, the highest from a firm in this sector. Next was the Boston Consulting Group with 23 offers. Other top recruiters were Bain & Company (20), Kearney (15) and McKinsey & Co (14). The other recruiters were GEP Consulting, KPMG, Alvarez & Marsal, EY-Parthenon, Nomura Research Institute, IBM Consulting, Gartner, Oliver Wyman, Auctus Advisors, Ernst & Young, Vector Consulting, Infosys Management Consulting and L.E.K. Consulting.

Firms from the technology consulting domain made 27 offers, and leading the lot was PricewaterhouseCoopers (12).

The information technology and IT product management industry made 38 offers, led by Microsoft IDC (10), TCS (6) and Razorpay (3), apart from 10 other industry giants.

In addition, e-commerce space giants made 32 offers, with 20 from Amazon and 4 each from Flipkart, Paytm and Prione.

There were 42 offers in the finance domain. Among banks, Goldman Sachs made the maximum of 8 offers, followed by Avendus Capital an JP Morgan with five offers each and Allianz Benelux with 3. Other recruiters included IDFC First Bank, Bharti Financial Services, ICICI, Kotak Mahindra, Wells Fargo, HCL, Landmark, Motilal Oswal Group and Prime Ventures.

Sixty offers were made by industry giants for their general management positions — Aditya Birla Group (8), Adani Group (7), Vedanta (6), Capgemini (5) and EPIC Group (5). Among the other companies were Tata Administrative Services, Zee Entertainment, Genpact and ONGC.

Students opting for sales and marketing roles got 55 offers and were recruited by major consumer goods firms led by Anheuser-Busch InBev with 10 offers.

For operations roles, 17 offers were made by various companies. Leading the list was Accenture Operations at 5, followed by Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages at 3.

Title: Palghar cops nab spurned suitor who wanted to torch woman’s kin
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Accused was nabbed at Palghar station late on Thursday night

MUMBAI: Palghar police succeeded in averting a repeat of the recent Hinganghat incident where a teacher was torched by a stalker, by arresting a 28-year-old Rajasthan man with plans to set afire the mother and sister of a 24-year-old woman who had called off their wedding last year. She later married someone else.

Bhaironsinh Rathod was nabbed from Palghar railway station late on Thursday with a bottle containing 750ml of petrol. He wanted to target the woman’s mother and sister as he did not have her contact details.

Rathod was to marry the woman last year but her mother called it off after learning that he had lied about his job; he was unemployed and was an alcoholic. Even after the wedding was called off, Rathod continued to harass the woman over phone and on social media.

As his threats to deter her from marrying failed, he began to harass her mother and sister. Palghar police inspector Dashrath Patil said the mother approached them early this month when Rathod threatened to set them and their home on fire.

She shared with the police threat messages sent by Rathod to the family. He went a step further and began to defame the now married woman on Facebook.

A Palghar police team went to Ajmer to nab Rathod but did not find him there. On Thursday, Rathod called the woman’s mother and threatened to set her afire. She informed the police who on tracking his cellphone found he had landed at Palghar railway station. Rathod was nabbed late at night. He told the police he procured the petrol from an autorickshaw driver in Ajmer.

He was booked under sections of IPC and IT Act.

Title: 50% of Bihar households exposed to migration: Study
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: If a recent study conducted by Institute of Population Sciences (IIPS) is to be believed, more than half of the households in Bihar are exposed to migration to more developed places within or outside the country and majority of households depend on remittances for their livelihood.

The report of the IIPS-sponsored study project, ‘Causes and consequences of out migration from middle Ganga plain’, was jointly released by IIPS director K S James and state education minister Krishnandan Prasad Verma here on Thursday.

The survey, which covered 36 villages and 2,270 households, reveals that migration from the region is male selective without family. Highest migration occurs in the traditional migration pockets of Saran, Munger, Darbhanga, Kosi, Tirhut and Purnia. Seasonal migration is highest in Kosi, Tirhut and Purnia divisions. The migration is highest from other caste groups followed by OBCs, SCs and STs.

Middle Ganga plain covers 64 districts of eastern Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. Historically, migration from this region dates back to the first quarter of the 19th century. Due to persistent widespread poverty and under development, migration from this region continued even after Independence and mainly remained confined to the developed western states of the country. Recently, this region also showed a significant rise in trend of international migration towards the Gulf destinations. The continuum of two-century-old association between migration and poverty has led to the “culture of migration” in Middle Ganga Plain, the study says.

It has been observed that migration is highest for the landless group and nuclear families in Bihar. The average age of migrants is 32 years. Eighty per cent migrants are landless or have less than one acre of land and 85% of them have passed Class X. Ninety per cent of the migrants work in private factory or as casual workers. Average remittance by a migrant is Rs 26,020 in Bihar and Rs 38,061 in eastern Uttar Pradesh per annum.

As far as the status of women in migrants’ local households is concerned, 47% women are literate and 22% of them work for wages. Majority of the left behind women in Bihar lives in nuclear family. Three-fourth of the left behind women communicate with their husband daily on mobile. Only 29% women are members of self-help groups and 80% women have their own bank accounts.

Wives of both migrants as well as non-migrants feel that economic status, lifestyle, autonomy, education and health of children improve after the migration of their husbands.

Seasonal migration is more predominant in Bihar, as 90% of the seasonal migrants are from Bihar. While 31% from Bihar migrated to Punjab, 27% from UP migrated to Maharshtra. Nearly 46% of seasonal migrants bring cash at the end of the month and 48% operate through banking system, the study reveals.

The study further reveals that 75% migrants perceived improvement in their family income, family bonding and social status after their return. As many as 25% of them want to migrate again while two-thirds would encourage their children to migrate for employment, the study concludes.

Project coordinators K C Das and R B Bhagat, both from IIPS, observed that the most important outcome of migration is remittance which influences the process of development and brings change in the consumption pattern and lifestyle of the individual.

“Remittances result in increase in wealth of the family and consequential improvement in education and nutrition of the members of the household and greater use of hospital facilities during times of illness of the family members,” they said.

Title: Lebanese man held with drugs at Siolim
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: A Lebanese national was arrested by the anti-narcotics cell of the Goa police on Friday at Siolim after he was allegedly found in possession of LSD papers worth around Rs 5 lakh.

Louh Ahmad, 25, was apprehended following a raid on his rented room. The police said that the drugs – 100 papers of LSD, were found concealed in the room and were meant for sale to tourists. He is in Goa for the last three months

Title: Six new suspected coronavirus cases in Hyderabad
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: Six new suspected cases of novel coronavirus were reported in the city on Friday. Two of them were admitted at Gandhi hospital and four were kept in home isolation.According to the latest set of reports, a total of 88 people so far have tested negative for the virus. These people, who were previously suspected to be infected, are still being monitored closely by state health authorities. The health status of the suspects who are under observation at home and hospitals are stable.Till Friday, 8,735 travellers were screened at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. 196 passengers are under home quarantine for 28 days. Passengers admitted at Fever hospital and Gandhi hospital are under observation in isolation wards.The state helpline for the virus, 040-24651119 is functional, and 381 calls have been received as of date.

Title: Red timber worth Rs 1.5cr seized, 13 smugglers held
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Tirupati: In a major haul, the red sanders anti-smuggling task force arrested 13 smugglers and seized logs worth Rs 1.5 crore near Tirupati in the early hours of Friday. Task force teams led by RSIs Vasu, Vijay and Johny Basha were undertaking combing operations inside Seshachalam forests near Srivari mettu and Srinivasa Mangapuram areas on Thursday night when they spotted the group.

“The teams were searching the forest areas between Alipiri and Srivari mettu when they spotted a group of around 60 red sanders smugglers and woodcutters carrying logs on their shoulders and loading them on vehicles parked near Srinivasa Mangapuram early this morning. When the combing parties zeroed in on the smugglers, they started pelting stones,” task force in-charge SP P Ravi Shankar said.

By the time the teams managed to surround the group from all sides, around 45 of them escaped taking advantage of the darkness while 13 were arrested. All 13 were from Tamil Nadu. The task force seized 52 red sanders logs and two vehicles.

Title: SEC releases electoral roll
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Vijayawada: The state election commission ( SEC ) released an updated electoral roll on Friday ahead of local body, panchayat raj and municipal elections .

According to official data, a total 45,836 polling stations will be set up for local body elections. K Vijayanand, chief electoral officer (CEO) noted that the commission has found an initial increase of new voters by 1.63 lakhs till date. Overall, there are now 3.99 crore voters in the state.

Of the 3.99 crore voters, 2.02 crore are female while 1.97 crore are male. Vijayanand added that there are around 4,066 transgender voters while non-resident Indian (NRI) voters number 7,436.

Title: Security upped for Mahasivarathri
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Guntur: Security has been beefed up for the Mahasivarathri celebrations at Kotappakonda.

All the arrangements will be in place in a couple of days, the police said, adding that they are fully geared up for the big event on the hill shrine which is likely to witness nearly 4-5 lakh pilgrims over two days.

Rural district superintendent of police (SP) Ch Vijaya Rao visited the hill shrine on Friday and reviewed the security plan with local MLA Gopireddy Srinivasa Reddy and local police.

Speaking to reporters, the SP said that the entire Kotappakonda area would be divided into 24 sectors for bandobust arrangements and each sector would be headed by a DSP rank official.

“A 24x7 dedicated command control room and two traffic outposts will also be set up to manage traffic,” said SP Vijaya Rao. He said that nine-check posts would be set up along Kotappakonda to regulate traffic movement.

He explained that blue-colt teams would be moving around the area to prevent traffic jams and take immediate measures required for smooth movement of vehicles.

The SP added that special teams from Central Crime Station (CCS) would be deployed to nab anti-social elements, such as pick-pocketers. He said that CC cameras and drone cameras would be used to monitor the law and order situation and traffic movement.

He said that police personnel would be wearing body cameras and catch the offenders on the spot.

Title: BBMP’s choice of traffic junctions for revamp drive leaves many unhappy
Content:
Some commuters feel junction improvement works in the past failed to ease traffic flow across the city

BENGALURU: With BBMP announcing names of traffic intersections shortlisted for beautification and improvement works on Friday, residents of several areas were left dejected.Residents of localities such as Bellandur, Whitefield and Bannerghatta Road cried foul over exclusion of busy traffic intersections such as Silk Board junction, Iblur junction and Hope Farm junction from the initiative.The Palike plans to carry out junction improvement at 35 traffic intersections in the city at a cost of Rs 100 crore. The idea is to improve traffic flow at these points, BBMP commissioner BH Anil Kumar tweeted on Friday.“Several severely congested junctions, including the ones at Iblur, Carmelaram and Kaikondrahalli near Bellandur, have been left out of this list,” said Trilochan Nath, who lives near Carmelaram railway station.“Past junction improvement works have done little to ease traffic gridlocks. Instead of spending crores on beautification, the civic body must focus on actually improving traffic flow at these junctions,” he added.Reactions poured in from residents of areas who are feeling left out. “When will you look beyond MG road, sir. Are we not paying enough taxes. Hosa road /sarjapur road major Infra and you keep redoing Trinity and chruch street. @kdevforum @WFRising @ArvindLBJP We need separate corporation (sic),” tweeted Ramkumar, in response to the BBMP commissioner’s post.“On what basis are these junctions selected? Why none of the junctions near any major IT park is considered?” wondered Vinay Sogane.“How abt Bommanahalli jn, Hosa Jn, Silk board jn & Birla jn in Kudlu that connects Hosa and E-City by diverting Silk Board traffic. Ignored bcoz #NoVIPmovement here & who cares for #ITlaborers?? (sic)” tweeted Bikash Khilar, while responding to the commissioner’s post announcing the list of junctions.

Title: Flying out from Terminal 3 of Delhi airport? Get bags picked from home
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

The paid facility is also available to the flyers arriving at the city’s Indira Gandhi International Airport (... Read More

NEW DELHI: The passengers flying out of Delhi now have the option of getting their luggage transported from their place of stay to the airport for check-in. The paid facility is also available to the flyers arriving at the city’s Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA).

The service, which covers the whole of Delhi and the neighbouring states of Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan, was launched at Terminal 3 on Friday by Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL), the IGIA operator, which is collaborating with a Bengaluru-based firm, CarterX.

The charges will vary according to the number, size and the weight of the luggage and the distance of the pick-up/drop point, DIAL said. The charges start from Rs 299 and there is no separate delivery fee for Delhi, said a CarterX spokesperson. “The locations in the neighbouring states are considered outstation and charges are applicable pincode-wise,” he added.

The facility is now available only at T3 for both international and domestic flights. “A passenger flying out of Delhi can book their baggage through the CarterX website or through its mobile application,” said a DIAL spokesperson. The booking will soon be available on the IGIA website, www.newdelhiairport.in.

CarterX doesn’t charge anything for a luggage weighing up to 20kg, said its spokesperson. For every extra 5kg, an additional Rs 100 will be charged. “The maximum weight of a bag can be 40kg and the charges will also vary according to its dimension. We accept dimensions as per the airlines’ guidelines. Additional charges are decided after an inspection,” he added.

For the out-bound flyers, the luggage will be delivered to them on their chosen time slot at the airport so that they can proceed for check-in, the spokesperson said. The passengers arriving in Delhi can book their luggage from their outstation locations and the bags will be collected after they reach IGIA. “The bags will then be delivered to the address provided by them,” he added.

DIAL said each luggage, once booked, would be secured in tamper-resistant sealed bags and marked and barcoded for easy identification. They will be insured by the service-providing company.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Income tax raids on N Chandrababu Naidu’s aides trigger political slugfest
Content:
N Chandrababu Naidu

AMARAVATI: The income tax raids on infrastructure companies owned by close aides of TDP leaders N Chandrababu Naidu and Nara Lokesh has generated political heat in the state, with the YSRC launching a full-throttle campaign to push opposition TDP into a corner.YSRC parliamentary party leader V Vijayasai Reddy said the I-T raids have uncovered just one layer of the million-fold corrupt deeds of Naidu. “Several more layers are yet to be uncovered. The raids have unmasked Naidu’s real face, who round-tripped thousands of crores from infrastructure companies. We strongly believe irregularities worth more than Rs 10 lakh crore would be uncovered if the investigation goes further deep into the illegal network,” he said.Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy’s advisor Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy said the I-T raids on Naidu’s former personal secretary Pendyala Srinivas are only the tip of the iceberg. “Many big names are involved in the racket and more skeletons would tumble soon,” he alleged.Agriculture minister Kurasala Kannababu demanded an inquiry into Naidu’s assets by the Enforcement Directorate. “People have now come to know how Naidu plundered government treasury. The raids prove that TDP leadership was the fountainhead of corruption. Bogus contractors and benamis were got a free run during the TDP regime,” he said. Minister Avanti Srinivas said Naidu’s role in the multi-crore scam is evident from the I-T raids and a CBI inquiry should be conducted into it.Meanwhile, TDP has strongly refuted the charges linking Naidu with the I-T raids, saying it’s an attempt to malign the former chief minister’s clean image. “Srinivas was relieved from Naidu’s office nine months ago. While the I-T officials claim to have unearthed Rs 2,000 crore worth irregularities, the YSRC is spreading a false campaign as if the amount was found with Srinivas,” fumed former minister Yanamala Ramakrishnudu.TDP MLC Ashok Babu said Naidu’s family members have revealed their assets every year. “Why has Jagan’s family failed to do the same? YSRC leaders should first question their leader’s integrity,” he said.Deputy leader in the assembly Atchhannaidu said Jagan’s father YS Rajasekhara Reddy had failed to prove a single charge against Naidu even after instituting 26 inquiries. “Jagan should first come clean and complete the pending inquiry into the cases filed against him. TDP is in no way connected with the I-T raids and its revelations,” said Atchannaidu.TDP national general secretary Nara Lokesh said Jagan has started a “false campaign” against their family as he is worried about going to jail.

Title: MGP wants ZP polls held after April 20
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Panaji: MGP on Friday demanded that the state government postpone the zilla panchayat elections scheduled on March 22 due to the upcoming school and college examinations that will commence by February end and conclude on April 20. MGP wants the elections to be held after April 20.

Senior MGP functionary Ramkrishna Dhavalikar told reporters that the state government should see what is important before postponing the election. Recently, the ZP elections were postponed due to carnival and shigmo celebrations.

Stating that till date the government had not notified reservation of constituencies for ZP elections, Dhavalikar said, “The government is trying to mess with the ZP elections. I want to ask the government, ‘who will announce reservation of constituencies — government or state election commission?”

He said the reservation of constituencies should be announced by February 16. “If not, we will not be able to ask our candidates to start work for elections,” Dhavalikar added.

Speaking on the Mhadei issue, the senior MGP member said that he did not trust any national party with the issue, including Congress, which he said was “doing drama over the matter”.

He referred to the speech made by Congress Rajya Sabha MP, B K Hariprasad, in which he had demanded that the Centre give environmental clearance for the water project on the river. “It looks like both Congress and BJP are together on the Mhadei issue,” Dhavalikar said.

MGP has decided to organise a candlelight morcha in Panaji in March to highlight the Mhadei issue.

On the law and order situation in the state with relation to the 38 people who were booked on Thursday for rioting in a Baga hotel, he said that it was an example of deteriorating law and order situation in the state.

On the disqualification petition, Dhavalikar said that tourism minister Manohar Ajgaonkar and PWD minister Deepak Pauskar filed their reply in the case, copies of which have been handed over to them. He also said that the case has been adjourned till March 6.

Title: AMC chalks out plans ahead of Shiv Jayanti
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Aurangabad: A 10-ft high statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj made of metal will be placed at the Kranti Chowk ahead of Shiv Jayanti on February 19, said mayor Nandkumar Ghode

Municipal commissioner Astik Kumar Pandey, civic officials, the mayor, deputy mayor Rajendra Janjal, house leader Vikas Jain and others visited Kranti Chowk and discussed the alternative arrangements with the engineers and architects.

Following the visit, Nandkumar Ghodele said, “The Aurangabad Municipal Corporation is responsible to make arrangement for the celebration of Shiv Jayanti. The enthroned statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj depicting the coronation scene will be placed for people to pay their tribute. The statue will be kept at Kranti Chowk for the entire day and thereafter will be removed,” Ghodele said.

Ghodele said that the order for the statue has been given to a contractor. The AMC is yet to receive an estimate for the statue procurement.

The civic body had removed the statue of the Maratha warrior from Kranti Chowk in July to increase the height of the structure.

Currently, the AMC has dug up the Kranti Chowk circle around 20 feet deep and the civil works are going on for raising the pedestal on which the new statue will be placed. However, the AMC has not been able to issue the tender for the procurement of the new statue yet.

In failure to meet the deadline, the pressure is building upon the civic body by the representatives of the Maratha community.

Title: ‘Skull breaker’ challenge a new headache?
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

In the ‘skull breaker’ challenge, three people stand side by side

NEW DELHI: A new challenge going viral on social media, called “tripping jump” or “skull breaker”, has become a cause of concern for parents. Doctors said it has the potential to fracture every joint in the body of the person accepting the challenge. After “blue whale” and “momo” challenges, this is the third scare in the line because of which children have landed in a vulnerable position.

Principals of many schools said that though they haven’t seen children performing the challenge, awareness needs to be built against it. Earlier, when cases of children indulging in such challenges were reported, advisories were issued by both schools and the government.

Various countries have termed “skull breaker” as the latest danger in school. In some countries, police have started investigations to find out how it started. In this challenge, three people stand side by side. The person in the middle jumps high, while those on the side kick at the jumper’s legs. Because of this, the jumper lands on the ground with a hard bang. In the videos being circulated, it seems that the person in the middle is unaware of what is going to occur. There are also versions in which the jumper knows what’s happening and tries to avoids tripping. TikTok has its own version called the “skull breaker challenge”.

A mother, who got a video as a WhatsApp forward, said, “It is very scary. Imagine falling when you are jumping. These days, children have easy access to social media platforms, so how do we stop them? Some may also use this challenge to bully. This is scarier than the challenges that went viral earlier.”

Doctors said that this prank should not be performed because it may fracture every joint. Dr Rajeev Sharma, chairman, orthopaedics at Vimhans, said, “The person who trips has a free fall on the hip. He or she can fracture the knee, ankle, hip or any other joint. There is also a risk of ligament tear.”

Title: Telangana: Two held for sending women to Kuwait on fake papers, 16 passports & Rs 2 lakh cash seized
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A special operations team of Shamshabad zone arrested two persons for sending women from India to Kuwait via Dubai for employment using fake police clearance, medical and stamping certificates.

The accused were identified as Rellu Kubender Rao, 32, from Rajendranagar and Shaik Basheer Ahmed, 60, from Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu. A third associate, Balu Prasad from Chennai, is at large. The two accused were caught at a hotel at Shamshabad and Rs 2 lakh cash, 16 passports and 13 visa papers were recovered from them.

The Cyberabad police said: “For any worker to go to Kuwait, they would require the Immigration Clearance Certificate for ECR passports. To bypass the system, the accused would send the workers to Dubai on a tourist visa. From there, they would go to Kuwait, thus escaping from immigration clearance.”

Kubender Rao studied the process of sending people to the Gulf for employment. He created fake documents, and got stamps from Balu Prasad. Kuwaiti stickers were used for making the fake stamps,arranged by Basheer Ahmed.

Title: 2 women murdered in Old City over monetary dispute
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Hyderabad: A 60-year-old woman and her 32-year-old daughter were stabbed to death by a relative over monetary dispute on Friday at their house in Chandrayangutta. Shehzadi Begum and her daughter, Fareeda, were killed by Fareeda’s brother in-law, Rehman, and his friend, Multani, both butchers from Chandrayangutta.

Rehman has been working in West Asian countries since 2012 and he used to send the earnings into Fareeda’s bank account. Rehman’s brother works in Dubai. Recently, Rehman came to Hyderabad on personal visit and asked Fareeda for Rs 32 lakh he had deposited over the years.

“But Fareeda refused to return the amount. She only returned a small amount and did not even heed to her husband’s advice to return the money,” said an officer from Falaknuma police.

On Friday, Rehman and Multani went to Fareeda’s mother’s house and began arguing about the money. “Only Fareeda and her mother were at home. During the argument, the accused slit the throats of the women, killing them on the spot,” said Falaknuma ACP Mohammed Majeed.

The accused fled from the spot and neighbours alerted cops about the murder. Police rushed to the scene with a dog squad and forensic team. After securing evidence from the scene, the bodies were shifted to Osmania General Hospital for post-mortem and a murder case was registered.

On Friday night, police picked up both the accused from a hideout in Chabndrayangutta. While questioning, Rehman claimed that Fareeda had bought a house with the money he had sent and so, refused to return it despite repeated requests.

Title: Songs capture mood of love on Valentine’s Day
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nagpur: The mood of Valentine’s Day was beautifully captured with singers presenting songs based on love at a programme organized by Band Elements at Utkarsh Hall of Vidarbha Hindi Sahitya Sammelan, Sitabuldi, on Friday.

A mix of ghazals, romantic songs and soft rock music made the audience sway to the tunes with the singers presenting one hit song after the other. Songs reflecting the feeling of love in different moods were carefully chosen to mark the V-Day.

Group song ‘Chori chori chupke se’ was the highlight of the programme.

Purnima Joshi rendered in mellifluous voice songs like ‘Kitni bechain ho ke tumse mili’, ‘Raja ko rani se pyar ho gaya’ and ‘Mera dil bhi kitna pagal hai’ from popular movie Saajan, besides others.

While presenting ‘Kya tumhe yaad hai’, Karan Kulmethi urged the audience to sing along with him and got an instant response. He also sang ‘Jab koi baat bigad jaye’ and ‘Paani da rang’ which were received well.

Atul Hirekhan was cheered repeatedly as he sang ‘Teri ummeed tere intezar’ and ‘Tune mujhe pehechana nahi’, much to the delight of music lovers.

‘Tere dar par sanam chale aaye’, sung by Manish Naik, was another song that got applause from the audience.

Songs presented at the programme included ‘Jaadu teri nazar’, ‘Dil mera churaya kyun’, ‘Ho gaya hai tujhko pyar’ and ‘Tujhe dekha toh yeh jaana sanam’, besides others.

Singers Pranali Ramteke, Kaushik Meshram and Bhargav Patel rose to the occasion and gave spectators quality entertainment.

Medley songs presented by the singers was the attraction of the programme.

Anchor Sudhanshu Chandrikapure shared details of the songs and anecdotes associated with them that made the evening entertaining.

Moderator Arvind Raje spoke about the efforts put in by singers and the entire team. He said, “The singers understand the depth of music and gave their best to make the programme a success.”

(Reporting by Janhavi Dave)

Our Take

* I liked the songs sung by Joshi. She is an amazing singer and did justice to the songs. I thoroughly enjoyed the programme

Meena Rao | lawyer

* It was a wonderful programme organized on the Valentine’s Day. Songs based on love added a touch of beauty to the programme

Divya Ramani | student

* I liked variations in songs the most. Songs based on the theme of love made the programme spectacular

Pravin Dabli | yoga therapist

Title: CM meets Shah, seeks funds for Polavaram
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Amaravati: Making a strong pitch for abolition of the legislative council, chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy on Friday requested Union home minister Amit Shah to extend the Centre’s support to clear the hurdles in the abolition process.

The chief minister urged him to intervene to route the council abolition bill to the Parliament and get its nod in the current session itself. This is chief minister’s second visit to the national capital in the last three days after his meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday.

Jagan is believed to have briefed the home minister about the issues he presented to the Prime Minister two days ago. He also explained that the PM had positively responded to his requests and that he needed the support of the home minister to get the promises cleared.

The CM is believed to have discussed the issue of three capital cities with Shah and sought Shah’s support in issuing a notification from the Centre to move the HC to Kurnool.

Shah was also urged to positively consider the issue of release of funds for the Polavaram project. Jagan said the state would require financial support from the Centre to take up the relief and rehabilitation works of Polavaram project as it requires nearly Rs 34,000 crore.

The chief minister also requested the home minister to grant funds for modernisation of state police’s infrastructure, in particular to spare funds for construction of AP police academy which was part of the Reorganisation Act. Stating that the state government was not in a position to take additional financial burden, Jagan requested Shah to be liberal with funds for the state. He also reminded him the Centre’s assurance to grant special category status ( SCS ) to the state and the recent recommendation of the 15th finance commission which left the issue at the discretion of the Centre.

The CM is likely to meet Union law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman and commerce minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday.

Title: CPM launches campaign against CAA
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Aurangabad: The Communist Party of India (Marxist) has decided to hold door-to-door campaign across the country from March 1 in order to educate people about Citizenship Amendment Act, 2019, National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR).

CPM leader Brinda Karat, during a press conference held in the city on Friday, said the party will appeal to people to refuse to answer questions asked by the government.

Hitting out at the central government, Karat said during the recent Delhi assembly elections for the first time country’s home minister turned into country’s hate minister.

“The CAA-NRC- NPR is a straight attack on the Constitution of India. In the first phase of its implementation, government will send people to each of the houses and ask questions for the NPR. We are going say that we are not going to answer the questions,” Karat said.

Terming it as a three-edged trishul, the senior politician said CAA-NRC-NPR is piercing the soul of India. “The Maharashtra government should clarify its stand on the CAA-NRC-NPR. The CPM government in Kerala has passed a resolution, refusing to implement NPR in the state,” she said.

“There is absolutely no need for such a process in the country. If you need a register there are other documents for that. We don’t require NRC or NPR to decide who the citizen of this country is,” she added. Karat also criticized the Modi government for rise in price of LPG cylinder, unemployment, privatisation of public assets, slashing down fund allocation for MNERGA, food security, scheduled caste-scheduled tribes and midday meals.

“The CAA-NRC-NPR is not just a cover-up by the central government for its failure in dealing with key issues, but is an agenda being pushed by it with the help of the brute majority in the parliament.”

Title: Ministers talk up North Karnataka emerging industrial hub in state
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

CM BS Yediyurappa

HUBBALLI: Invest Karnataka Hubballi Conference kicked off here on Friday with Union chemicals and fertiliser minister DV Sadananda Gowda announcing the setting up of a Central Institute of Plastics Engineering and Technology unit here.

Inaugurating the event, chief minister BS Yediyurappa said Karnataka can play A key role in developing $5 trillion economy, the Prime Minister’s vision, by 2024. “Industrialise or Perish were Sir M Visvesvaraya’s words and that’s the economic philosophy of our government. Karnataka is well known for IT and software exports. It’s also a centre for aerospace, automobiles, machine tools, electric vehicles and biotech. It possesses the unbeatable combination of hi-tech technology and outstanding workforce. We’re in the process of setting up Global Manufacturing Clusters in North Karnataka — toys in Koppal; textiles in Ballari; FMCG in Hubballi; solar power goods in Kalaburagi and agricultural implements in Bidar,” he said.

Sadananda Gowda said his ministry is setting up a Drug Park at a cost of Rs 100 crore in Yadgir.

Union parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi said, “Karnataka ranks third in FDI destination in the country. Hubballi is a major industrial town in North Karnataka located strategically on Golden Quadrilateral NH-4 which is also the Mumbai-Bengaluru Industrial Corridor.”

Minister of state for railways Suresh Angadi said development of the eight-lane road from Pune to Bengaluru will promote intra- and inter-state business and promote business and commercial activities in Hubballi-Dharwad. “We’re working on ensuring rail connectivity to the last mile. For example, a train between Hubballi and Mangaluru will connect us to the coastal region, which, in turn, will boost economic activities. Projects like the Belagavi-Pune train from Hubballi and the new Belagavi-Kittur-Dharwad line have been proposed,” he added.

Large and medium scale industry minister Jagadish Shettar said the new industry policy 2019-24 will give preference for industrial development in tier-2 and tier-3 cities of the state. “When we went to Mumbai, Hyderabad, Guwahati and other cities to invite investors, many asked, ‘Where is Hubballi?’ Many industrialists want to set up units only in and around Bengaluru. We convinced them to come to tier-2 cities of North Karnataka like Hubballi-Dharwad, Belagavi, Kalaburagi, Bidar, and they’re thinking of coming here,” he said.

Ministers Basavaraj Bommai, CC Patil, MPs Prabhakar Kore, Shivakumar Udasi, Bhagavant Khooba and many elected representatives, industrialists from across the country and officials were present on the occasion.

Title: ‘CM should learn to appreciate’
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Panaji: Ridiculing chief minister Pramod Sawant ’s reaction to Aam Aadmi Party’s ( AAP ) win in the national capital, the state wing of the party said that the chief minister should learn to appreciate good in others.

“Chief minister should introspect his mismanagement of state finances and the severe strictures passed by the CAG against BJP government that has been ruling the state since eight years. He should learn to appreciate good in others,” AAP state general secretary Pradeep Padgaonkar said, who, along with the state convenor Elvis Gomes have been invited to attend the swearing-in of Arvind Kejriwal in Delhi.

Title: Man murdered by relative, body burnt to cover up incident
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Madurai: A 28-year-old man from a village near Thirumangalam was murdered and his body burnt by his parents and relatives to cover up the incident.

Police sources said the victim, M Suresh from Parapatti village was a drunkard and used to often pick up quarrels under the influence of alcohol. His wife had deserted him. On Thursday evening, Suresh had picked up a quarrel with his relative Venkatesh, 38. As they fought, Suresh tried to stab Venkatesan. However, he managed to escape and in retaliation, Venkatesan beat Suresh to death.

Suresh’s parents Murugan and Revathi, his brother Perumal, friend Vairamani and one of their his relatives came to know about the incident, but nobody informed they police. They tried to cover the issue to help Venkatesan escape from punishment. So, they took the body to the village cremation ground, where they burnt it.

The Koodakovil police, which learnt about the murder , rushed to the spot and recovered the remains and conducted an inquiry.

A case was registered under Section 302 IPC -punishment for murder against Venkatesan. Others were booked under IPC Section 201 – causing disappearance of evidence of offence or giving false information to screen offender. All of them have been arrested and remanded in prison. TNN

Title: Memorial for Pulwama martyr Subramanian dedicated at Savalaperi
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Madurai: The memorial built for Pulwama martyr G Subramanian at Savalaperi, his native village near Kayathar in Tuticorin district, was dedicated to commemorate the first anniversary of his martyrdom on Friday. The 28-year-old was among more than 40 Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel killed in the suicide car bomb attack on their convoy bus by terrorists at Pulwama in Srinagar on February 14, 2019.

The mortal remains of Subramanian were laid to rest in a piece of land belonging to his family in Savalaperi. His family had built a memorial and erected a pillar in his memory there.

On Friday the memorial was dedicated by the Kayathar union chairman Manickaraja in which Subramanian’s widow Krishnaveni, his parents Ganapathi and Marudhammal and his brother Krishnamoorthi. participated. Ex-servicemen, government officials, students of the government arts and science college in Kovilpatti and public paid floral tributes to Subramanian.

“Subramanian’s death is an irreparable loss to the family. But his martyrdom has put our village Savalaperi in the world map” Krishnamoorthi told reporters. “It is moving to see youth of this region who are aspiring to join the police and defence forces place their application forms at the place where Subramanian was buried and paying respect to him,” he said.

Stating that it was Subramanian’s dream to start an academy to train young aspirants who want to join the police and defence, the family said that they will take all possible efforts to make it come true.

Meanwhile, in Kanyakumari district, actor Vijay’s fan club paid floral tributes to all the Pulwama martyrs by garlanding the pictures of the CRPF heroes in Nagercoil town. Students of various education institutions also paid tribute to the martyrs by lighting candles.

Title: Light rail transit suggested for Tirumala
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Tirupati: Hyderabad metro rail managing director NVS Reddy has suggested commissioning of light metro transit system in Tirumala to ease traffic congestion on the twin ghat roads.

Reddy met TTD chairman Y V Subba Reddy at Padmavathi guest house in Tirupati on Friday and discussed various aspects related to traffic congestion in Tirumala and Tirupati, and the beautification works to be executed from Tirupati airport near Renigunta till the temple city among other things.

Whether the light metro rail proposal will take concrete shape is a million dollar question.

It may be recalled that the Tirupati urban development authority had plans in 2014 itself to commission a mono-rail system from the RTC bus station in Tirupati all the way up to Tirumala hills at a cost of Rs 9,000 crore. However, the project was later shelved.

Title: Weight-loss pill pulled off markets: Study
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: A study conducted by the US FDA found popular weight-loss medicine Lorcaserin , which has been in use in the country for nearly seven years and was launched in India recently, increases the risk of cancer. The drug regulatory authority has, therefore, ordered its withdrawal from the market with immediate effect.

“Patient should stop taking Lorcaserin and talk to healthcare professionals about alternative medicines and weight management programmes,” stated the US FDA in its latest advisory. Lorcaserin was approved by FDA in 2012 for use with reduced-calorie diet and increased physical activity to help weight loss in adults who are obese or overweight and have weight-related medical problems.

According to the drug regulatory authority of the US, Lorcaserin works by increasing feelings of fullness, which leads to less food intake. It is available in the form of tablets (Belviq) and an extended release tablet (Belviq XR).

Dr Sujeet Jha, principal director, endocrinology, Max Hospitals, said this was the third weight-loss medicine to be banned in the past 14 years. “We have at least 50 patients who are using it. I am going to ask them to stop taking it immediately,” he said.

Dr Anoop Misra, chairman, Fortis C-DOC centre of for diabetes, metabolic diseases and endocrinology, also said that they had been using this drug to reduce weight, but were not impressed by the results. “We need better and more effective drugs since many people find it hard to lose weight. With the ban, options are fewer in India,” he added.

Obesity affects nearly one in three adults in India. Doctors said weight-loss medicines were prescribed when reduction was not achieved through diet restrictions and increased physical activity. “It is prescribed for about 12 weeks and usually leads to reduction of 5-10% of weight,” said a doctor.

Concerns over the side-effects of weight-loss medicines have been raised in the past too. In 1997, a doctor said, the US FDA had recalled fenfluramine and dexfenfluramine because of problems related to heart valve.

Apart from the weight-loss drug, people also go for bariatric surgery. The Obesity Surgery Society of India claims India has seen a 100-fold increase in weight-loss surgeries — rising from just 200-odd in 2004 to over 20,000 in 2019. The surgery involves bypassing or stapling of a portion of the stomach to reduce a person’s appetite.

Title: Railway stall major attraction at meet
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Railway stall exhibition receiving an overwhelming response

HUBBALLI: The railway stall exhibiting spare parts is receiving an overwhelming response.

Since morning, many members of small-scale industries and manufacturers of spare parts visited the railway stall and filled forms for the Rail Ancillary Components Manufacturing Park, which is proposed to come up at Kittur in Belagavi district. According to railway officials, over 70 manufacturers from Guwahati, Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra filled in their application and submitted the same.

R K Varma, senior section engineer, Hubballi division, who is looking after the spare parts pertaining to railway line, said there is a huge scope for spare parts required for laying railway lines. “For the latest design of the railway line, there is huge demand for wider-base PSC line sleepers, which are currently being supplied from Hubballi and Hosapete,” he added.

There is also demand for composite grooved rubber sole plate and combination metal liners which are being imported. “As per new design of railway line, goods trains can run 100km per hour, and can also carry more quantity of goods compared to earlier,” he added.

In another stall, KLE Society demonstrated its Rs 600 crore project of establishing a full-fledged hospital having 1,200 beds and also a medical college in Hubballi. The hospital and college is expected to come up At Bidnal. Society officials said the hospital and college will start functioning by 2023, and the work has commenced.

KIADB, Tata Hitachi and other companies have also set up their stalls at the convention venue.

Suresh Angadi, minister of state for railways, visited Aequs, a toy manufacturing cluster, and discussed about the product range. Later, he visited the railways stall and enquired about spare parts exhibited there.

Title: Short crop cycle to help reduce ecological impact
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Hyderabad: International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics ( ICRISAT ), Hyderabad launched India’s first public research facility, RapidGen on Friday with an aim to reduce the time of crop cycles.

Experts said that the facility will shorten the time to breed new crop varieties, which are relatively high yielding and more suitable to adverse environmental conditions.

“Every crop is unique in the way it responds to a set of environmental parameters. We have to mimic the right set of conditions within closed spaces to convince a plant to grow faster at high density and to reproduce quickly,” said Pooja Bhatnagar-Mathur, team leader at ICRISAT.

“A facility like this can help accelerate the cycle from a period of six to seven years to the crop completeing its whole cycle in one to two years,” she added. The facility is comprised of three installations — an area where the different crops are tested, another where the tested crops are kept in lighting controlled space, and a temperature-regulated area called polyhouse.

“With facilities like RapidGen, crop breeders can overcome the limitations of seasons and develop the future generations of a crop in a fraction of the time and cost it would take if done in fields,” said Peter Carberry, director-general, ICRISAT.

Depending on the crop and the requirements of breeding programs, researchers can scale-up their activities in either of the installations, read an official release from ICRISAT. The polyhouse, which is the largest of the three installations can be used for over 30,000 crosses in one go.

“After testing crops and preparing a protocol, these modern techniques can be accommodated into breeding programs,” said Kiran K Sharma, deputy director general-research, ICRISAT.

Title: Used oil sent to Kakinada to convert it into bio-diesel
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Madurai: Food safety department officials from Madurai dispatched the first consignment of used cooking oil collected from 222 food business operators (FBOs) from the city under Repurpose Used Cooking Oil (RUCO) scheme . Madurai district collector T G Vinay flagged off the truck carrying 15,000 litre oil to a plant in Kakinada, where the oil would be converted into bio-diesel.

Officials said that Madurai is leading all other districts in the state when it comes to implementation of RUCO scheme. On average, 250 to 300 litres of used oil is being collected per day. An agency called Anantha Oil Corporation collects the oil and pays Rs 25 per litre to FBOs. So far Rs 3.89 lakh has been paid towards it. Around 460 containers have been issued to FBO for storing oil.

Designated officer for food safety, Madurai district, Dr M Somasundaram said there is a bigger scope for this scheme in Madurai. “We have covered only 222 FBOs, who use 40 litres of oil every day. There are 100 wards in Madurai city. Considering that there are at least minimum of 10 more FBOs using 40 litres a day, the oil collected will go up by manyfold,” he said.

More shops would be brought under the scheme in the coming months. He said that even smaller FBOs, whose production of used oil per day is less than one and two litre can be brought under the scheme. Ultimately, it will help consumers as the used oil will go out of the system. It also helps the environment since most of the used oil end up being dumped into water bodies if not collected, he added.

Title: NU fetes Srivastava for getting PhD at 78
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nagpur: Shrichandra Srivastava, who created a history by doing PhD in chemistry at a ripe age of 78, was honoured with Vitthalrao Jibhkate award on Thursday, the first day of four-day international conference on ‘Advances in physical, chemical and mathematical sciences’ (ICAPCM).

The programme was hosted jointly by Nagpur University and Laxminarayan Institute of Technology at Dr Vasantrao Deshpande Hall.

The university felicitates the senior-most person with Jibhkate prize at the convocation ceremony every year. This time, the deadline to apply for the prize was January 4 for which 66-year-old Jyoti Wadhwa had already staked claim as the oldest recipient. The award was given to Wadhwa as the application of Srivastava was received on January 10.

Srivastava, who retired as senior chemist from Indian Bureau of Mines (IBM), did PhD in ‘Microwave-assisted synthesis and characterization of some ter-polymers using substituted phenols, carbamides and formaldehyde’ under the guidance of LJ Paliwal.

He was also associated with the postgraduate department of geology of Nagpur University.

An elated Srivastava told TOI that he wanted to do a doctorate quite early, but could not. He expressed gratitude for felicitating him with the prize.

Manik Salunkhe, vice-chancellor of Bharati Vidyapeeth, Pune, was the chief guest. SP Kane, vice-chancellor of Nagpur University presided while pro-VC Vinayak Deshpande was the guest of honour.

In his address, Salunkhe underlined the importance of gaining knowledge and keeping updated. “It is a fact that India is lagging behind as compared to the western countries mainly because of lack of proper industrial revolution. How to bring about a change in work culture is still a challenge,” he said.

Such events are helpful in providing better opportunities to gain knowledge as science is all about understanding nature and the world, he added.

In his presidential address, Kane spoke about the hard work put in by the university members to conduct the international conference. He said, “In just about a month’s time, the university prepared itself to host the event in which more than 1,000 delegates are participating. This is the first time the university has brought together different departments and subjects.”

In his speech, chairman of ICAPCM Govardhan Khadekar said the programme will provide an opportunity to connect better with university laboratories. The conference will conclude on Sunday.

Besides participants from all over the country, delegates from Malaysia, Philippines, South Korea and Sweden are also part of the conference.

Amruta Indurkar of the department of Marathi spoke about the background and academic excellence of Kane. In the scroll of honour, she highlighted the achievements of Kane and the progresses that the university made under his guidance.

Kane was felicitated with a shawl, shrifal and memento by Salunkhe.

VM Tangde, organizing member of ICAPCM, was felicitated by acting registrar Niraj Khaty for his untiring efforts to conduct the mega event.

The programme was conducted by Manisha Joshi and Priyanka Warnekar, professors at Priyadarshini College of Engineering. Tangde proposed a vote of thanks.

Title: Few takers for town planning schemes in Maharashtra
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Pune: Nearly 150 town planning schemes in Maharashtra, proposed by the erstwhile BJP-led government, have failed to take off.

The then government had hoped to roll-out 150 town planning schemes in the state, but the current dispensation is yet to give the necessary clearances, officials in the know said. “The realty sector is not looking up and the cash-strapped state government is keen on focusing other schemes,” one official said.

The plan was further hobbled by the lack of interest showed by the civic bodies in the state. Senior town planning department officials said that while the previous government had directed 27 municipal corporations and 250 municipal councils to come up with proposals — on the lines of the Mann-Mhalunge scheme — only a handful have shown interest as the current government is yet to issue directions on the same. “Only Pune Municipal Corporation, Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation, Kalyan-Dombivli Municipal Corporation, Mumbai Metropolitan Regional Development Authority, Pune Metropolitan Regional Development Authority and Nagpur Municipal Corporation have responded,” a top government official said.

The official added the government would clear the proposals as and when the local authority submits one. However, some analysts said the process may not be as clear-cut. “The slowdown in the announcement of more schemes could also be attributed to the amount of time it consumes — from the announcement of the schemes to checking for the land ownership, it is a lengthy process,” another analyst said.
