Thereafter, the pumps needed to be changed as even their discharge capacity has reached its limit. Actually, the entire water supply system needs to be overhauled,” he said.

Many places in E ward do not receive water and the citizens lean on private bore wells to take them through the dry days. The two elevated reservoirs in the E ward have never been used.

As per the norms, the water pressure should be such that supply takes place through taps that are three feet above ground level. However, citizens have to use electric motors to lift water.

Pranil Maniyar, resident of Ruikar Colony, said they receive water from 4am to 8am. “The supply is at very low pressure. Water has to be pumped with the help of electric motors even to reach up to first floor,” she said.

Also, the number of water connections to the main pipeline passing from Shingnapur scheme is increasing. At present, the E ward has 36,139 metered connections, while according to a primary estimate of the officials, the number of illegal connections is over 5,000.

Corporator Satyajeet Kadam of Tararani Aghadi said, “The Shingnapur scheme was developed exclusively to supply water to E ward. However, the water is withdrawn from the pipes before it reaches the localities in E ward. The water supply network is grappling with several issues.”

Title: Social welfare schemes get more funds
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Chennai: The Edappadi K Palaniswami government has increased fund allocation for the social welfare schemes by nearly 12% to continue the party’s flagship programmes.

Deputy chief minister O Panneerselvam, who presented his 10th budget on Friday, has announced a cumulative allotment of Rs 5,935 crore for welfare schemes. It is 11.8% higher than the previous budget allocation of Rs 5,305 crore.

Stating that “true to the legacy” of former chif minister J Jayalalithaa, OPS said the government was committed to securing gender parity and justice. He announced the government’s new initiative to form the Tamil Nadu working women’s hostels corporation limited as a special purpose vehicle to establish and manage women hostels in 13 places, including eight in Chennai.

Since quarter of the children below five years in the state were severely malnourished, the government has allocated Rs 483 crore more than previous year’s allocation of Rs 2,052 crore for integrated child development scheme (ICDS). It has also increased the fund for MGR noon meals scheme from Rs 1,772 crore in last year’s budget to Rs 1,863 crore. “The scheme continues to be implemented in TN to improve the nutritional statues of preschool children and to ensure a malnutrition free state,” said the deputy CM.

The government has also continued the fund allocation for marriage assistance programme (Rs 726 crore) and Amma two-wheeler scheme (Rs 250 crore), chief minister’s cradle baby scheme and girl child protection scheme (Rs 140 crore).

Title: Deo Nagar residents take on NMC over road dug up 10 months ago
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nagpur: The residents of Deo Nagar recently held a protest against Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) authorities over the condition of a road which was dug up ten months ago and kept as it is.

Recently, the tarring of road was completely removed under the pretext of laying a cement road, and loose gravel was laid on it. Thereafter, the civic contractors disappeared from the spot for over a week, thus putting the residents in lurch. In the meantime, many senior citizens, women and children skidded while driving their vehicles due to lose gravel and sustained injuries.

When residents contacted contractors, they cited that they were yet to receive cement from the NMC. They also blamed MSEDCL authorities for failure to lay cable that led to inordinate delay of ten months. Despite several complaints to the civic officials from Laxmi Nagar, the road was not repaired.

Interestingly, the area comes under mayor Sandip Joshi’s jurisdiction and even he was apprised of the situation. However, when local BJP activists came to know about the complaint, they allegedly tried to intimidate the complainants stating that no work took place during the previous Congress regime for all these years and only due to their leaders, at least some work was happening and therefore, they should keep patience.

The residents then approached Congress activists from the area with their plight. The Congress workers took them to NMC office at Laxmi Nagar under water tank and staged protests there. They also raised slogans against the civic authorities for putting the citizen’s life in danger by not repairing roads. They submitted a memorandum to the civic officials while warning them to intensify the protests, if no steps were taken immediately.

Admitting the inordinate delay, NMC’s assistant commissioner for Laxmi Nagar Zone Rajesh Bhivgade, stated that the delay was caused as MSEDCL didn’t installed their underground cables and also storm water drains wasn’t completed. “Now, we’ve completed 300 metres of cement road’s first layer and work is in full swing. We plan to complete it as soon as possible,” he assured.

According to the residents, several pits dug on the road were left unattended. “Moreover, holes were dug for installing MSEDCL’s cables, but were not filled up properly. The sand that was supposed to be used for constructing roads is left as it is, which not only blocked the regular traffic, but also led to many vehicles skidding,” they said.

When informed on Bhivgade’s statement, the residents claimed that the NMC officials swung into action only after their protests and lodging a complaint with new NMC commissioner Tukaram Mundhe, who had directed his subordinates to look into the issue.

“During rains, we faced numerous problems due to incomplete road work as rainwater used to collect in the pits. It led to mosquito menace in entire area. The contractors used to work only on few days in a month,” they said.

Title: Have changed only party flag, not stand, says MNS chief
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Aurangabad: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) president Raj Thackeray said on Friday that only the flag of his party had changed, not its original stand against Bangladeshis, Pakistani illegal migrants.

Thackeray claimed that he has not changed his stand or ideals in the past 15 years since he launched his party. He said his party had taken up many campaigns, which others didn’t dare to, despite talking about Hindutva.

“Our party has successfully campaigned against the Pakistani artists, the Bangladeshi auto-rickshaw and taxi drivers, who are in Mumbai. The party also spoke against use of loudspeakers at the mosques, no other party dared,” he said while speaking to the media.

Thackeray was in the city to gauge his party’s preparations ahead of the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) elections in April. His stand is being closely watched as many Shiv Sena members are unhappy with the party decision to align with the Congress and the NCP to form the government in the state.

He also criticised the Aurangabad civic body and questioned why problems like garbage and drinking water could not solved for all these years. “When we were in power in Nashik municipal corporation, we handled these problems effectively. Why can’t these problems be resolved here,” he said.

Shiv Sena has been in power in Aurangabad for almost 30 years. The MNS chief has scheduled a number of meetings with party workers and the new entrant in the city during his stay.

Meanwhile, Suhas Dashrathe, a former district unit Shiv Sena president, joined the MNS in Thackeray’s presence. His entry would bolster the chances of MNS in civic polls scheduled in April this year.

City’s name change

MNS chief Raj Thackeray said there was nothing wrong in the plans of the state government to change the name of the city from Aurangabad to Sambhajinagar

Title: Engineer who certified Bhopal station foot-bridge ramp safe suspended
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Repair work of the bridge ramp underway at Bhopal station on Friday

BHOPAL: A day after the collapse of a concrete slab on the foot-bridge ramp at Bhopal railway station leaving eight injured, railways have suspended an engineer who had certified the bridge as safe and useable in March 2019.

The general manager (WCR), Shailendra Kumar inspected the Bhopal station and reviewed the situation. During the inspection, Kumar also took up the issue of the need for constructing another FoB at the station with the railway officials. Railway officials said injured passengers being treated at a private hospital are recovering fast.

The GM after inspecting the site ordered suspension of engineer BK Mishra.

A section of a footbridge ramp at Bhopal station — certified safe less than a year ago — collapsed on Thursday morning, sending eight passengers plunging 20 feet to the platform below. Meanwhile, repair work at the Bhopal station was also started in the morning.

During the inspection, Mishra visited all platforms. He said, “In-charge of the bridge who gave the last inspection report has been suspended. He will be suspended till the probe committee submits its report.” A senior administrative grade level committee is probing the accident. The committee has been asked to submit its report at the earliest. About the inspection, he said, “I came here to find out ways to regulate traffic at Bhopal railway station.”

He disclosed that an action plan is being prepared for better security and safety of passengers at the station. “The plan will be implemented in next 2-3 days,” he added.

After inspecting Bhopal station GM Kumar visited the hospital where the accident victims are being treated. He directed the railway officials to make available everything required for their fast recovery.

Meanwhile, the repair work of the ramp was also started. This time railways do not want to take any risk as extra steel support are being placed under the concrete to reinforce the ramp. Sources said steel reinforcements will be placed under all the ramps at the Bhopal station in the next couple of days.

DRM Bhopal Uday Borwanker told TOI that the priority is to strengthen the available foot-bridge structure. “As the bridge is almost 30-years-old the need of another FoB was also felt at the Bhopal station. We have discussed about its modalities,” said Borwanker.

Regarding the ramp closed from platform no-1 at the newly-constructed foot-bridge, Borwanker said, “We will try to open it for the passengers’ soon.” As the construction work is underway at the platform no-1 the ramp has been closed due to which the passengers coming from platform no-6 have to get down at platform no-2 and 3 and are supposed to take the old ramp and foot-bridge to get to platform no 1.

The 50-ft-long ramp, built in 1992, was certified safe in March 2019 by a high-level railways inspection team. The Sampark Kranti pulled into platform 2 around 9am. A group of 40 members of a family from Bhopal alighted and joined the crowd jostling up the ramp towards the foot over-bridge. At 9.10am, the section connected to the footbridge caved in, taking down eight to 10 people.

CCTV footage of the incident shows a cloud of smoke rise as the ramp slab crashes. Concrete beams and iron supports lie on the ground as passengers — some still holding plates of samosa or poha in one hand — race to save those trapped.

Title: Karnataka: Two police teams to probe Mercedes crash near Ballari
Content:
Two persons were killed and three injured in the Mercedes crash case

Where is Sharath Ashoka?

By: Shreyas HS & HM Mahendra KumarBALLARI: Under pressure, Ballari police on Friday set up two teams to investigate Monday’s Mercedes car crash on National Highway 50.Officials said one team will probe if revenue minister R Ashoka ’s son Sharath was present in the car.The postmortem on Sachin, a passenger in the car who died in the impact of the accident, was conducted around midnight at Hospet Government Hospital, indicating pressure on police officers and doctors. “Postmortems in government hospitals are conducted usually in the day. They are performed in the night only in special cases,” a source explained.Ballari additional superintendent of police BN Lavanya defended the police action and said, “In normal course, police don’t let off the driver. They do (let off) if doctors suggest they need to be shifted to a hospital in case of grievous injuries.”Asked why the doctors performed the postmortem in the night, she said: “You should ask the doctors. We in the (police) department obey the SP.”After handing over a cheque of Rs 50,000 to the kin of Ravi Naik, an 18-year-old construction worker from Mandya who was knocked down dead by the speeding Mercedes on National Highway, Hagaribommanahalli Congress MLA Bheema Naik said, “Conducting autopsy in the night is against the law. I’ll urge the chief minister and the home minister to conduct an impartial investigation into it.”He said the Hospet hospital has 16 CCTV cameras, but its authorities have refused to share footage with him. “All this raises several questions,” he said.Bharathi Bai, who works at a private hospital in Hospet, said: “Unidentified youths brought in an injured person to our hospital, but doctors refused to offer him treatment since it was a case of accident. Later, they took him to a government hospital. I can identify the youths.”Was Karnataka revenue minister R Ashoka’s son Sharath badly injured in the accident involving a Mercedes Benz that killed two persons on a national highway in Ballari district?As Ballari police personnel question the accused in the case, they are also trying to ascertain if the family and friends of those involved in the crash are still holding on to some facts and the exact roles played by the occupants of the car that crashed on Monday afternoon.Sleuths want to know why isn’t Ashoka asking Sharath to show up in public to clear the air on the controversy.Rahul, the prime suspect as per the police FIR, could face charges of misleading the police for his claim that he was driving the car at the time of accident. “We are investigating the reasons why the family isn’t revealing Sharath’s whereabouts,” a police inspector, part of the probe team, said.Senior police officers said Sharath’s presence in the car could be ascertained by tracking his mobile number’s activity on Monday.A police officer said the car’s airbag that opened in the accident could offer vital clues since the driver is impacted on his body or face in what’s called silicon bite or air-bag scrap. “Going by nature of injuries, one could find out who was possibly at the wheel,” he added.Eyewitness and police accounts said the Mercedes took the full impact, rolled over twice before crashing into a tea kiosk.In Video: Bengaluru car crash: Cops shielding Karnataka minister R Ashoka’s son?

Title: Government committed to give land titles in illegal colonies: Hardeep Singh Puri
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Hardeep Singh Puri

NEW DELHI: Over 150 families living in unauthorised colonies in Delhi have received ownership rights till date , Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri said on Friday as he handed over the documents to 34 property owners in his office. Puri said the government’s commitment to give land titles to people living in these colonies had nothing to do with the Delhi elections.

Puri told reporters, “Twenty people were given the conveyance deeds on January 3, today (Friday) 34 more got it. And, during the election period about 100 people had been given (the document) by the DDA authorities.” He added that the scheme was on even during the election campaign and had never stopped.

“Due permission was taken from poll authorities to give the conveyance deeds during the poll period, as this scheme had been announced before the model code of conduct came into force,” he said. Puri did not take any question on the BJP’s poll loss in the capital.

Sources said with the assembly election over, the housing ministry will soon bring the Model Tenancy Act before the Cabinet for its approval.

Title: Huge cache of weapons seized in Jodhpur, 8 held
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Jodhpur: Police on Friday arrested eight persons, including a juvenile and seized 18 pistols from them along with 21 live cartridges and two magazines. All these persons were arrested from different parts of the city by the police teams of six police stations of commissionerate.

Those arrested included Mukesh Solanki, a resident of Devas in MP, a supplier of the arms, who had reached Jodhpur on Friday early morning by bus with this cache of arms for supplying them to various persons.

Police commissioner Prafull Kumar said that Solanki was on the radar of the police following interrogation of those dealing illegal and country-made arms.

“We learnt that Solanki has reached Jodhpur with a huge cache of arms and supplying them to his contacts,” said Kumar.

After arresting him from Mandore garden with six pistols, police arrested remaining seven persons from different parts of the city on the basis of the information provided by Solanki.

Kumar said that Solanki is a big supplier of the arms from MP and has different social media groups for different states for supplying of the arms.

“With the help of these groups, he had come into contact with a similar group from Rajasthan run by one Manoj, who connected him to local suppliers of arms in Jodhpur,” said Kumar.

Solanki has come to Jodhpur earlier also and supplied the arms to many persons. Police have now been trying to get to these buyers.

This is the second breakthrough of the Jodhpur police in a week when the police has arrested eight persons along with arms. On February 9 also, eight persons had been arrested and 11 illegal weapons had been recovered from them. The illegal weapons include pistols, revolver and country-made pistols apart from 17 live cartridges.

Title: Maharashtra: Woman held for lodging ‘false’ complaint
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

Aurangabad: The Jawaharnagar police, probing a case human trafficking, have arrested a woman after the investigation officer found that her mother lodged a false complaint .

“The woman was actually unhappy with the fact that she was not paid the promised cash amount for marrying a man in another state,” said police on Friday.

On September 17, 2019, police had registered a missing case, before adding sections of IPC 370 (trafficking, sexual exploitation), 420 (cheating) and 120B (criminal conspiracy) against nine suspects and arrested them.

Police swung into action and rescued the 25-year old woman from Makla village of Mahidpur tehsil in Ujjan, Madhya Pradesh.

As per the complaint, the woman along with another, a relative, were sold in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan after taking them there on the pretext of job. However, the probe revealed that the women were aware of the fact that they would have to temporarily stay with the men they were being married to and flee as and when they found an opportunity.

The probe has revealed that both the women were sold for Rs 1 lakh each to different men. Out of this amount, the duo were supposed to get Rs 10,000 each.

It was after the 25-year old woman, who is already married and has two children, neither got the promised amount nor was able to flee that her mother lodged a complaint, said police.

Assistant inspector Shraddha Vaydande said the accused, including Ranjanabai Jogdand (48), Jijabai Shinde (60) and Shivaji Dhanedar (58), during their custodial interrogation claimed that the women sold in other states were part of the racket, but police refused to believe them.

“However, it was after rescuing the second woman from Rajasthan, the picture became clear, following which the woman who was rescued from Madhya Pradesh came to be arrested for being part of the racket and also for misleading police.”

Title: Matang community demands speedy trail of murder cases
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Aurangabad: The members of the Matang community took out a rally to the divisional commissionerate demanding speedy trial of the accused involved in the rape and murder of women at Nanded, Akola, Sillod, Hinganwadi in a fast track court and the culprits be hanged within six months.

They also demanded Bharat Ratna for Annabhau Sathe.

The community, that took out the rally under the aegis of Matang Kranti Morcha, expressed their anger and grief over the way women of Matang community were being subjected to cruelties like rape and murder.

Kamlesh Chandane, who was among those who led the rally, said that apart from the Dalits and Matang, women from other castes and communities were targeted and the culprits do not fear the law. The police have failed to keep a check on these people, he added

He said the community has made a representation to the government through the divisional commissioner also demanding that the next kin of the victims should be provided government job and Rs 10 lakh assistance.

The other demands include adequate compensation to the community members whose land was acquired for the extension and development of the Ghrushneshwar temple at Ellora and Rs 1000 crore provision for the LokShahir Annabau Sathe Corporation and that the government should accept the 67 recommendations made by the Lahuji Vastad Salve Commission.

Title: Amid protests, NMC sends list of 315 surplus teachers to state
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nagpur: Amid strong protests from office bearers and unions, the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has sent a list of 315 surplus teachers for absorption in state’s education department, as a step towards reducing high administrative expense. Mayor Sandip Joshi said the decision will not have much impact as the state government too has surplus teachers.

The cash-strapped NMC has been bearing financial burden of over Rs20 crore per annum on salaries and other benefits of 315 surplus teachers for last six years. Municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe learnt about this during a review meeting of NMC education department and directed officials to send the list to state’s education department.

Accordingly, Mundhe approved the list and NMC education officer Priti Mishrikotkar on Friday sent the list to deputy director of education department Satish Mendhe. Now, the state’s education department will start absorbing NMC’s surplus teachers in government-aided and zilla parishad-run schools, in case there are vacancies. The teachers can be absorbed in other districts in case there are no vacancies in the district and paucity of teachers in other districts.

Joshi added, “NMC has large number of vacancies in other departments. Surplus teachers should have been absorbed in NMC itself. They were recruited by NMC so they and their families were never a burden,” he said.

Joshi, leader of opposition Tanaji Wanve and corporators from all political parties had taken a decision to support surplus teachers.

The list comprises 255 teachers from Marathi medium, 33 from Hindi, 8 from Urdu (all from primary section), and 19 from secondary section.

President of Nagpur Mahanagarpalika Shikshak Sangh Rajesh Gavre said the move was unjust to teachers. “Education department sought suggestions/objections from teachers within 24 hours, which should have been atleast 15 days. Department was supposed to hear all, which too was avoided. I requested thrice the office of municipal commissioner to meet and hold discussions but got no time. Any decision before giving chance to atleast hear is bad in law. Therefore, we are left with no option other than to approach court,” he said.

The NMC’s large number of schools had shut down with decrease in number of students so 315 teachers became surplus as per state government’s students-teachers ratio.

Title: Mumbai: Cupid strikes in the winter of life
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Senior citizens dance at a V-Day function at Shivaji Park on Friday

MUMBAI: As Suresh Saoji (84) serenaded his wife on wobbly knees in full public view at Shivaji Park , Suman (82) blushed. As the elderly couple danced to the tunes of old Hindi film songs, a crowd of senior citizens cheered them on. The Saojis were among a mix of elderly persons who had gathered at Aajee-Aazobaa Udyaan to celebrate Valentine’s Day for senior citizens on Friday morning. The garden, usually a quiet spot at the buzzing maidan, was adorned with red heart-shaped balloons and there was frenetic activity around.

Organised by HelpAge India, the aim of the event was to hammer out a message to children and youngsters that Valentine’s Day is not just romance between young people, said Prakash Borgaonkar, director of HelpAge India. “We wanted to change the clichéd idea that Valentine’s Day is only for young lovers. Our aim was to tell youngsters that even your grandparents can be your Valentine,” said Borgaonkar.

So, children from Ryan International School, Chembur, came face-to-face with the elderly. As the kids belted out songs, grey-haired couples danced while others in the audience gently swayed their heads to the flow of music.

Mahim resident Deepa Govekar said she could not have missed the V-Day event. “I come to the garden regularly to take walks and use the gym equipment here,” she said. “Today, of course, it was special due to Valentine’s Day celebrations.” Chief guests, TV actors Dr Girish Oak and Nivedita Saraf, protagonists of a Marathi serial that centres on the lives of senior citizens, shared anecdotes of the hardship of the aged.

Among the crowd was Dadar resident Shashikant Naik (87), who hobbled around the garden with a walking stick and a cloth bag slung across his shoulder. “I come here regularly to spend time with people of my age. And it charges me mentally,” said Naik, a widower.

At the end of the morning, HelpAge India had a message for the elderly. “Ageing does not mean all is over,” Borgaonkar told the crowd. “In fact, it’s just the beginning. Live every day with love. Let each day be Valentine’s Day.”

Title: Parties publishing candidates’ criminal cases of little use: Analysts
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

BENGALURU: Political analysts say the Supreme Court’s order to parties, instructing them to publish the entire criminal history of candidates, is a step in the right direction but it is unlikely to clear up the system.

They say the only way forward is either for voters to show zero tolerance for candidates with criminal antecedents, or parties to stay clear of fielding such candidates.

“We welcome the SC order, but it is just a step,” said L Vasudev Murthy, an educationist from Bengaluru. “Unless political parties stand up and decide against fielding candidates with criminal background, no amount of legislation will help contain the menace.”

The SC on Thursday ordered political parties to publish the criminal history of candidates for assembly and Lok Sabha elections along with reasons that forced them to field “suspected criminals over decent people”.

The information must be published in a local as well as a national newspaper besides the parties’ social media handles within 48 hours of selection of candidates or less than two weeks before the first date for filing of nominations, whichever is earlier.

“This information [criminal cases] is already out there in public domain and publishing it again will be of little use,” said Trilochan Shastry of Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR). “It will not solve the problem of criminalisation of politics. However, the Supreme Court seems to feel that it cannot go beyond this step.”

ADR, a body which aims to improve governance and strengthen democracy through electoral and political reforms, has been creating awareness among voters by publishing criminals antecedents of candidates. The information is sourced from candidates’ sworn affidavits.

However, AT Ramaswamy, JD(S) MLA, who has been fighting against encroachment of government land, welcomed the move while expressing hope that it will address the problem to some extent.

“Currently, all candidates declare cases filed against them in their election affidavits, but not many people know about it,” Ramaswamy said. “Now, the onus is on political parties to explain to people why they gave a ticket to a candidate with criminal antecedents. So, parties will have to be careful while selecting candidates. I welcome the SC order.”

Title: Edu dept: Permission must for holding students’ rally
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kolhapur: The deputy education director of education, Kolhapur, in a letter, directed all the schools in the region to take prior permission from its office, education officer and also from an administrative officer of the municipal corporation before involving students in any kind of political rally or rally-like activity.

The deputy education director office has issued a letter to the education officers on February 12, asking them to convey the communication to the schools across the district.

He has also asked the schools to take prior consent of the parents and parent-teachers’ association before involving students in rallies.

Headmasters flouting the said instructions will be liable for the disciplinary action, the letter added.

The action was taken after a complaint in this regard was filed by the Kolhapur City and District Citizens’ Action Committee (KCDCAC).

The committee members highlighted the matter to the deputy education director S D Sonawane, following which he issued the letter.

Ramesh More, member of KCDCAC, told TOI, “It has been learned that students are being used as a political tool in various rallies which is affecting their studies. These students are mostly from the government-run schools like zilla parishad and civic schools. They are made to stand for hours or to walk long distances for no apparent reason. These rallies have nothing to do with academics.”

He said that one would not see students from private schools in such rallies as these schools do not indulge in any such activities; however, the students from the civic or ZP schools are literally ‘used’ for gaining political mileage.

“It has been observed that students from Classes IV to VII are generally seen for some official programs or happenings for the government as well as private agitations or demonstrations, which should not be permitted at all,” he said.

Title: Madhya Pradesh chalks out policy to regulate preschools
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

BHOPAL: Madhya Pradesh government has finally framed a preschool education policy to regulate pre-schooling in government as well as private schools. The policy has been framed by women and child development department. As a part of this policy, private schools would also be made responsible for growth, monitoring, nutrition and immunization of kids.

In government pre-schools, run by anganwadi centres, the government has outlined the syllabus and activities to take place in the year with complete timetable. Its pilot project has already begun in 313 identified anganwadis. As the next step, private preschools would be asked to register with the women and child welfare department.

Sources informed that government does not wish to regulate fee and syllabus of private preschools at this stage, but wants to ensure that all preschools share students’ data and health conditions with the government. Officials, requesting anonymity, said there was no preschool policy in the state till now. Maharashtra government also expressed the desire to follow the same in a meeting of officials held between the two states recently.

Going by the official record, there are 40 lakh children between 3 and 6 years of age and 35 lakh kids between 6 months and 3 years in the state. As per the state government business rules, newborn to six-year-old kids are taken care of by the women and child development department and from class one onwards, the students come under the school education department.

Training of anganwadi workers has been done, especially to promote and nurture the preschooling process. Women and child development minister Imarti Devi said, “This preschool policy has been introduced in the state to ensure that all the children, rich or poor, get good preschool education.”

Officials said in the preschools at anganwadi centres, known as Bal Shiksha Kendra, the students would be given certificates; syllabus would be on par with the private schools and will be changed as per the needs. A month-wise syllabus for 19 subjects has been prescribed for children between three and six years at anganwadis. It also covers topics like self-identification, my home, personal hygiene, colours and images, temperature and environment, animals and birds, means of transport, safety rules, helpful weather, children's confidence and our festivals.

Apart from education, students would be taught basic manners, especially giving respect to their parents.

Title: Father-in-law sent to jail for raping woman in Jhalawar
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kota: A court on Friday sent a 45-year-old man to judicial custody for raping his 20-year-old daughter-in-law in agriculture field in Laxmipura village under Dangipur police station of Jhalawar district on last Sunday.

The court also sent the rape survivor’s husband to judicial custody for having thrashed and burnt her with iron tongs to force her to shut her mouth about the act by his father.

Dangipur police station SHO Radhakishan said that the woman along with her parents lodged a rape case against her father-in-law . She also filed a case against her husband for beating up and burning her with iron tongs, he said.

Radhakishan said, the woman in her complaint alleged that her father-in-law on last Sunday night took her to their agriculture field on the pretext of watering the crop and raped her. After reaching home, she narrated the ordeal to her husband, who instead of going to the police station to lodge a case, thrashed her and burnt her with hot kitchen iron tongs and asked her to keep her mouth shut on the incident following which she left for her parent’s home the next day. She returned to her in-law’s village with her parents to lodge a case in police station on Tuesday, the SHO said.

After police filed cases, both the accused fled, however, they were arrested on Thursday and produced before the court on Friday.

The medical examination upon the rape survivor was conducted and further investigation into the matter is underway, he further said.

Title: Told to be ready for evacuation next week, says Ashwini
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kolhapur: Satara woman Ashwini Patil, who is stranded in Wuhan city, the epicenter of coronavirus, has been told by the Indian embassy to be ready for the evacuation by mid next week, she told TOI from Wuhan.

She said that she has run out of her supply and was struggling to go out to collect groceries from the supermarket.

She said that she got a call from the embassy officials on Thursday and was asked to be ready for the evacuation by mid next week.

“The embassy officials told me that they are planning an evacuation for 90-100 other stranded Indians in Wuhan and the surrounding region. They have instructed us to carry a few belongings during the travel, as the necessary things will be provided by the embassy,” she said.

She added that the officials also took note of her current grocery availability and promised to make arrangements in case of current stock get over.Wuhan city is in lockdown mode since January 23 and all the routine activities including transportation etc have been suspended until further notice.

Ashwini, who had shifted to Wuhan in June 2019, with her Polish husband Alan Goldmann, is alone there. Her husband developed an ear infection and had to be evacuated on an emergency basis by the Polish embassy.

She was also allowed to board the rescue plane, however, Chinese authorities did not allow her departure due to the unavailability of her passport. Her passport is stuck at visa facilitation service centre in Wuhan.

Title: Aurangabad: Mother of 2 marries youth, flees with gold ornaments
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: Kranti Chowk police have arrested a woman, who claimed to be unmarried, for allegedly cheating a youth by marrying him and fleeing with his valuables on the very next day of the marriage.

The woman has been slapped with sections 406 (criminal breach of trust) and 420 (cheating) of the IPC. Police have launched a manhunt for two of her accomplices, one of whom is a woman matrimonial agent.

Police said that Sriram Veerbhan Patil hailing from neighbouring Jalgaon district was looking for a suitable match. He came across this woman who introduced herself as a matromonial agent and assured to help him find a suitable bride from a humble background.

The agent convinced Patil to bear all the marriage expenses, following which the marriage was solemnised in Jalgaon on January 30. The woman agent and her male accomplice reportedly took Rs 1 lakh from Patil for finding him a suitable bride.

On the very next day of their marriage, Patil’s wife informed him that her mother was unwell. Accordingly, Patil and his wife reached the Central bus stand in Aurangabad to take a bus to the woman’s hometown. The woman was wearing the gold ornaments that Patil had given to her at the time of their marriage.

The woman left him on the pretext of answering nature’s call and fled away. When she did not return for a couple of hours, he started looking for her but in vain. Worried about her sudden disappearance, Patil lodged a missing complaint at Kranti chowk police station.

Taking serious cognizance of a newly-wed woman mysteriously missing from the Central bus stand, police launched a hunt for the woman and found that she had returned to her native place.

Preliminary investigation has revealed that the woman was not only married but also a mother of two children. She was part of a racket whose modus operandi is cheating people like she duped Patil. Police said that soon after knowing about her arrest, the woman’s accomplices have reportedly gone underground.

Police have also recovered the gold ornaments and the cash that she had taken with her while fleeing from Patil.

Title: HC questions atrocity charge in Narol fire case
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Ahmedabad: The Gujarat high court on Friday raised a question about the invocation of atrocity charges against the promoters and employees of Nandan Denim Ltd in Narol, where a unit caught fire resulting in the deaths of seven employees last week.

Three accused persons – company director P K Sharma, general manager of the shirting division B C Patel and fire safety officer Ravikant Sinha – approached the high court seeking the quashing of the FIR filed against them in connection with the fire.

They claimed innocence and objected to the invocation of charges under Sections 304 and 114 of the IPC, for culpable homicide not amounting to murder and abetment. They also objected to the invocation of atrocity laws against them, merely because one of the seven persons killed belonged to a scheduled caste.

tnn

Title: Firm with links to Sasikala moves HC against I-T action
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Chennai: One more firm, accused by I-T officials of being a ‘benami’ of V K Sasikala , close aide of the late chief minister J Jayalalithaa, has approached the Madras high court to quash attachment of its shares in ‘Perambur Spectrum Mall’ under the Prohibition of Benami Property Transactions Act.

Chennai-based Ganga Foundations Private Limited has been accused by the income tax department of acting as benami of Sasikala by putting to use Rs 130 crore received from her in demonetised currency.

On January 20, the deputy commissioner of income tax (Benami Prohibition), Chennai, passed an order under section 24(4) of the Act confirming the provisional attachment of 65% shares held by the company in the mall. The issue pertains to I-T raids in November 2017 on the premises of the company consequent to a separate search conducted at various places connected to Sasikala. During the search, various documents were seized and statement was recorded from S Senthil Kumar, managing director of the company. Based on the material, the department initiated proceedings against the company under the Benami Act, resulting in attachment of its shares in the mall.

Challenging the attachment order, the company has moved the present plea.

When the plea came up for hearing before Justice Anita Sumanth, the petitioner contended that the entire proceeding is based against a ‘commercial transaction’ which was not complete due to unforeseen circumstance and that it in no way could be called a benami transaction.

Representing the department, advocate A P Srinivas sought time to get instructions from the authorities concerned. Recording the same, the court directed the department to file its counter by March 6.

According to the petitioner, Spectrum Mall was a joint venture between the company and the land owners in which the company was holding 65% of shares. As the company was burdened with the interest on the borrowings from the bank, it decided to dispose of the property in 2016. Meanwhile, advocate S Senthil claiming to be negotiating on behalf of Jayalalithaa proposed to buy the property. The price was finalised as Rs 192.50 crore. In the meantime, demonetisation of Rs 500 and Rs 1,000 denominations came into effect. In December 2016, the company was forced to sign a memorandum and to accept Rs 130 crore in demonetised currency from Senthil.

Title: Rajasthan: Minor raped, video uploaded on social sites
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

Title: Thousands of govt employees boycott work, hit the streets over promotion
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Dehradun: Most government offices wore a deserted look on Friday as employees boycotted work to stage a march in favour of the demand to restart the departmental promotion committee (DPC) meeting and follow the Supreme Court order on the issue of reservation in promotions.

Under the umbrella of over a dozen associations of the government employees of different departments, thousands of government staff members gathered at Parade Ground on Friday and walked towards the secretariat building, where they met chief secretary Utpal Kumar Singh and put forth their demands.

The protesters also announced to hold a protest along with their family members on February 20. Few days ago, employees had set ablaze an effigy of Congress party and Rahul Gandhi for the latter's remarks on the issue of reservation in promotion in government jobs.

Speaking about the stir, Deepak Joshi, who heads the association of secretariat employees and is also the chairperson of Uttarakhand General-OBC Employees' Association, said, “We put forth our demands to the chief secretary. A memorandum addressed to the chief minister was also handed over to the chief secretary.”

He added that “despite the Supreme Court order on the issue of reservation in promotion on February 7 this year, the state government has yet not revoked its order of September 11, 2019 through which it had stopped promotion in government jobs.”

Joshi said that before the issue takes a “political colour” and is delayed further, the order needs to be taken back. “Many government employees have been deprived of promotion in the past few months and justice should not be denied to them,” he added.

Virendra Singh Gosain, general secretary of Uttarakhand General-OBC Employees Association, said that the new reservation roster for the government jobs needs to be followed. “The protest was called as no action was taken in the issue of promotion of government employees even though the apex court had given its judgment on the issue a week ago,” he added.

Meanwhile, state urban development minister Madan Kaushik said that "the issue will be resolved soon." "We will look into the matter and take the required steps," he told TOI.

Title: South station redevelopment to spill over into GCDA land
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Two buildings are to be built on the western wing of the station after demolishing the existing structure hous... Read More

KOCHI: The ambitious Rs 500 crore project for developing the Ernakulam Junction railway station complex has been set in motion. Rail Land Development Authority (RLDA) has approached Greater Cochin Development Authority (GCDA) for acquisition of its land on the eastern margins of the station.

The land will be developed to improve passenger amenities and the road network to the station. “We received a letter from RLDA today. We will hold a meeting to discuss their demand,” said V Salim, GCDA chairman.

RLDA’s chairman and senior officials had visited the station a month back, following which Kerala Industrial Technical Consultancy Organisation (Kitco), the consultant, was asked to redesign the project. GCDA was approached after the revised plan brought land belonging to it into the picture. The project now also involves a new four-storey building, to come up on GCDA land, providing more amenities to passengers who enter the station from Karshaka Road.

“We will share the redesign with Southern Railways next week. Once they accept the project, we will work out the financial valuation. This will be submitted to the Niti Aayog for approval. The Aayog has already given us in-principle approval for moving ahead with the revised plan,” said RLDA vice-chairman Ved Prakash Dudeja.

We have written to GCDA for their land. Railway land will be used to develop the road network, which is now just a narrow stretch. The existing building will remain and we will develop it as an independent second entry to the station,” he said.

Two buildings are to be built on the western wing of the station after demolishing of the existing structure housing offices and ticket counters. The old quarters will be razed to make way for a six-storey commercial building. All the mandatory railway infrastructure and passenger amenities will be part of the main building, which will be a five-storied one. The remaining spaces in the main building will be for commercial use. The development on the western end was part of the original plan

The existing car park to the east of the station is spread over an acre of GCDA land.

Title: Empowering women to rise against abuse at home
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Survivors of domestic violence with e-rickshaw provided by the state government

BHOPAL: Empowering women to rise against all sorts of domestic violence and take back their lives, Gaurvi-One Stop Crisis Centre of Bhopal in collaboration with other organizations working for welfare of women, including Udaan, Action Aid etc, organised a programme ‘Bol ki lab azad hain tere’ where more than 600 survivors of domestic violence shared their stories. Public Relations Minister P C Sharma also flagged off 6 e-rickshaws that will be driven by the survivors of domestic violence.

Showing solidarity with One Billion Rising global campaign, founded by Eve Ensler, to end rape and sexual violence, the women opened up about their suffering and encouraged other women going through the same ordeal to stand for themselves. Sharing their stories, the survivors recalled some of the most harrowing incidents that they were put though and how they summed up the courage to get out of the situation.

Shivani Saini, centre-coordinator of the One Stop Crisis centre said, “We have helped the survivors get a subsidy on the e-rickshaws, so that they can drive passengers around the city and earn their living. By the end of the year, we are planning to have at least 1000 e-rickshaws and are also providing proper training to the women. Their documents and licences have also been made.”

Title: SC speeds up process of hearing pleas against death sentences
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

NEW DELHI: Against the backdrop of the growing demand for speedy decisions in cases involving heinous crimes, the Supreme Court on Friday framed a set of guidelines that mandate apex court benches to hear appeals challenging decisions of high courts confirming award of death sentences in six months. "In matters wherein the HC has confirmed/upheld death penalty, and this court has granted leave, the criminal appeals will be listed for hearing not later than six months before the three-judge bench from the date of grant of leave irrespective of the fact that the appeal is ready or not," the SC said.

The SC had admitted the appeals of the four Nirbhaya case convicts against their death sentence on March 15, 2014, and finally upheld the capital punishment on May 5, 2017.

In the Nirbhaya case, the four convicts had moved the SC challenging the March 13, 2014 decision of the HC upholding award of death sentence.

The SC stayed their execution on March 15 before finally upholding the capital punishment on May 5, 2017.

Similarly, in the case involving Sonia and Sanjeev, who had killed seven of her family members over a property dispute, the matter lingered for two years in the SC when they challenged the death sentence.

The case involving Ravi, who had raped and killed a minor girl, took nearly three years in the SC before the death penalty was commuted to imprisonment for entire life.

In the case of Shabnam, who with her lover killed six members of her family, including a 10-month-old, to grab property and to end the daily admonitions by her father, her appeal against the HC's decision confirming death sentence took the SC two years to decide.

Keeping in mind the delay in such cases, the guidelines framed by the SC said, "As soon as the special leave petition involving death penalty is filed, a communication from the SC registry may be sent... for summoning of original case records within 60 days from filing of such appeal."

After the appeals are admitted for hearing by the SC, the parties would be allowed 30 days to file any additional document. This will prevent appellants' counsel from seeking repeated adjournment of hearings. The guidelines also said if adjournment was sought in matters involving the death penalty, it would be listed before chamber judges instead of the present practice of these requests getting decided by SC registrars.

Title: NID convocation: Is March 7 the new date?
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Ahmedabad: Will 300-plus students of National Institute of Design (NID) be second time lucky at the same date a month later? If sources are to be believed, NID has internally conveyed March 7 as the new date for the convocation. The premier design institute had hastily cancelled the convocation on February 7, leaving hundreds of the students and their parents in the lurch.

An official close to the development told TOI that the institute is mulling March 7 as the new date. “It’s currently under wraps and is not communicated to the larger audience,” said the official, adding that suspense continues on the chief guest. “It’s not decided whether it would be danseuse Mallika Sarabhai, the original chief guest, or someone else.”

Officials however fear that the controversy surrounding cancellation of the convocation just four days before the big day stole some shin off the event. “Several students, now working abroad, had come only for the event along with their parents. It’s possible that many parents may give the event a miss,” said an official.

While NID officials have remained tightlipped about the reason for cancelling the convocation, sources suggested invite to Sarabhai and fear of black ribbons worn by the students in support of anti-CAA stir as some of the possibilities.

Title: Mullappally slams Pinarayi’s remarks on RSS ideologue
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kozhikode: It is a shame for a communist leader like chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan to state that late RSS ideologue P Parameshwaran was a ‘saint-like’ figure, said KPCC president Mullappally Ramachandran .

Delivering the keynote address at the Shaheen Bagh Square organised by the Muslim Youth League (MYL) here on Friday, he said there is nothing wrong in paying homage to a departed person. “But Vijayan should make it clear whether the words he wrote on Parameshwaran had come from his heart,” he said.

Mullappally said Vijayan wrote the words on Parameshwaran in his own handwriting. “Vijayan had not written on any other person in his own handwriting in the recent past,” he said.

The Congress leader reminded the Muslim community that the CPM never stood with the minorities in the country in the past. The condition of the Muslims is dismal in West Bengal where the CPM ruled for 33 years, he said.

KPCC president alleged that there is an undercurrent between Vijayan and Prime Minister Narendra Modi as is evident from the former’s handling of the issues related state police chief Loknatha Behera and governor Arif Muhammad Khan.

Mullappally claimed that his position of not going for a joint struggle with the CPM on the CAA was vindicated by the recent developments. “I was against joining hands with the CPM as I am aware of the history of the party,” he said.

The CPM considered the Muslim community only as a vote bank. The party organized beef festivals and protested when Saddam Hussein was killed only to capitalise on the Muslim sentiments, he said.

But on the ground the CPM always targeted the members of the Muslim community. The murder of Youth Congress worker Shuhaib and MSF activist Ariyil Shukkur and the riots in Nadapuram are the examples of the CPM’s anti-Muslim stand, Mullappally said.

MYL state general secretary P K Firos, KPCC vice-president T Siddique, KSU leader K M Abhijith and others attended the meeting.

Title: Cong targets BJP over Nehru-Patel remark
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Hyderabad: The Congress on Friday hit back at BJP for its comments on Sardar Vallabhai Patel’s position in the party. “Vallabhbhai Patel was a Congress leader and cabinet colleague of Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru . The BJP’s bankruptcy has been exposed. It does not have leaders of the stature of Patel on its side. It’s a shame that the saffron party is trying to claim Vallabhbhai Patel as its leader,” said TPCC vice-president Mallu Ravi. tnn

Title: Delhi: Sikh panel objects to revamp of Sheesh Mahal
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Sheesh Mahal (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC) on Saturday objected to restoration of 17th century palace—Sheesh Mahal—in north Delhi’s Shalimar Bagh , where sixth Mughal emperor Aurangzeb’s coronation took place in 1658.

Addressing a press conference, DSGMC president Manjinder Singh Sirsa and other members called the Mughal emperor “a cruel leader and a murderer,” and said that it was unfortunate that the decision to renovate the structure was taken in the 400th birth anniversary year of Guru Tegh Bahadur. “Guru Tegh Bahadur sacrificed his life against Aurangzeb’s attempts of forceful conversions. It is surprising that Aurangzeb has been glorified despite his atrocities on Sikh gurus. People need to be reminded of his bloody past, instead of glorifying things associated with him,” said Sirsa, who is also a member of Shiromani Akali Dal.

“We strongly oppose the decision to refurbish the structure with public funds. It will hurt the sentiments of lakhs of people. We will hit the streets if ASI does not take back its decision,” he added.

TOI had published a report on Thursday regarding Archaeological Survey of India (ASI)’s plans of spending Rs 2-5 crore on sprucing up the Aurangzeb’s coronation site, which lies dilapidated.

Title: Churchill running out of time
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Margao: Stanley Rozario has seen Indian football from so close for so long that he knows not everything is at it seems.

“In I-League and Indian football, anything can happen, anytime,” said Rozario, who has coached some of India’s biggest clubs like Mohun Bagan , East Bengal and Salgaocar FC, and is now guiding former champions Aizawl FC .

On the looks of it, Mohun Bagan are now the overwhelming favourites to win the I-League after opening a 11-point gap at the top of the table. But like Rozario affirmed, there is still many a slip between the cup and the lip.

“Mohun Bagan are in the driver’s seat but let’s wait and see what happens. Openings will be there till the 15th round. We cannot say who will finish on top,” said the Aizawl coach, wondering how they have been left behind by Bagan, who they held goalless in their opening game.

It’s the same with Churchill Brothers too. When Bernardo Tavares took charge of the team, his first assignment was against Bagan in Kolkata, a match Churchill won 4-2. Since then, not everything has gone according to the Portuguese coach’s plan.

“It’s difficult to work in this situation because we feel the team is working in the right direction. Not everything has gone our way. Moral victories don’t count. They don’t give you any points,” said Tavares.

Churchill have played three matches less than Bagan. But even if they win all three, they will still find themselves seven points behind the leaders. Catching up with Bagan – who visit Goa next week – won’t be easy, although Tavares maintains they must get back to winning ways, starting with the clash against Aizawl at the Nehru Stadium in Fatorda on Saturday.

“It’s important to get three points against Aizawl. They play direct football, they are a physical team and have strong strikers,” explained Tavares.

It’s not the same Aizawl who they drew 2-2 away. For the visitors, much has changed; they now have six foreigners, better understanding, and even though Rozario laughed that their best results came with just two foreign players in their rank, the inclusion of South Americans has sparked improvement.

For Churchill, it’s been a mixed bag. The team that hammered Bagan away and drubbed Neroca at home have also lost, quite inexplicably, to Indian Arrows, TRAU and Chennai City FC at home. In all three games, Churchill were the most dominant team, creating a plethora of goal-scoring chances.

“The most difficult thing is to create opportunities. If they can create, then they will score. But our last game (against Chennai) was a mix of bad luck and poor scoring. Everyone, of course, will only remember the result.

“We can now no longer make excuses that we were unlucky. We cannot say that all the time. We need to be more focused, attentive when shooting at goal. That’s also important,” said Tavares.

Churchill cannot afford to be wayward again.

ACTION TODAY

Churchill Bros FC vs Aizawl FC, Nehru Stadium, Fatorda, 5pm

Title: Smart Raj: 3 firms to get final termination notice
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Jaipur: The local self government (LSG) department has decided to serve final termination notice to three firms for failing to carry out digitisation work under the Smart Raj project .

Smart Raj project was given to three firms who had to jointly conduct digitisation work in 32 urban local bodies including seven municipalities and 25 municipal councils in the state. The digitization work included the property survey of Jaipur city which was last conducted in 2005. Firms were given contract in 2015 with a deadline of 2017 but after many extensions, till 2020 they haven’t been able to complete the project and finally government has decided to serve the termination notice.

Secretary of UDH Bhawani Singh Dehta wasn’t available for an official comment.

An officer at the LSG said that many times extensions were given to the firm. “The entire project was Rs 124 crore of which nothing was given to the firm as the work was never completed. In 2018, Smart Raj was fined as well but still they were given extension and result was same. As per the agreement they were supposed to upload the data of birth and death but they sublet it to someone who further sublet it to someone else. When the work was completed it was rejected by the municipalities as wasn’t authentic. In these five years, I believe state has bear the loss of Rs 1,000 crore that would have been gained if the project was completed but still no strict action have been taken against the firm,” said one official.

Pramod Kumar, deputy project manager of Smart Raj project said that they are not being paid by the government on time. “We are asked to present proof of our work. This is not termination and within a week we will submit a reply. Government should also give us payment on time to expect result,” said Pramod.

In the notice it is mentioned that after many extensions given to the Smart Raj project, work was not up to the mark and it was assessed either the firms were unable to complete the work or not willing to complete the work. Within 30 days they have to submit a reply or final termination of contract will be done.

Title: Making of indigenous Beast: Indian Limousine for President
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

The ‘Indianness’ of the limo, envisioned in midnight blue, is reflected in the material used for the interiors

AHMEDABAD: For many heads of state, their preferred ride not only reflects their status but also their country’s automobile prowess.

Even before US President Donald Trump visits the city, his land and aerial transport are in the news. That was the genesis of the ambitious Presidential Limousine project initiated by Kunal Kashyap, a second-year transportation and automobile design (TAD) student of NID Gandhinagar.

“We wanted automobile design philosophy rooted in India and thus Tata was a natural choice,” said Kashyap, who along with the NID team had showcased the scale model for Tata Garuda, the name of the limo given by him, at Auto Expo 2020 recently. “We got inspiration from its newer Impact 2.0 designs with the slingshot line — running from the hood and wrapping around the entire profile before coming back — and split headlamps,” Kashyap said.

The team members said that the wheels for the president should have gravitas and road presence befitting the presidential stature while ensuring safety and stability.

Kashyap added that the ‘Indianness’ of the limo, envisioned in midnight blue, is also reflected in interiors. “We chose tussar silk which is tear-proof, instead of leather for upholstery. Another material we chose is transparent wood,” said Kashyap. He said that the response from experts including Pratap Bose, the vice-president of global design at Tata Motors and an NID alumnus, is encouraging.

Other concepts also steal the show: Regin Muralidharan, another student, displayed the concept of Mahindra Rath — a three-seater luxury SUV — taking inspiration from the temple rath. Harris Raju has conceived of a futuristic flying pod for 2040 India. Sandeep Jena, their teammate, presented the concept of Mazda Tamashi, a hypercar for the LeMans race. “We had designed a VR experience. Thus, it was a double challenge to provide a 1:1 scale experience to visitors,” he said.

Title: Unified authority must to stop infra goof-ups: VNIT professor
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

NHAI and city traffic police have sought VNIT’s help to decongest traffic at the landing of the newly construc... Read More

Nagpur: The Sadar flyover landing mess is nothing but lack of coordination among city’s decision-making authorities. “There is an urgent need to form a single platform like Unified Metropolitan Transportation Authority (UMTA) to regulate roads and infrastructure projects,” said V Landge, head of civil engineering department, Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology.

The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) and city traffic police had sought VNIT’s help to decongest traffic at the landing of the newly constructed Y-shaped Sadar flyover near Kasturchand Park.

Transport planner, traffic engineer and VNIT assistant professor Udit Jain suggested two solutions — short-term and long-term — providing a curve (on left side of the flyover’s landing connecting with the road near Kasturchand Park) and make roads along Kasturchand Park one-way. Implementing one-way vehicular movement road along KP will require enforcement from traffic police.

To a query, Landge said, “No one can be blamed for the flyover’s landing mess, it is just a matter of lack of coordination.”

Learning from the haphazard infrastructure planning lapse, it is time the city gets a UMTA, said Jain. “The people, apart from all stakeholders, must be invited to express opinion while implementing an infrastructure project. Experts should take these suggestions into consideration for flawless implementation of the project,” added Landge.

Though VNIT has received a letter to share its opinion to resolve the mess, both traffic police and NHAI are not showing any further interest. “So, we have not prepared any report in this regard,” said Landge.

To this, a senior traffic cop from deputy commissioner of police Chinmay Pandit’s office said NHAI has given a letter to VNIT to conduct the study and simultaneously the city traffic police had sought permission from the divisional commissioner for the same. “Now, we are awaiting the nod,” he said.

Title: Telangana high court gives three-day extension to Numaish
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Allowing the petition filed by All India Industrial Exhibition society, Telangana High Court on Friday extended Numaish 2020 for three days.

In wake of requests from traders across India, the society on Friday noon moved a lunch-motion before Telangana High Court and sought permission to extend Numaish 2020 by three days. While considering the petition of Exhibition Society, a division bench comprising Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice Abhishek Reddy allowed it to conduct Numaish for three more days till February 18 subject to the clearance from authorities.

The court said: “However, as artisans from all over the country bring their goods to be sold on the Exhibition Ground, and since the sales have been rather slow, the society proposes to extend the functioning of the exhibition till February 18.” In December 2019, a division bench of the HC had granted permission for the Numaish- 2020 event.

Title: CM round-table with corporates brings Rs 3250 crore investment
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

CM Kamal Nath

BHOPAL: The Kamal Nath government on Friday announced investments worth Rs 3,250 crore with the potential to generate 14,000 jobs. During a daylong round-table at Delhi, CM Nath rolled out major policy initiatives for major players in textile and apparel sectors .

The Hoshangabad-based Trident group will expand its existing unit in Budhni with an investment of Rs 3,000 crore. “This will have employment generation potential for 10,000 people,” said Rajesh Rajora, principal secretary industry, after Nath’s meeting with representatives of the textile sector.

The CM announced a 60-acre plug-and-play industrial park in Badiya Khedi in Sehore district, just 28km from Bhopal airport and close to Bhopal-Indore highway.

Nath announced several measures for ease of doing business in Madhya Pradesh . “Immediate clearances and licenses will be provided for up to 40 services within seven working days,” Nath said, adding that the state will devise more incentives for manufacturing of textile and apparel from organic cotton.

“Any industry with investment of less than Rs 100 crore but employing more than 500 people will be accorded status of mega industry and will be eligible for customized package,” said the CM.

As per the existing scheme, industries with Rs 100 crore or more investment were considered mega industries for which customized package used to be approved by cabinet committee for investment promotion.

“Until now, garment units which are outside the limits of textile park or industrial parks, were not eligible for incentives under the government’s garment policy. Now, they will also be eligible for incentives offered under the garment sector package,” the CM said, promising to take up policy for incentivizing composite and integrated units in textile sector.

The government has urged private developers to come forward to develop a garment park at Barlai, 20km from Indore, on public-private-partnership model. It announced investments of Rs 100 crore and Rs 50 crore by Mayur Uniquoters and Gokaldas Exports. The two units will generate 4,000 jobs in all, Rajora said.

The announcements were made in the presence of Rajinder Gupta, chairman of Trident group, Shiva Ganpati, MD of Gokaldas Exports, and Swapnil Vyas, GM (operations) of Mayur Uniquoters. MD of Pratibha Syntex announced setting up a textile park for MSME units in Indore at an investment of Rs 100 crore.

Title: Cong woos SC, ST youth to revive its fortunes
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Hyderabad: With SC, ST and BC communities shifting their loyalties to the ruling TRS after Telangana came into being, Congress is now going the whole hog to connect with young voters of SC, ST and BC communities to revive its political fortunes.

The Congress leadership has decided to make a big issue in the wake of Supreme Court making observations to do away with quota for these communities. Sources said the party is mobilising youngsters for a maha dharna it is organising at Indira Park on February 16 in protest against moves to discontinue reservations.

SC, ST communities were once a strong votebank of Congress but have steadily moved away and begun supporting TRS in various elections the state has seen.

AICC general secretary in charge of Telangana RC Khuntia and TPCC president N Uttam Kumar Reddy have asked party members to go to the doorsteps of SC and ST communities and interact with the family members. The party members are also meeting students from these communities in colleges and universities.

Congress is also trying to convince BCs that the ruling TRS has shown little interest in their political empowerment and had even reduced BC quota in the gram panchayat polls.

BCs comprise 52% of the total population in Telangana but its votebank is divided among political parties with a large chunk rooting for TRS. “Any step to withdraw reservations to SCs and STs will not be tolerated,” AICC secretary V Hanumanth Rao warned.

Title: COVID-19: 11 no longer under home quarantine
Content: Kozhikode: Eleven people kept under home quarantine for suspected novel coronavirus COVID-19 ) infection have been removed from observation. District medical officer Dr V Jayashree on Friday informed that so far 165 people were removed from the list of those kept under home quarantine in the district.So far, 239 people who have arrived from corona-hit countries are under home isolation. Of them, one reached Kozhikode from China on Friday.The DMO also informed that a person admitted to the isolation ward of the Beach Hospital was discharged on Friday. At present, three people — two at the Beach Hospital and one at the Kozhikode Government Medical College Hospital — have been kept under isolation ward.The DMO said results of two samples received on Friday tested negative for COVID-19 infection. She said out of the 30 samples send for test so far, 26 have tested negative.In Thrissur district, three people are under hospital-based surveillance and 196 are under home quarantine. One person was discharged on Thursday. Two fresh samples were sent for tests on Friday, an official release said.The health department sources in the district said the condition of the student, who is the first COVID-19 positive patient in the country, is improving. However, the health authorities are awaiting the test results of more samples taken from her, before taking a call on her discharge.

Title: English medium govt schools a big success: Gehlot
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Jaipur: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that the initiative to open English medium government schools in the state has been a tremendous success. By learning English, children in government schools gained confidence and stood on par with those from private schools, Gehlot said at a private school function here on Friday.

The chief minister stated that there was no dearth of talent among the Hindi-speaking people, but in today’s times, the importance of English has increased in all fields of life. “Hindi-speaking children do not get as many opportunities as those who are fluent in English,” he said.

“The government’s duty is to take decisions that benefit the common man. Keeping this in sight, our government took steps to provide quality education to children from marginalised sections. Our effort has been to provide education to every child so that s/he can progress,” Gehlot said while speaking at the Jayshree Periwal Global School in Jagatpura.

Minister for primary and secondary education Govind Singh Dotasra said the present government intends to provide quality education to every child, be it in government or private schools. “The state government wants to support private schools in tandem with the government schools to ensure access to quality education to all children,” said Dotasra.

“English medium schools have been opened in all 33 districts to provide equal opportunities to children from every section of the society. Today, 11,850 children are studying in English medium schools across Rajasthan, which is now number 2 in terms of quality education,” Dotasra said.

Chief secretary D B Gupta said that literacy rate in the state increased from a mere 8.95% in 1951 to 66.11% in 2011. “The male literacy rate stands at 79.19%, which is equivalent to the national average, but the female literacy rate is just 52.12%. Considerable efforts are needed to educate the girl child,” Gupta said.

Title: Mumbai: Get your car on 24x7 ship for Ferry Wharf-Mandwa
Content:
The first Ro-Ro ship that can carry bikes, cars and buses too arrived in Mumbai on Friday morning

MUMBAI: Mumbai’s first roll-on roll-off ( Ro-Ro ) ship, which will carry passengers along with their bikes, cars and even buses between Ferry Wharf (Bhaucha Dhakka) and Mandwa (Alibaug), arrived from Greece on Friday to a rousing welcome from the shipping fraternity.To be commissioned in the first week of March, it will probably be the country’s first big passenger-vehicle transport ship that will operate even during monsoon and thus will serve traffic 365 days and also 24x7, said MbPT chairman Sanjay Bhatia. “We have been anxiously looking forward to such a facility as we will be able to get our bikes or cars to reach Parel from Ferry Wharf instead of spending on taxis. We can also easily do late-night shifts now,” said Anamika Kulkarni, who works with a media firm at Parel and at times has to rush to catch the last boat at 6pm. Now, three others from Alibaug can join her in a car, thus saving on fuel.The ship will initially travel every three hours till the second one is introduced. As per the agreement with the contractor, Esquire Shipping, a major stakeholder in the M2M Ferries consortium, the second ship is to be brought into service once the first attains 60% occupancy in a day. Dr Anirudh Kohli, radiology department head at Breach Candy Hospital, who has a weekend home in Alibaug, said the 24x7 Ro-Ro ship is a big boon as other services shut at night and during four monsoon months.Around 10-20% of 5,000 passengers who use catamarans to Mandwa from Gateway of India daily and about 100 cars and four buses which travel to Konkan from Mumbai are expected to move to the Ro-Ro ship, say sources. The ship has a capacity for 500 passengers and 180 cars. Vehicles to Goa will save three hours travel time by ship.Aashim Mongia of M2M Ferries said, “People from Alibaug and beyond can come to Mumbai with their bikes and cars and go back. We expect to achieve our target of 60% occupancy in just two to three years or maybe even faster,” he said.In Video: Mumbai: Ro-pax service set to begin for commuters, motorists

Title: 7 migrant transgender persons arrested for creating nuisance
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kochi: Railway protection force (RPF) arrested seven transgender persons , who were found in trains without tickets, on Thursday night.

The arrested were from Assam and West Bengal . According to RPF, the transgender persons were found creating nuisance with an intention to forcefully collect money from passengers duly creating threat, using abusive words in public, causing public nuisance in train coaches and misusing the berth occupied by bona fide passengers thereby adversely affecting the travel comfort of the passengers. Some of them were even found in the upper class coaches.

They were arrested during a special drive conducted by the RPF focusing on night trains running between Ernakulam and Thrissur railway section. The arrested are Babli (23), Chumki (25) of West Bengal, Priyanka (28), Sajna (25), Basriniza (39), Kajol (20) and Swapna (24) of Assam.

They were produced before the railway magistrate on Friday at Ernakulam and the court convicted all of them to undergo five days of imprisonment with a fine of Rs10,100 each and if they are unable to pay the fine they will have to undergo imprisonment for three months and 20 days.

RPF said the transgenders persons make money by forcing passengers to pay them while travelling on train. When these transgender persons visit their natives, they come back with more people from their community.

The raid was conducted by the team of inspector A K Prince, sub-inspectors J Varghese and G Gireesh Kumar, head constable Jolly C Vincent and constable Saranya under the supervision of assistant commissioner T S Gopakumar, RPF, Ernakulam. Many raids will be continued further.

RPF requested passengers and public not to entertain transgender persons during train journeys by giving them money. If any problems arise, Passengers can complain via RPF helpline 182.

Title: Three on flight from Saudi try to smuggle 1,200gm gold in socks, caught at RGIA
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Hyderabad: Air Intelligence Unit (AIU) sleuths of the Customs department intercepted three passengers trying to smuggle gold from Jeddah to India at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport on Friday.

They were travelling on Air India flight (AI-966) from Jeddah to Hyderabad, which landed at RGI Airport at 7am. While screening the passengers, the AIU sleuths noticed that three passengers had concealed some metal objects in the socks.

“The three offenders opted for green channel indicating they were not carrying dutiable goods. When subjected to metal detector check, we found broken gold biscuits concealed by them in the socks they were wearing,” said an official. The AIU team recovered four pieces of gold together weighing 1,200 gram. The gold, of 24 carat purity, is valued at Rs 48 lakh, said an official. A case was booked against the accused under the Customs Act.

Title: Battery-operated vehicles for VIMSAR patients
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020
