Sambalpur: Patients will now be able to commute in battery-operated cars on the premises of Veer Surendra Sai Institute of Medical Sciences and Research ( VIMSAR ), Burla. The premier healthcare centre of Western Odisha received two battery operated patient transportation vehicles on Friday.

The vehicles have been procured at a cost of Rs 11.07 lakh. While Rs 10 lakh has been given by the Western Odisha Development Council (WODC), the district administration has contributed Rs 1.07 lakh. The Junior Doctors Association (JDA) of VIMSAR had demanded for the vehicles. President of JDA Sanjeev Mishra said the patients are facing lots of problems for transportation on VIMSAR premises. tnn

Title: Unscheduled power cuts before exams worries parents
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Berhampur: The unscheduled power cuts in Ganjam district has worried parents as it would affect the studies of their children slated to appear for different Class X and Class XII examinations.

The annual High School Certificate examination is slated to start from February 19 and Plus II examinations from March 3. The Class X and XII examinations, conducted by the CBSE (Central Board of Secondary Education) will start from February 20 and 15 respectively. The Class X ICSE examinations will begin from February 27.

“The frequent power cuts is affecting the studies of my son who will appear for the matriculation examination this year,” said Shantilata Mishra of Shakti Nagar. Parents are of the opinion that the power cuts should be stopped at least during examination time.

Social activist Sudhir Sabat said Southco should rethink about the unscheduled power cuts. “When there is no official announcement about the power cuts, it is unfortunate that there is no electricity for around three to four hours in different areas of the district,” he said.

Southco officials said there have been no power cuts officially. “The load shedding might be taking place in different areas due to transfer of transformers, replacement of cables and upgradation of electricity lines,” said superintendent of Southco Chandan Das. “These works are being executed under the Integrated Power Development Scheme (IPDS) and is expected to be completed by March-end,” he said.

He assured that the distribution company would ensure to continue power supply during the examination time as there is no short supply of electricity.

Title: Election for 9 standing panel members on Feb 20
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nagpur: Eight members of the Standing Committee of Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) will retire on March 1. The election of new members to replace these members will be held at the NMC general body meeting on February 20.

As per the Act, only nine members will be replaced while other eight will get a second term in the Standing Committee. Accordingly, BJP’s eight corporators and one Congress corporator will be replaced. The tenure of present standing committee chairman Pradip Pohane will also end on March 5. Many corporators from the ruling party have already started staking claiming for the coveted post.

Meanwhile, the NMC health department has submitted a proposal (to be taken up during the general body meeting) to handover maintenance of prayer hall at Gangabai ghat crematorium to a city-based NGO for five years.

The transport department too has submitted proposal seeking the house’s nod to procure 40 electric buses under central government scheme by replacing 30 standard buses received under Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Mission.

Title: Mayor, BJP corporators seek civic chief’s time to discuss issues
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nagpur: A day after municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe admitted to stopping development works, ruling party leader and BJP corporator Sandip Jadhav sought time with him to discuss issues regarding the city’s development.

On Friday, a delegation of BSP corporators met Mundhe and appealed to him to sanction their files for pending works otherwise citizens will be put to inconvenience, in the absence of basic civic amenities.

BSP corporator and party leader Vaishali Narnawre told TOI, “We informed the commissioner that already BJP-ruled NMC had given less priority and sanctioned lesser development works in our constituencies. The curbs on development works ordered by Mundhe will affect mostly cement roads in our prabhags. We asked him to review his decision.”

The civic chief replied that cement road should not be the city’s priority. The NMC’s priority is to look after sewer lines, and proper drinking water, Narnawre said.

In his letter to Mundhe, Jadhav said that in the house of 156 corporators, BJP has 112 corporators and they are receiving complaints from citizens on various issues ranging from development works, mistakes in property tax invoices to water bills.

“Being a ruling party leader, I am receiving complaints from corporators and as an elected representative, it is our duty to carry out development works and provide basic civic amenities. Under Section 63 of Maharashtra Municipal Corporation Act, it is the prime responsibility of the civic administration to ensure better amenities to the citizens,” Jadhav’s letter said.

The pending works and poor revenue collection show the administration’s apathy towards their prime duties. Jadhav also stressed on the need to resolve complaints of citizens pertaining to incorrect property tax invoices and water bills. “Even the civic chief’s Janata Darbar is receiving similar complaints, so I have requested him to spare time to meet all 112 BJP corporators to discuss these issues,” Jadhav told TOI.

Despite the financial crisis and Mundhe’s restriction to float new tenders for development works until the condition improves, the standing committee on Friday okayed two project proposals before it, including one to appoint a project management consultant (PMC) for beautification of Sakkardara lake.

Standing committee chairman Pradip Pohane said, “The PMC for beautification of Sakkardara lake will cost Rs16.71 lakh, out of state government fund of Rs8.35 crore.” Though the civic chief has stalled all works, whether or not work orders were issued, the standing committee also gave the nod to entrust M/s Santosh R Khaparkar to construct cement road under Phase-III project at a cost of Rs5.77 crore.

It also gave a nod to dispose of scrap from electrical department worth Rs97.62 lakh.

Title: As per NPR, I could land in a detention centre: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot
Content:
CM Ashok Gehlot after addressing an anti-CAA/NRC protest gathering at Shahid Smarak in city on Friday

JAIPUR: Urging the Centre to withdraw the contentious amended Citizenship Act to maintain peace and harmony in the country, chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that like many others he was not aware of the birthplace of his parents and could land in a detention centre.In a surprise move late in the evening, Gehlot reached Shahid Smarak— the city’s Shaheen Bagh where anti-CAA/NRC protesters have been staging round-the-clock dharna from February 1— and addressed the gathering.The chief minister claimed that information on birthplaces of parents was being sought for the National Population Register (NPR).“If I am not able to furnish the details, I too would be asked to live in a detention centre. But stay assured, if such situation comes then I would be the first to go there,” Gehlot told the protesters.He demanded the NDA government to “reconsider the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), which is against the spirit of the Constitution, and come forward to withdraw it so that peace and harmony can be maintained”.He assured protesters that the Congress and the state government were with them and, if required, he would be the first to go to a detention centre.He said the BJP government in Assam has refused to implement the National Register of Citizens ( NRC ).“It is the right of a government to make a law, but a government should rule as per the sentiments of the people. Like Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, protests are being held at many places across the country, including Rajasthan . The government should understand public sentiments,” he said.Several states were against CAA and have passed resolutions in assemblies. "We want the Centre to reconsider its decision,” he added.In Video: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot visits Jaipur's 'Shaheen Bagh', demands CAA rollback

Title: Kochi priest suspended over financial irregularities
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kochi: Ernakulam Angamaly Archdiocese , on Thursday, suspended Fr Prince Thykootathil , former assistant vicar of St George Forane Church , Edappally , for ‘serious breach of discipline’. Sources said the priest indulged in improper financial dealings and ‘acts unbecoming of a priest.’

As per an official statement of the archdiocese, the action was for financial mismanagement of church funds by the priest. “The action was taken after several inconsistencies were found in the accounting of money offerings received at the church, including the sum received for conducting the mass,” said Fr Paul Karedan, spokesperson of the Ernakulam-Angamaly Archdiocese in the statement.

Sources said that the vicar used to take money from priests and religious as loans and in the guise of contributing to others. An official sources said that complaints started to come up from Edapally after Fr Prince was transferred to Karukutty in Ernakulam. Several priests and parishioners alleged that he had borrowed money from them, source said. “Though we are yet to calculate the whole amount, around Rs 10 lakh is likely to be missing," an official source said.

Fr Thykootathil has been serving as assistant vicar for two years and he was in charge of the offerings money received by the church. The priest now cannot engage in any priestly affairs. Sources said that the priest has already agreed to leave behind his life as a priest and has signed a relieving letter on February 6.

Sources said that the 28-year-old priest had ‘relations’ unbecoming of a priest. “We talked to him. After finding, evidence that he was involved in 'actions unbecoming of a member of clergy', we talked to him. He expressed his willingness to leave and we are going forward with the action,” said a well-placed church official who did not wished to be named.

Meanwhile, Major Archepiscopal Vicar Archbishop Mar Antony Karayil assured the faithful that the Archdiocese takes full responsibility of the money offerings made by the faithful at the Edapally Church and it would be put to use properly.

Title: MLA, Cong min ‘wrestle’ with BJP mayor over tourney invite
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Chandrapur: A political row has erupted in the city with guardian minister Vijay Wadettiwar and independent MLA Kishor Jorgewar targeting mayor Rakhi Kancharlawar of BJP for breach of protocol in printing invitations for Mahapaur Chashak (Mayor’s Cup) wrestling tournament slated to start from Saturday.

The tournament is an annual event organized by Chandrapur Municipal Corporation. Mayor Kancharlawar this year took charge of the event and decided to grant the honour of inauguration to former Union minister Hansraj Ahir, while former state finance minister Sudhir Mungantiwar was named as president of the inaugural function.

She allegedly overruled the invitation prepared by the CMC officials as per protocol claiming that mayor has all the powers to decide in the corporation.

The invitation merely mentioned Wadettiwar as prominent attendee. Irked over this, he dashed off a letter to collector alleging breach of protocol by the mayor. Later, Wadettiwar told media persons that if mayor goes ahead with the same invitation, then cost of the event should be recovered from her, as government funds cannot be spent on programmes where protocol is breached.

Jorgewar too objected to the breach of protocol as he was not consulted before deciding the tournament dates and printing invitations. The MLA’s Young Chanda Brigade has submitted a memorandum to collector demanding action against the mayor. City Congress too protested the move and demanded to register criminal offence against Kancharlawar.

Collector Kunal Khemnar ratified that there is breach of protocol on two counts in the invitations of both inaugural as well as prize distribution programme of the tournament. “As per protocol norms, CMC is bound to ask local minister, MP and MLAs for their dates and time while deciding to hold such events and they have to be given prominent place in the programme. The invitation printed by the CMC violates both the norms. I have directed CMC commissioner Sanjay Kakade to change the invitations,” he said.

“CMC commissioner has explained that the invitation was prepared as per protocol, but the mayor on her own changed it,” said the collector.

He, however, clarified that there is no provision for registering criminal offence against political functionaries in such cases. “If anybody feels that the breach of protocol is serious and offensive, (s)he can approach court seeking action against such politicos,” said Khemnar.

Title: Rift out in open, Jyotiraditya Scindia warns Kamal Nath government of stir
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Jyotiraditya Scindia

BHOPAL: AICC general secretary Jyotiraditya Scindia took his party by surprise by vowing to hit the streets if promises made to guest teachers in the Congress Vachan Patra aren’t fulfilled. Chief minister Kamal Nath , who is in Delhi, shot back that manifesto is “for five years, not five months”.

Scindia — who has often been openly critical of the Nath government, targeting it on crop loss survey and farm loan waiver earlier — expressed solidarity with contract teachers, who are agitating against the state government for over 60 days, demanding regularization.

Addressing a rally in Niwadi district of MP on Thursday, Scindia said: “Your demand was included in the Congress manifesto. And the manifesto is sacred text for us. If all the promises in the manifesto are not fulfilled, do not think you are alone. Jyotiraditya Scindia will also hit the streets with you.” Asking the protesters to be a little patient, he added: “It has been a year for the government. Teachers have to be a little patient. Our turn will come, and if not, then I assure you that I will be your shield and sword.”

In Delhi, when mediapersons asked CM Nath about Scindia’s comment, he said: “The manifesto is for five years. It’s not for five months.”

Nath met AICC chief Sonia Gandhi in the evening. Agencies quoted him as saying: “I have met the party president and discussed how much the government in the state has been able to fulfil the Vachan Patra (manifesto).” CM Nath’s spokesperson in Pradesh Congress, Narendra Saluja said he spoke to the party president on organizational issues. “He also apprised her on the steps taken by his government for public welfare and promises made to people of Madhya Pradesh in Vachan Patra that have been fulfilled. He also delivered a report card of his government to the party president,” said Saluja.

Cooperatives and GAD minister Govind Singh urged Scindia “not to hit the road”. “Jyotiraditya Scindia is a state leader and there is no need for him to do so. I suggest Scindia should discuss the issue with the chief minister in view of the financial situation of the state,” he told mediapersons in Bhopal, adding that guest teachers were “not appointed to be made regular”. “It was a temporary post. They can be regularized only if they follow the rules,” he said.

Scindia has been touring parts of the state in the last 24 hours, addressing rallies organized by supporters. On Thursday, he had called the Delhi poll rout “very, very disappointing”, and suggested that Congress needs to “reinvent itself with new ideology”. After Scindia lost the 2019 Lok Sabha election from Guna, his supporters have been demanding that he be appointed PCC chief, a post that AICC has asked Nath to hold even after he became chief minister.

Public is god, can bring a neta to the ground: Scindia

Bhopal: Almost 10 months after he lost the Guna Lok Sabha seat, AICC general secretary Jyotiraditya Scindia expressed his feelings on his defeat. At a rally organized by his supporters in Ashoknagar, MP, on Friday, Scindia said “Janata (public) as the biggest god”. “The public can make a common man a leader, and bring a neta to the ground. I have this realization as I stand on the ground. I want to remain grounded, remain close to the roots, as well as to stay in your heart,” he said.

Title: An app to access Odisha budget from anywhere
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Representative image

BHUBANESWAR: The state finance department has developed a mobile app named ‘ Odisha Budget ’ with an aim to help people access budget documents in digital form from anywhere in the world.

Any individual can download the app in android or IOS system to access the documents soon after finance minister Niranjan Pujari tables the budget for 2020-21 financial year on Tuesday, said an official source. “All the documents like budget speech in English and Odia, annual financial statement, budget at a glance, explanatory memorandum, revenue receipts, demand for grants and people’s guide can be accessed by using the app. There will also be some graphic elements on budget, which can be accessed too,” said a senior finance department official. Earlier, people had to wait for some days to get the detail budget documents till it is uploaded on the finance department website. As a green initiative, the finance department had in 2019-20 financial year reduced printing of about 57 lakh pages of paper for budget documents, which translates into saving around 700 large trees. Physical printing of budget documents has been reduced further this year, said the official.

Only the budget speech of the finance minister and people’s guide will be printed while other budget documents will be provided in electronic form with the help of pen drive. Other documents related to budget will be distributed to various stakeholders in digital format. “From the next year onwards, we will switch over to complete paperless electronic budgeting system,” said the official. The issue was also mentioned by governor Ganeshi Lal during his address to the assembly on Friday. The finance department has also decided to provide iPad to each MLA to get the budget documents, which would have been uploaded on the gadget. “The MLAs, who are not comfortable using IPads, we will provide them physical documents. From next year onwards, they will be trained to access the documents in digital format,” said an official source.

Title: Raj failed to fulfil promises: Pulwama martyr’s kin
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Jaipur: Pulwama martyr Rohitash Lamba’s brother has claimed that the state government has still not fulfilled many of the promises made to the family a year back. The promises included naming a public place after the martyr’s name.

Lamba’s brother said that despite repeated reminders to the state government, nothing has been done. Coincidentally the martyr’s brother was blessed with a baby boy on Friday and was named Rohitash.

The martyr’s brother Jeetendra told TOI, “While the monetary compensation was given to us, the other promises including naming a public place in my brother’s and giving a government job to his next of kin are yet to be fulfilled. The ministers just came at the time of my brother’s death to get photographs clicked and despite reminders, the promises remain unfulfilled.”

The 27-year-old soldier was martyred when a suicide bomber in a vehicle loaded with explosives drove straight into a bus ferrying CRPF jawans in Pulwama on February 14, 2019. In this terrorist attack, 40 jawans were martyred. This included five jawans from Rajasthan. The families had been given Rs 50 lakh compensation by the state government.

“My brother’s loss still continues to affect the family and this was the reason when my son was born on Friday morning, we decided to name him Rohitash. This would always keep my brother’s memory alive. We just hope that the government fulfils its promises,” added Jeetendra.

Title: Kishan to take JBS-MGBS Metro
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Hyderabad: Minister of state for home affairs, G Kishan Reddy , will conduct a review meeting with officials of Hyderabad Metro on Saturday. Reddy, along with BJP state chief K Laxman, will take the Metro between JBS and MGBS stations.

BJP is unhappy over the launch of this Metro corridor while Parliament session was on as the Centre also has contributed to the project. Earlier, the minister vented ire at Metro officials for not maintaining protocol during the launch of the corridor.

Title: Disabled shown dead in docus, deprived of pension
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

yyyyyyyyyyyy

Uttarkashi: Ratan Singh’s Divyang Pension got stopped unexpectedly in 2016. Since then he had been complaining to different local authorities asking to restart Rs 1,000 per month pension but no one looked into the matter. After four years of inaction of local officials, Singh, a resident of Satudi village in Mori block of Uttarkashi district, visited the district collectorate office, but only to be shocked.

Singh (47) found out that he was declared dead in the official records in 2016 and subsequently, his pension had been stopped. Thereafter, he approached Uttarkashi district magistrate Ashish Chauhan, who later set up an inquiry to resolve the issue and ordered the concerned department to restart crediting the pension to his post office account.

Singh claimed that he was a recipient of the pension amount since 2005, when the scheme was launched, but credit of the amount to his account got stopped in 2016. He adds that a few weeks ago, officials at social welfare department office in Uttarkashi had also told him that he was “dead” as per official records but the information only got confirmed after he visited the collectorate office last Wednesday.

Meanwhile, district’s social welfare officer DD Arya told TOI, “According to our findings, the villager got regular pension till March 2018. We will credit the due pension amount in his account at the earliest and restart monthly payment. We will also investigate the issue and take required action to fix such loopholes.”

Title: After NGT order, govt closes down 292 mines in Chittorgarh
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Jaipur: Following National Green Tribunal's ( NGT ) order to close down 292 small mines falling within the municipal area of Chittorgarh , the state mining department has complied with the order and shut down the mines with immediate effect. The order was issued on February 12.

The state may also take legal opinion in the matter. In its order, the NGT stated, "In compliance of our earlier order the director geology and mines, government of Rajasthan and the additional director of the department are present in person. After hearing the submissions made by director geology and mines, we direct that the additional director to file a personal affidavit giving out full details and submit the same before the Tribunal within one week."

"However, as we have been informed that in compliance of our earlier order dated March 8, 2019, 77 mines, have been closed down but 292 mines falling within municipal area are still operating. Accordingly, we direct that remaining 292 mines falling within the municipal area, as per the report of Survey General of India, be also closed down forthwith. The compliance in this regard should be done and mentioned in

the affidavit which is to be filed by the additional director," it added.

The next date for hearing in the matter is February 28. Earlier, 77 mines were closed down by the state's mining department.

Title: Law College clash leaves several students injured
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kochi: Students Federation of India (SFI) and the Kerala Students Union (KSU) activists clashed on the Government Law College campus allegedly over Valentine’s Day celebrations on Friday afternoon. Several students sustained grievous injuries. The college will remain closed till February 24.

College principal T G Ajitha said that an internal inquiry committee has been constituted to look into the incident. “It was a minor argument, seemingly following Valentine’s Day celebrations, which was resolved following intervention of the faculty. A second clash broke out later on and it was over by the time faculty reached the spot,” said Ajitha.

Despite the ongoing valuation camp, classes were convened to help students. “Now, with this event, it would be better to remain closed till things settle down. Also, teachers are busy with the valuation camp, so the college will now reopen on February 24,” said the principal.

Ajitha said she visited the students who are admitted in hospital and some of them have sustained substantial injuries. Both student organizations approached central police and officers said cases would be registered against both sets of students. KSU activists have been accused of sabotaging a cultural programme organized by the SFI-led union in view of Valentine’s Day and an event to pay tributes to victims of the Pulwama terror attack of 2019. “KSU activists held a ‘eating competition’ when the union programme was going on. This led to an argument which got resolved soon. Later, non-student Youth Congress activists entered the campus and beat up union members,” an SFI activist alleged.

He said that a university union councillor suffered head injuries, the nature club secretary sustained a broken nose and arm and that three SFI activists are admitted in hospital.

K M Anas, district general secretary, KSU, said it was SFI activists who had gone on the rampage. “We had organized eating competition after the programme organized by SFI. They created the ruckus to vent their frustration over the failure of the programme. Five of our activists are in hospital with injuries,” he said.

Title: To recover dues, finance firm locks infant in house for 7hrs
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Jaipur: A nine-month-old infant girl was locked inside a house for nearly seven hours by the representatives of a private finance company before she was rescued at Kasya Ki Dhani hamlet under Roopangarh sub-division of Pushkar in Ajmer.

This ‘criminal act’ was brought to notice during Zero Hour by Suresh Rawat, BJP legislator from Pushkar, who also presented the infant as proof in the assembly on Friday.

The MLA claimed that the infant was rescued only after the intervention of district collector and demanded the government to lodge a case of murder attempt against the employees of the private finance company and local police. Addressing the media with the infant in his lap, Rawat said, “We are not against action by a finance company if instalment of any loan or dues are not paid. But, I have only drawn attention to the issue of an infant being locked inside her own house in presence of police and, that too, when her parents kept pleading with them.”

He claimed that the incident took place at 11am on Thursday and the girl was rescued after district collector’s intervention at 7.30pm in the evening.

“What is more shocking in this case is that the sealing of the house was also illegal as the family had already got a court stay in this regard,” he claimed.“I have demanded strict action so that in future nobody dares to repeat it,” he added.

In the evening parliamentary affairs minister Shanti Dhariwal assured the House that a senior police officer would investigate the matter. “She remained locked for three to four hours. We will get the matter investigated by a senior police officer,” he said.

Title: Group booked for V Day ruckus
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Hyderabad: On Valentine’s Day, a group of individuals, suspected to be from a right wing group, allegedly destroyed balloons and cards put up at an eatery in Gachibowli. The police registered a case of rioting and mischief against the group. In a widely circulated video, some youths were seen bursting balloons and shouting slogans, “ban Valentine’s Day”. tnn

Title: Elderly couple thrashed, robbed of valuables worth Rs 25L in Tonk
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Jaipur: An elderly couple was robbed of valuables worth approximately Rs 25 lakh in Tonk ’s Lambaharisingh area by unidentified men on Thursday night. The accused beat up the couple and tied them up before taking away the valuables. The gang of five is yet to be arrested.

“According to the complainants, Ratan Lal Aggarwal and Mohini, they own a medical store which is managed by their son. Around 8.30pm on Thursday, the couple who is their late 60s, was watching television when five masked men entered their house and beat up the couple. At the time, the victims were alone at home,” said Chittar Singh, SHO of Lambaharisingh police station.

After this, the accused tied the couple to chairs and while one of the robbers held a gun to the complainant’s head, another one held a knife to his wife’s throat.

The official further elaborated, “The accused threatened to kill the couple if they did not tell them where the valuables were kept in the house and the victims, fearing for their lives, told the accused about the safe and the jewellery. After this, the couple was locked up in a room while the unidentified accused ransacked the house.”

The robbers took Rs 1 lakh cash and other valuables. The couple was rescued when their son returned home around 10pm and when he did not see them, he started looking around the house and finally found them locked inside a room. The accused also took the mobile phone from the couple so they could not alert the police.

The robbers are yet to be found and the SHO said, “We are looking at CCTV camera footage and taking action to find the robbers at the earliest.” A case of robbery has been registered.

Title: COSCON set to take you to the cosmos of comics
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Illustration by Rammurti Nerlay

Nagpur: If you love the world of fantasy and imagination, then circle February 16 (Sunday) on your calendar as the third edition of Comic Otaku Superhero Convention ( COSCON ) in association with Pop Culture Hiroshima and Japan Foundation and Nagpur Anime Club is set to take flight from the Suresh Bhat auditorium in Reshimbagh at 11am.

Kids and adults alike will surely stay glued to their seats as talented performers from all over the country will descend on the city to entertain and enthrall lovers of comics, anime, gaming, music, art and cosplay. Books and movies will complete the creative list at this one-stop destination which aims to leave a lasting impression.

The fun-filled day will feature discussions with Sonal Kaushal (the voice of doremon, pikachu and bubbles from power puff girls), Megumu Ishiguro (production supervisor of Ramayana, the Legend of Prince Ram) and Vaibhav Lal (co-founder of Vkaao). There will also be a gaming tournament, geek quiz, Japanese karaoke, cosplaying and superhero performances. “There will be a cosplay competition in coordination with Pop Culture Hiroshima (PCH) in which the winner stands to win an all-expense paid for trip to Japan,” said Tanmay Atey, co-founder of Nagpur Anime Club.

The competition will decide the best kid, best male and best female cosplayers of the city. National and international cosplayers of repute will portray different characters.

Donald Khumlo is coming all the way from Meghalaya to present his favourite and popular anime character ‘Gilgamesh’. “I’m very excited and looking forward to donning the role of my favourite character. I’m also eager to watch the ones who will be portraying anime characters. I will be dressing up as Gilamesh and enacting his voice.” he said.

City’s Mukul Yadav is one of the competitors. He will be enacting ‘Obito’. “It is my favourite anime character. I will be performing with my partner,” said Yadav.

Siddhi Chaudhari from Mumbai will participate as a cosplay performer. “I will be playing the character of ‘Nana Shimora’. I have always been an anime fan and performing in Nagpur will be very exciting,” said Chaudhari.

This event intends to create awareness about anime, Japanese, comic and gaming culture.

Title: HC orders IAS officer to plant 100 trees
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Kochi: In an unusual order, a single bench of the high court on Friday ordered an IAS officer to plant 100 trees in a forest for not implementing its earlier order.

Industries department director K Biju was ordered to plant 100 trees by Justice Amit Rawal in a case where repeated orders issued by the HC were not implemented on a complaint that was filed over 20 years ago.

The court has asked the IAS officer to consult with the forest department to decide the place for planting the trees. The court has also ordered that disciplinary action should be taken against all the officials who had caused the delay on the complaint. After taking disciplinary action, report should be filed before the court, the judge ordered.

The order was issued in a petition filed by a small-scale industrial unit named SS Chemicals. Though the firm was initially granted exemption from sales tax, it was cancelled by the industries department in November 1999. The department had found the reason that the product being manufactured by the company is not included in the list of products eligible for exemption. Though the firm approached a state-level appellate committee against the decision, the appeal was dismissed. Following this, the company approached the high court.

After considering the plea, the high court quashed the order of the industries department declining exemption and asked it to reconsider the matter. When the decision by the industries department was again not favourable, the company approached the state-level appellate committee once again. While the appeal was pending, the company was asked to pay sales tax from 1996 to 2002. When the company approached the high court challenging this, government assured the court that the appeal before the state-level committee would be considered soon. The court directed for finalizing the appeal within two months and stayed the action to levy tax, while asking the company to furnish a security of Rs5 lakh.

When no decision came from the state-level appellate committee even after 10 years, the company approached the high court again. Citing RTI document, the company pointed out that no hearing on the appeal has been scheduled yet.

Considering the company’s petition, the court ordered the industries director to appear before it in person and issued the order for planting trees as punishment for the delay.

Title: Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra go on a double date on the occasion of Valentine's Day
Content: On Valentine's Day, several Bollywood celebs took to their respective social media accounts to share pictures with their loved ones.Now, Shilpa Shetty shared a picture from Valentine's Day celebration with her hubby Raj Kundra . The will be helmed by Sabbir Khan.Meanwhile, Shilpa has been active on small screen as a reality show judge. She was last seen on the big screen in a full-fledged role in the 2007 film 'Apne'.

Title: Orlando Bloom misspells son's name in new morse code tattoo
Content: Hollywood actor Orlando bloom has fallen victim to a tattoo fail that came to light after he posted a photo of his new ink on Instagram.According to a report, the out of the box tattoo on Bloom's forearm was supposed to spell the name of his son Flynn in the morse code, including date and time of birth.The caption of the picture said, "New #tattoo can you guess who?"Sadly enough, the 'Pirates of the Caribbean' actor got his son's name misspelled, as pointed out by a follower who commented, "If the Morse code is supposed to spell out Flynn then there is a mistake."The symbols instead spelled the letters F-R-Y-N-N due to a single missing dot.However, Bloom's tattoo artist took the gaffle like a true sport and publicly accepted his mistake on Instagram.He wrote: "A beautiful reminder for @orlandobloom of his son," wrote the artist in the caption. "And yes, a dot is missing, we know, it will be fixed :)"According to the tattoo, Flynn was born on January 6, 2011, at 9:03 AM to his ex-wife Miranda Kerr

Title: Plan to buy a flat? Check if your area falls in ‘black’ zone
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Next time you intend to purchase a new property and want to make it your permanent home, make sure you have gone through all the fact-checks properly. For, several banks have adopted a policy against sanctioning unsecured loans at some pin codes in the city and you might find your application for a new credit card or personal loan getting rejected.

K Raju, who bought a new flat in Madhurwada locality last year, was in for a shock when he tried to apply for a new credit card. “To my utter surprise, the private bank rejected my credit card application. I was told the bank can’t service the locality under my pin code,” the 39-year-old private sector employee said.

When TOI tried to apply for a personal loan and credit card on the website of a few private banks, it was found that the banks were reluctant to give loans or credit cards to a few specific pin codes. While applying online, the applicant needs to fill up his or her home address on the personal profile section. Once Visakhapatnam is typed in the specific ‘city’ column, the websites automatically generate the pin codes and the applicants need to select their area’s pin code from the scroll down button. However, the ‘unserviceable’ areas’ pin codes can’t be found in the list.

“Yes, banks often restrict unsecured loans depending on the locality where the applicant is residing. However, different banks have different restricted zones. We first check if the bank has any restrictions in the pin code area where our customer is residing before going ahead with the application,” said B Ganesh, owner of a DSA agency.

A senior official in the credit department of a private bank said ‘redlining’ of some areas exist in almost all Indian cities. “We redline only those areas where our credit realization is very poor. There are some neighbourhoods where our officials fear to enter. It’s difficult to track loan defaulters staying in those areas,” he explained.

Earlier, such system of rejection never used to come to light because bank officials never used to reveal the exact reason behind the rejection of loan applications. But with the increase in online applications, they are now bound to remove the restricted pin codes from the system to avoid ‘wastage’ of both time and money. “However, in some cases we give exemption if the applicant has a salary account with us, or if we have a corporate relationship with the employer, or if the applicant wants a loan against fixed deposits or other investments,” another private bank official revealed.

The legal fraternity, when asked for their reaction, said this is a new trend and very few bother to check this aspect when buying a new property. “But this is not a healthy trend. Normally, a home buyer checks the area and papers related to the property. Why should one check this aspect? As the city is expanding, many residential projects are coming up on the outskirts. Many people are buying properties in such complexes and staying there permanently. Such a policy by the banks is not right. You cannot judge an individual on the basis of his or her locality,” K Murlidhar, a senior advocate, opined.

Title: Simultaneous elections to GVMC, local bodies likely
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Visakhapatnam: If things go the way they seem, the state government may hold simultaneous elections for local bodies and GVMC (Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation). Moreover, the state cabinet decided to amend the Andhra Pradesh Panchayati Raj Act, the AP Municipal Act and the AP Municipal Corporations Act on February 12 to disqualify candidates indulging in electoral malpractices.

It is being projected that candidates will have a maximum of seven days to campaign and the entire election process will be completed once the notification is issued. The state government plans to get done with the elections by March 15. The hurry to finish of the local bodies’ polls is because of several reasons including examinations, new financial year and the budget sessions in the state assembly.

The GVMC has lost over Rs 300 crore in basic and performance grants under the 14th finance commission over the last three fiscals because it did not have an elected council. The Union government has made it clear that grants under the 14th finance commission cannot be released to civic bodies where there are no elected members.

No elections have been held in the GVMC since the term of the council ended in 2012. Further, four cases are pending in court on ward delimitation and merger of new villages among other issues. It is expected that the cases will be disposed over the next few days.

Speaking to TOI, GVMC commissioner G Srijana said that the civic body is largely ready for the elections with the exception of having finalised ward-wise reservations. “A notification pertaining to ward delimitation has already been published. The GVMC has also notified polling stations and published voter lists. It will take two to three days to finalise the reservations after receiving the official guidelines,” she said.

Speaking on the housing scheme for the poor and its implementation, the GVMC commissioner said that a total of 1.76 lakh beneficiaries have been found eligible for the scheme within the GVMC limits. “We received around 11,000 applications that are being screened during Spandana programme,” Srijana said.

Title: City one of the first to submit data for ‘Ease of Living’ index
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

GVMC chief G Srijana (right) releases poster for citizen perception survey

Visakhapatnam: Visakhapatnam is one of the first cities to complete the data uploading exercise for the ‘ Ease of Living ’ index and the municipal performance index, said GVMC commissioner G Srijana on Friday.

Speaking to the media, Srijana said that the Union ministry of housing and urban affairs had launched these two frameworks to assess quality of life of citizens in 100 smart cities and 14 other ‘million plus’ cities.

The GVMC commissioner further said that the citizen perception survey is a major component of the ease of living index which has 30 per cent weightage. Data provided by the civic body will have 70 per cent weightage, she informed. “We request residents to participate in the survey and submit their feedback,” the GVMC commissioner appealed.

According to Srijana, the survey seeks to get feedback from nearly 20,000 city residents about infrastructure, service delivery and quality of life. The online survey began on February 1 and will continue till February 29. The GVMC has collected responses from 4,000 people yet, informed Srijana.

Talking about the municipal performance index, she said that it seeks to assess the sector-wise performance of municipal bodies across five verticals. “While the ease of living index data assessment covers the entire city, including the private sector, data assessment under the municipal performance index will be largely limited to the civic body,” she said. The civic body chief said that GVMC and the Greater Visakhapatnam Smart City Corporation Limited have taken up various IEC activities and teams are visiting institutions to make different stakeholders a part of the survey. She further informed that Vizag smart city has been paired up with Diu smart city under by the Union ministry of housing and urban affairs under the Smart Cities Mission.

Title: MPCC appoints communication ministers
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Nagpur: The Maharashtra Pradesh Congress Committee (MPCC) on Wednesday declared names of its communication ministers for various districts, which included four ministers from Vidarbha.

As per the press communiqué, Nagpur district guardian minister Nitin Raut has been given charge of Akola and Washim districts. Chandrapur’s guardian minister Vijay Wadettiwar will look after Gadchiroli, Yavatmal and Raigad districts.

Women and child development minister Yashomati Thakur was given charge of Buldhana and Gondia districts while animal husbandry minister Sunil Kedar to take charge of Pune.

Minister of state Vishwajeet Kadam, who was earlier appointed guardian minister for Bhandara, was given charge of Sangli and Solapur.

MPCC chief Balasaheb Thorat, also the revenue minister, would look after Ahmednagar and Nashik. PWD minister Ashok Chavan was handed over charge of Parbhani, Beed and Jalna districts.

Latur’s guardian minister Amit Deshmukh was told to look after Aurangabad and Osmanabad, while school education minister Varsha Gaikwad was allotted Mumbai suburban region.

Tribal development minister KC Padvi was asked to look after Dhule, Jalgaon and Palghar, and minister of state Satej Patil was assigned charge of Satara, Sindhudurg and Ratnagiri districts. Textile minister Aslam Sheikh was appointed for Thane.

Title: City’s cure rate for childhood cancer is abysmally low
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Visakhapatnam: As cost treatment remains high and inaccessible to a major portion of the population, the cure rate for childhood cancer is abysmally low in Visakhapatnam.

In the developed world, the cure rate for common childhood cancers like lymphoma and leukaemia is over 80%. But in India, the cure rate is only 30%. City doctors said that the figure is around the same percentage in the city.

Speaking to TOI, Dr Nirmalya Deo Pradhan, paediatric oncologist at Homi Bhaba Cancer Hospital and Research Centre (HBCH & RC) said, “A majority of childhood cancer cases are diagnosed between the age group of 5-14 years at fairly advanced stages. These cancers are completely curable if diagnosed early and treated timely.”

Doctors feel that in order to reduce the number of mortalities in child cancer cases, diagnosis and treatment services need to be more accessible to families from all sections of society.

Currently, a number of the major cancer hospitals or those with requisite infrastructure are concentrated in big urban centres. Families who have a child suffering from cancer need to travel long distances to access treatment. This compounds the distress and anxiety, aver doctors.

“90% of the children with cancer get free treatment at HBCH & RC with the help of funds provided by the Union ministry of health and family welfare,” added Pradhan.

One other problem with regard to childhood cancer is that a child coping with cancer needs physical, mental and emotional support. Simply putting them on treatment is not enough.

Cancer treatment is often very long drawn out painful with children suffering from a number of side-effects. Efforts therefore have to be made to minimise pain. “Actually, in most cases, children with cancer do not require any kind of isolation from the family. The child can live a normal life,” Dr Pradhan added.

February 15 is International Childhood Cancer Day. The day is being celebrated all over the world to help create awareness about childhood cancer. “Together we can achieve the vision that ‘no child should die of cancer — cure for more and care for all’,” said Dr D Raghunatha Rao, director of HBCH & RC.

Title: Greta and I fighting the same fight, says city girl
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

15-year-old climate activist Deepsri Peela outside the GVMC office on Friday

Visakhapatnam: Twelve weeks ago, 15-year-old Deepsri Peela from Visakhapatnam took to the streets in a call for action on the climate crisis. Every Friday since, the climate activist has attempted to draw attention to the issue by sloganeering and carrying placards, in an answer to the ‘School strike for climate’ movement started by Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg .

“I knew about the school strikes from the day Greta Thunberg started striking in Sweden. I knew that sometime in the year, I’d join strikers on this side of the world. Greta is an inspiration, but I am me. We are two different people fighting for the same cause,” said the climate activist.

When asked about the threat that global warming poses, Deepsri said, “The crisis is causing ecological breakdown and disturbances in wildlife. An ecological imbalance due to this rapid species extinction and endangerment is breaking our ecosystem. Animals that were once abundant and forests with which we lived in harmony are vanishing as we are ‘expanding’ our civilisation.”

Desertification, Deepsri said, has led to the extinction of the Indian cheetah, pink-headed duck and the Great Indian Bustard, but “how much do we, sitting in our air-conditioned rooms care about some species going extinct? Extinction means the wiping out of a species forever. It is the ultimate end and it hurts me that these beautiful animals are gone.”

India must take the lead in Asia to do this because India has taken the lead several times. We are a nation that is built on science. It will be an insult if we oppose the same science,” Deepsri said.

“Only when we first declare the crisis as such can we truly move forward and I would like Visakhapatnam to declare the climate crisis as one,” Deepsri said, adding that 1,034 jurisdictions in 19 countries have already declared a climate emergency. “I started to protest because it is the one thing I can do for my future self and to tell my children that on my part, I tried to combat the crisis,” she said.

While there are solutions to tackle climate change, an individual contribution can start with moving towards a plant-based food system that would conserve water, combat desertification and habitat loss, Deepsri said.

But even as Deepsri’s posts on social media gain visibility, there has been little action on the ground. On the official response to her campaign, she said the GVMC is aware while there is growing awareness among other sections. “The only support I wish for should come in the form of action, not appreciation. Until now, I’d received none. It’s not for myself that I’m doing this,” Deepsri said.

Title: CBSE issues guidelines for board exams
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Central Board of Secondary Education ( CBSE ) has prepared detailed guidelines for the conduct of Class X and Class XII examinations across India and elsewhere. Examinations for Class X will be held between February 15 and March 20 while Class XII examinations will be held between February 15 and March 30.

The Board has issued information and guidelines to various stakeholders, including local administration, city coordinators, custodians, centre superintendents and observers. A webcast was also recently launched to ensure instructions were conveyed to city coordinators, invigilators and students.

Exemptions have also been made for special candidates and children with special needs (CWSN), in accordance with the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016. In addition to extra time, a scribe/reader and computer/laptop (without an internet connection) will be provided.

All candidates already registered under the CWSN category will also be allowed to use a simple basic calculator from this year.

The Board has also put in place special arrangements for students with benchmark disabilities. The total number of candidates under the CWSN category in India—including visually impaired, dyslexic, muscular dystrophy, spastic, locomotor impairment, dwarfism and others under the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act—are 6,844 in Class X and 3,718 in Class XII.

Title: Power consumption soars ahead of summer
Content:
This story is from February 15, 2020

Visakhapatnam: With a rise in temperature levels in the city, electricity consumption under Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation (GVMC) limits has gone up by nearly 4.5 million of units (MUs) between February 9 and 14.

The city recorded a temperature of 31°C on Friday, as against temperatures below 30°C on the last few days.

A senior official of the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said, “Now onwards, temperature levels will go up beyond 30°C in the city. In fact, summer will officially begin on March 1, but conditions of summer have already arrived in the cty.”

Officials at the Andhra Pradesh Eastern Power Distribution Company Limited (APEPDCL) said the discom registered electricity consumption of 64.35 MU on Friday, up from 60.82 MU on February 9.

“In five days, electricity consumption increased by nearly 4.5 million units. This indicates that people have already started to feel discomfort with the change in temperature,” said a senior APEPDCL official to TOI.

The discom registered 21 MU of power consumption for Visakhapatnam district on Friday, up from 19 MU on February 9.

Meanwhile, GVMC officials have started to prepare a summer action plan. “This year, we are planning to sort out water supply problems and provide thatched hats at select centres. This is still at the planning stage,” said an official with the civic body.

Officials at the education department have also cautioned students appearing for examinations to take precautionary measures.
